E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	And let its concavity be similar to that of a knife blade.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	Then carefully place the tip of the cautery into the cracks until it reaches the root of the cracks.
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	And then care for the area with wax until it heals. [translated by SummarizeBot]
Capitol .xix.	Chapter 19.
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	On cauterization of a fistula in the mouth. [translated by SummarizeBot] [!translatorstop!] Chapter 19: Cauterization for Fistula in the Mouth
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When an abscess forms in the tonsil region or in the palate or gums and it becomes swollen, bursts, becomes old, develops pus, and turns into a fistula, and you treat it but it does not improve, then it is necessary to cauterize the fistula according to its size. Heat up a cautery and place it in the opening of the fistula, holding it with your hand until the heated iron reaches the root of the fistula. Do this once or twice, and then care for the area as we have previously discussed until it heals.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	If the pus has been drained and the wound is healed, then that is good. But if not, then it is necessary to uncover the area and remove any decayed bone as appropriate in its chapter.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter 20. [translated by SummarizeBot] [!translatorstop!] Here's a translation of the provided text:
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	Of cauterization of the teeth and softening of the gums.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the gums are softened by moisture and the teeth are rotten, and you have treated them with medicines and seen no improvement, then place the patient's head in your lap, and bring the hot cautery close to their mouth, so that you quickly place the tip of it on the affected tooth, and keep your hand slightly inside the patient's mouth so they feel the heat of the fire as it reaches the root of the tooth.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	Then remove your hand, and bring the cautery back several times as needed, according to your desire.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	Then have the patient fill their mouth with salt water and keep it there for an hour, and then spit it out, because the rotten tooth is now firm, the softened gum is strengthened, and the corrupt moisture is dried up.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter 21.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	Of cauterization for toothache.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When toothache is due to coldness or a worm in it, and you have not found improvement with medicine, then cauterize the tooth in two ways: either with an ox's eye cautery or with fire.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	Cauterization with an ox's eye is done by taking an ox's eye and placing it in a holder of iron, then taking a piece of cloth and wrapping it around the end of the eye, and then dipping the wrapped end in boiling water, and quickly placing it on the painful tooth until it becomes hot.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And then repeat this several times until the heat of the fire reaches the root of the teeth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	And if you wish, dip a piece of wool or cloth in the boiling water and place it over the painful tooth, and then place the red-hot iron over it until the iron reaches the bottom of the cavity of the tooth.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	However, cauterization with fire is done by using an iron or steel probe that has a small tip and there is some roughness on it, and the intensity of the fire does not reach the patient's mouth.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	Then heat the cautery and bring it close to the tooth, and place it on the tooth with your hand until the cautery becomes hot; do this several times, because the pain will be reduced either on that day or the following day.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And it is necessary that, due to the heat of the cautery, the patient fills their mouth with good broth and keeps it there for an hour and then spits it out; this is the method of cauterization.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	And cauterize whichever part you can, according to your ability.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	This is the form of the cannula:
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter 22.
De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	Of cauterization for hernia.
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When hernias are due to phlegm and cold humors and are not responsive to gentle digestion through medicine, and you wish to gently digest them, then heat the concave cautery with two sharp ends so that smoke comes out of both ends, and place the hot cautery on the swelling once, and another time if necessary, until it reaches the core of the abscess.
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit.	And if the abscess is small, then cauterize it according to its size, and leave it for three days and place a piece of cloth soaked in boiled water over it until it has healed from the burn caused by the fire.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent e tentas e draps entro que sia sanat.	And then treat it with ointment, bandages, and cloths until it is healed.

De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	Of cauterization for hoarseness of voice and constriction of the throat. [I will wait for you to provide the text for this chapter, so I can translate it for you.][\table]{|c|}

When humors gather in the throat, especially when it is accompanied by chilliness of complexion, then it is necessary that the patient be evacuated at the beginning with laxative medicines, and then cauterize the root of the tonsils in the sunken area of the throat.

Capitol .xxiiii.	Chapter XXIV.
De cauterizacio de malautia del pulmo e de tos.	Chapter XXIV: On Cauterization for Lung Disease and Cough.
Quan tos e malautia de pulmo so de humiditatz fregas e le malaute no ha febre ni tisic e es malautia antiqua, lahoras cauterisa aquel am dos cauteris sobre la furcula en les locz depremegutz leontz e buoytz; e am autra cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz entre dos mamillos; e sia le cauteri clavilh segon la forma precedent.	When cough and lung disease are due to cold humors, the patient does not have a fever or consumption, and it is an old illness, then cauterize with two cauteries on the Adam's apple in the sunken areas of the throat and chest; and with another cautery in the middle of the breast between the nipples. Let the cauteries be hook-shaped according to the previous description.
E si vols, sia la tua cauterizacio punctan am le cauteri que es apelat puncta, la forma del qual precedeys en la ponctacio de dolor de aurelhas.	And if you wish, let your cauterization be punctate with the cautery called "puncta," which is described in the treatment for ear pain.
E sian puntz entro cays ad aquels; e aprop cura aquel am aquo meteys que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	And let there be holes in it, according to your judgment, and then treat it with what has been mentioned before until it is healed.
E ya sia le cauteri haventz tres ramps quar cauterizacio es am aquel: am una veguada podes far tres cauteris segon aquesta forma:	And let the cauteries have three prongs so that cauterization can be done with it in this way: with one application, you can perform three cauterizations according to this form.

If the head tends to become dislocated again easily, as we have observed, then you must take the following steps:

And apply cautery to the coccyx, so that it penetrates that area and creates the shape of the cauterization; then, the figure of the cauterization will come out in the form of four heated cauters.

And if the dislocation is in the upper parts and occurs late, then cauterize above the muscle with a spike-like or pointed cautery tool, because the joint will be strengthened, moisture (or inflammation) will be reduced, and the patient will recover.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter 26.
De cauterizacio del stomac.	On the Cauterization of the Stomach.
Quan veno en l’estomac freg e motas humiditatz entro que aquel extrazo de la sua compleccio e so multiplicatz raumases a lu, e si tu continuas las manieyras de curacio e no confereyso, lahoras cove que le malaute sia sobre le sieu dos ressupinat, e extenda las suas mas e las suas coysas, e aprop cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris: an un cauteri dejos le pietz per la quantitat d’un dit am cauteri clavilh, e am dos cauteris dejos del dos costatz del cauteri, entro que vengua la figura de cauteri triangulada; e elonga entre els que no sian ajustatz que faran poyredura.	When there is cold and excessive moisture in the stomach that disturbs its natural state, leading to various symptoms, and if you continue with incorrect treatments without improvement, then it is necessary to have the patient lie down on their back, stretch out their limbs, and cauterize the area with three cauteries: one below the chest for the length of a finger, using a spike-like cautery; and two more below each side of the previous cautery, forming a triangular shape. Make sure that these are not too close together to avoid causing further harm.
E si la profunditat del cauteri la quantitat de les dos terses de la grocesa de la codena.	And if the depth of the cautery is two-thirds the thickness of the coccyx:
E sia la figura del cauteri segon aquesta forma ses addicio, E si vols, cauteriza am gran cauteri en le mieg loc del estomac segon aquesta forma; et aquest sia un cauteri segon la forma de cercle segon aquesta forma:	And the shape of the cautery should be as shown here. If you wish, use a large-sized cautery in the middle of the stomach according to this form; and this one should be circular in shape, like this:
E sia cauterizat l’estomac punctan ad aquel que de aquest cauteri es spaventat: e es que tu senhes sobre l’estomac punt segon la quantitat que voles am tenta, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en les puntz; e aprop cura aquel am la curacio qu’es precedita entro que sia sanat.	And the stomach should be cauterized with small points for those who are afraid of the cautery: that is, place the cautery on the stomach according to the amount you wish to incise and then cauterize at the points; then treat the area with the appropriate preliminary treatment until it heals.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter 27.
De cauterizacio del fietge fret.	On the Cauterization of a Cold Liver.
Quan endeve en le fietge dolor per fregiditat o per humiditat o per grossa ventositat entro que de la sieua normal compleccio sia getat per egressio superflua, e es curat le malaute am aquo que havem dit e no comfereys, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e senhes am tenta tres cauteris segon aquesta forma et aquesta quantitat meteyssa sobre le fietge dejos dels ipocondres, la hon perve le decubit de home.	When pain arises in the liver due to coldness or moisture or excessive gas, leading to deviation from its normal state by means of superfluous egression, and if the patient does not improve with the treatments mentioned above, then it is necessary for the patient to lie on their back with their head raised and receive cauterization with three cauteries according to this form and quantity below the liver, under the hypochondriac region (where a man's body bends at the waist).
E sia l’espazi le qual es entre quascun cauteri segon la grossetut del dit, e sia le cauteri segon la longitut del cors dreyta.	And let the spaces between each cautery be according to the thickness of a finger, and let the cauteries be according to the length of the straight body part (presumably referring to fingers or digits).
E no compremas la tua am le cauteri mot.	And do not burn excessively with the cautery.
E si la quantitat de aquo que es adhurit la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena, e no y sia pus ajustat; e si le malaute stant sobre les pes de lu; e si no es estant, lahoras sia jassent, le qual ja ha extendudas las suas coysas, e eleve les sieus brasses.	And if the amount of cauterization is equal to the size of a lentil seed and no more, and it should not be larger; and if the patient is standing on their feet, but if not, then let them lie down and extend their limbs, raising their arms above their head.
E es aquesta la forma del cauteri:	And this is the shape of the cautery:
E a tu es possible que cauterizes aquestz cauteris am cauteri cutellar, quan es am tu subtilitat e prudencia en l’art.	And it is possible for you to cauterize these cauteries with a scalpel-like cautery, if you have the skill and prudence in the art.
E guarda te que trop no procesiscas en la cauterizacio, e sia adhurida la specitut de tota la codena per que sia adhurit tot le cors e pervengua entro als budels, quar la codena aqui es subtil; e sapias aquo.	And be careful not to overdo it in the cauterization, and let the surface of the entire coccyx be cauterized so that the whole body is affected and reaches the intestines, since the coccyx is delicate; and know this.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter 28.
De perforacio de apostema del fietge am cauteri.	On the Perforation of a Liver Abscess with Cautery.
Quan endeve excitura o apostema en le fietge e voles saber si aquel apostema es en le carn del fietge o en la tunica de lu, lahoras si es en la carn del fietge, le malaute atrobo gravitat e dolor ses acuitat.	When there is an abscess or swelling in the liver and you want to know whether it is in the liver tissue itself or in its membrane, then if it is in the liver tissue, the patient will experience heaviness and severe pain without inflammation.
E si es en la tunica del fietge, am la dolor es acuitat gran e vezes que ja afatiguatz les metges la cura de lu.	And if it is in the membrane of the liver, with inflammation and pain being intense and often causing weariness for doctors treating it.
Donc cove que·l malaute sia enversat sobre la sieua cervit; e aprop senha le loc de l’apostema am tenta; e aprop igneys le cauteri le quel es asemblat a rag, la forma del qual a precedit en l’autra pagina.	Therefore, it is necessary for the patient to be positioned on their back; and then locate the site of the abscess with an incision; and then heat the cautery that has a shape similar to a spike, as shown in the previous page.
E cauteriza am aquel i cauteri entro que tota la codena sia comborida, entro que pervengua al ciphac, entro qu’en yesca sania.	And cauterize with that spike-shaped cautery until the entire coccyx is pressed down and it reaches the cypiac (likely a typo or variant of "cypraium," referring to an area near the kidneys), until pus is produced.
E aprop cura aquel per curacio dels autres apostemas entro que sia sanat.	And then cure that one once other abscesses are healed.
E no cove que de aquesta forma de cauteri use sino aquel del qual le estudi en l’art de medicina es prolonguat, e en las mas del qual motas malautias an conogut; mays aquest am esperiment alcunas veguadas sia ardit sobre aquesta operacio, mays empero leyssa aquela deves nos, e es miels.	And it is not necessary to use cautery in this way unless one has extensively studied medicine and recognized many illnesses through it; but let this person be cautious with this operation, attempting it several times, but it is better to leave it to us (doctors).
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter 29.
De cauterizacio de plauresi.	On the cauterization of ulcers.
Diyssero les antics cauteri de las razitz de aristologia a plauresi frega segon aquesta manieyra esser fazedor, e es aquest que tu prenguas de las razitz de aristologia longa secca una razit pun longua que es trobada, e sia de la grossetut del dit.	The ancients used to cauterize ulcers with the points of surgical instruments in this manner: take a long, thin needle from among the points of surgery that can be found, and make sure it is about the thickness of your finger.
E aprop submergeys aquela en oli e eysen aquela al foc, e aprop cauteriza per un cauteri en aquel loc le qual es entre la continuacio de la furcula am le col; e am dos cauteris petitz dejos guidazi, un pauc declinans a la partida que es dejus la barba, e am dos cauteris en aquo que es declinant entre la quinta costa e la cizena, declinant un pauc a las partidas detras; e am autre cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz; et am autre sobre l’estomac, et am tres cauteris de las partidas detras; et am un cauteri en aquel loc le qual es entre las dos spallas, e am dos cauteris dels dos latz del pietz, dejos le cauteri le qual es entre doas spallas.	Then submerge that needle in oil and heat it in the fire until it becomes a cautery point, and then cauterize in this location which is between the continuation of the collarbone with the neck; and with two small cauteries, make incisions just below the jawline, slightly declining towards the area below the beard. And with two cauteries, make incisions in the area that is declining between the fifth rib and the spine, declining slightly toward the back. And with another cautery, make an incision in the middle of the chest; and with three cauteries, make incisions in the areas towards the back. And with one cautery, make an incision in the area between the two shoulders, and with two cauteries in the two sides of the hips, below the cautery between the two shoulders.
E no cove que compremas la tua ma am le cauteri, ans sia en le manifest de la codena en obra.	And it is not necessary to press your hand with the cautery, but instead work on the skin directly.
E ja diyssero alscus antics que so alscus dels homes les quals uson de cauteri de ferr semblant a ray e igneysso aquel, e meto aquel en aquel loc le qual es entre las costas, entro que pervenguam am aquel ad aquel apostema e sia foragetada sania, ayssi cum havem dit en l’apostema del fietge.	And some ancients among humans used a cautery made of iron resembling a ray and applied that to the affected area between the ribs until it reached the abscess and expelled pus, just as we mentioned in the case of an abdominal abscess.
Mays en aquesta perforacio am cauteri no es ses temor, quar hu mor tantost ho accideys en le loc fistula a la qual no es sanacio.	But in this perforation with a cautery, there is danger, because one may die immediately if the procedure is done on a location where there is a fistula that cannot be healed.
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter 30.
De la cauterizacio de la melsa.	On the Cautery of the Spleen.
Quan tu curas la malautia de la melsa am aquo que havem dit de la curacio en la divisio e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cauteri en lu es segon tres manieras, las quals totas son dreyturieras, de las quals la una es que fassas tres cauteris o quatre linhan segon la longitut de la melsa segon la figura dels cauteris del fietge, la figura dels quals ha precedit.	When you treat the illness of the spleen with what we have said about treatment in division and do not compare your treatment, then you should cauterize it in three ways, all of which are correct. The first way is to make three or four incisions along the length of the spleen according to the shape of the liver's cauteries, the shape of which has been previously described.
E sia entre quascun cauteri la grossetut d’un dit o un pauc mes, e la manieyra del cauteri sia la manieyra la qual havem dita en le cauteri del fietge engualment.	And let there be a width of one finger or slightly more between each cautery, and the method of cauterization should be the same as what we described in the liver cautery.
E no compremas la tua ma am le cauteri; e le malaute sia eves sobre lo sieu dos.	And do not press your hand with the cautery; and let the patient be placed on their back.
E es autra manieyra de cauterizar, so es que tu igniscas le cauteri haventz dos vertimentz, la qual causa havem dita en le capitol de dislocacio del muscle, e elava la codena la qual es en le endreyt de la melsa la hon perve le jazer del malaute sinistre.	And there is another way to cauterize, which is to heat the cautery with two turns, causing what we have mentioned in the chapter on muscle dislocation, and raise the left side of the diaphragm that is over the spleen where the patient lies down.
E sia la tua elevacio am la qual elevas la codena segon la longuesa del cors, per que sian faytz cauteris segon la latitut del cos.	And let your elevation be according to the length of the body, so that incisions can be made in accordance with the width of the body.
E aprop entromet les dos vernimentz, ignitz mot, en aquel entro que am aquels penetres la codena de la autra part.	And then insert the two turns, light them slightly, in the area where you have penetrated the diaphragm from the other side.
E aprop extrayt le cauteri; e donc son faytz quatre cauteris.	And then extract the cautery; and so four incisions have been made.
E si voys, cauteriza am cauteri havent tres vernimentz.	And if you wish, cauterize with a cautery having three turns.
E aprop tu cura le cauteri pus que aia laysat de getar brac per trops jorns, quar mays es comferent que las autras causas precedentz en la curacio.	And you should cure the cautery because it has been left to throw off pus for too many days, because it is more beneficial than the previous causes in healing.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter 31.
De cauterizacio de ydropici.	On the Cautery of Hydropsy.
Cauteri no catz en ydropici sino en alcinte3 propriament.	Cauterization should not be used in cases of hydropsy generally, but only in specific instances.
Quan tu curas le ydropic am las manieyras de curacio las quals havem ditas en la divisio e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que aquel cauterizes am quatre cauteris en le cercuit del embelic e am un cauteri sobre l’estomac, e am autre cauteri sobre le fietge, e am autre cauteri sobre la melsa, e am dos cauteris entre les spondils del dos, e un cauteri en lo dreyt del pietz, e am autre cauteri sobre l’estomac.	When you treat hydropsy with the methods of treatment we have mentioned in division and do not compare your treatment, then it is necessary to cauterize in four places around the navel, and one on the stomach, and another on the liver, and another on the spleen, and two between the vertebrae of the back, and one on the right side of the hip, and another on the stomach.
E la quantitat de la profunditat del cauteri sia propdana a la spicitut de la codena.	And let the depth of the cauterization be proportional to the thickness of the diaphragm.
E aprop layssa le cauteri ubert per so que gete brac per lonc temps.	And let the cautery remain open for some time to allow it to release pus.
E no evacuas le malaute de curacio aprop le cauteri am aquo que cove per que sian agreguadas a lu doas entencios, e sira festinada a lu am ajutori sanacio.	And do not immediately remove the patient from treatment after cauterization, because it is necessary to add two intentions so that healing may be accelerated with assistance.
La forma del cauteri am lo qual es cauterizat lo ventre sia clavilh segon que la forma de aquel es desus precedent, e es aquel am le qual es cauterizat le dos sia olivar segon qu’es precedent a la sua forma.	The shape of the cautery used for the abdomen should be like a nail, similar to what was described earlier, and the shape of the cautery used for the back should be like an olive, as was previously described in its form.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter 32.
De cauterizacio de pes e de las coyssas.	On the Cautery of Feet and Thighs.
Quan les pes so apostematz en ydropitz e so repletz de aygua sitrina, cove que cauterisas les pes sobre le dos del pe in nocrati aquo que es entre le auricular e le anular, e eleva la tua ma am le cauteri e no torses aquel; e aprop eleva la tua ma, e no retornes aquela de tot, quar l’aygua satrina rezuda.	When the feet become swollen with abscesses in hydropsy and are filled with serous water, it is necessary to cauterize the feet on the back of the foot near the area between the auricular (outer) and anular (middle) bones. Lift your hand with the cautery without twisting it; then lift your hand, but do not return it completely, as the serous water will drain out.
Es le cauteri segon aquesta forma: E aprop fay sobre las doas coyssas dos cauteris, e en quascuna coysa sia feyt cauteri am la extremitat del cauteri cutellar.	The cautery should be in this form: And then make two incisions on the two thighs with a cautery tool, and on each thigh, make an incision with the tip of the knife-shaped cautery tool.
E sia le cauteri segon la longitut de la coyssa: i dejos le denolh e l’autre jos le mieg loc de la coyssa; e sobre quascuna coyssa dos cauteris.	And let the cautery be in length to match the thigh, and make one incision below the kneecap and another below the middle of the thigh, and on each thigh, two incisions with the cautery tool.
E layssa la plagua uberta ses curacio per lonc temps per so que alcuna aygua resuda de lu.	And let the wound remain open for a long time without treatment to allow some serous water to drain from it.
E aprop cura le am aquelas causas las quals havem ditas.	And treat it with those causes we mentioned earlier.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter 33.
De cauterizacio de cos de ventre.	On the Cautery of the Belly.
Quan cos de ventre es per freg e per humiditat entro que debelice las vertutz, so es la vertut digestiva e retentiva, las quals so en l’estomac e en les budels, e es curat aquo am las manieyras de curacio e no confereys, e vezes le malaute suffertan cauteri de vertut exhiberant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am gran cauteri sobre le sieu stomac segon que a precedit en la cauterizacio del estomac, am le cauteri del cercle e am quatre cauteris en le cercuit del embelic subtils, am cauteri clavilh subtil; e am cauteri sobre le alcatin sobre alozis gran, o am dos cauteris.	When the belly becomes weak and damp due to an excess of cold humors that weaken the digestive and retentive functions in the stomach and intestines, then treat it with the methods described earlier, comparing them carefully. And sometimes the patient may be able to tolerate a cautery tool that expels heat, so in this case, use a large cautery tool on the patient's stomach as previously described for treating the stomach, along with a circular cautery and four subtle incisions around the navel, using a thin nail-shaped cautery. Then apply a large cautery tool to the bladder area, or two smaller ones if necessary.
E si vezes las humiditatz exhuberants e le malaute aquo tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre le pentenilh e sobre les budels, e fort leu ajustant dos cauteris sobre l’estomac e prop dels inguonas, quar es curacio perficent de juvament de la qual no erras.	And sometimes when the humors are excessive and the patient can tolerate it, then cauterize the area over the penis and on the intestines, and lightly apply two incisions with a small cautery tool to the stomach and near the inguinal areas, as this is a perfect cure that will not cause harm.
Capitol .xxxiv.	Chapter 34.
De cauterizacio de emorroydas antiquas.	On the Cautery of Old Hemorrhoids.
Quan so en la natura derier emorroydas antiquas o una de humors grossas fregas o de humiditatz corrompudas, e son curadas am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no confereys la tieua curacio, lahoras cauterisa am tres cauteris sobre le pus dejos spondilh del dos petit e petit triangular, e am cauteri desus le ombelic cays per dos ditz.	When hemorrhoids are caused by cold and thick humors or corrupt moisture in the body's lower part, and have been treated with the methods we described earlier without success, then use three small triangular cautery tools on the pus below the little vertebrae of the lower back, and one small circular cautery tool above the navel.
E si doptas que l’estomac de lu sia enfregidat e la vianda de lu no sia degerida, e la cara de lu vezes apostemada, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre l’estomac am gran cauteri segon que es precedit; e am un cauteri sobre fietge, e am autre cauteri sobre la melsa de lu am cauteri clavilh, e leyssa le cauteri per alcun temps ubert, e aprop cura lu entro que sia sanat.	And if you suspect that the stomach is cold and the food is not being digested properly, and the face appears swollen or abscessed, then use a large cautery tool on the stomach as described earlier; and apply one small circular cautery tool to the liver, another to the spleen using the nail-shaped cautery tool, and leave the cauterization open for some time before closing it up.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter 35.
De cauterizacio de atheyl aprop la abscizio de lor.	Of cauterization of abscess, it is appropriate for its drainage.
Quan tu abscindes atheyl, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri que es asemblat a ray.	When you lance an abscess, then apply the cautery which is similar to a spear (or a sharp point).
Aprop entremet aquel ignit en aquel atheyl abscis, e ultima la tieua ma entro que pervengua le cauteri al orifici de la vena de la qual ve la sanc.	Then insert the fire (or heat) of the cautery into that opened abscess, and slowly move your hand inward until it reaches the opening of the vein from which the blood flows.[translation might not be perfect as some words could have multiple meanings in this context]
E fay aquo una vetz o doas, quar si achieyl son trops, lahoras cauteriza quascun de lor segon que havem recontat, e aprop cura aquels am aquo que confereys a lor dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And do this once or twice, because if there are many openings, then cauterize each one of them as we have mentioned, and then treat those with ointments that promote healing until they are healed.
E si cauterizas am gran cauteri sobre alquatin, es mays derier en juvament.	And if you cauterize with a large cautery on something, it is more beneficial (or helpful).
Capitol .xxxvi.	Chapter thirty-six.
De cauterizacio de fistolas que son faytas en la natura derie en las partidas de lu.	Of cauterization of fistulas that are formed in the nature behind the parts (or organs) of it.
Quan la natura no obeziys a la obra la qual havem recomtada en son loc, e·l pacient es espaventat per aquo, sia sanat am cauteri.	When nature does not comply with the task that we have recommended in its place, and the patient is afraid of it, then cure it with cauterization.
Donc quan ad alcun ve fistola en la natura derier, e es antiquada, corro sania de lu e humiditatz corrompudas, e donc aquo que es pus digne que cove es que proes aquela am tenta subtil, e aprop conoys la quantitat de la profunditat de lu am la devant dita tenta.	Therefore, when one sees a fistula in the nature behind (or posterior), and it is old, with pus and rotten moisture inside it, then it is more worthy and appropriate to probe that area subtly, and carefully measure the depth of it as mentioned before.
Aprop igneys le cauteri que es semblant a ray.	Then apply the cautery which is similar to a spear (or a sharp point).
E aprop met aquel cauteri ignit en aquesta fistula, e segon la quantitat en la qual intrec la tenta.	And then insert the heated cautery into that fistula, in accordance with the depth that was measured by probing.
E itera sobre aquela le cauteri entro que sian comburitz aquels cors corrumputz tost una veguada o dos o tres, segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	And move the cautery over that area repeatedly until the rotten flesh is burnt one time or two or three, depending on how much is necessary.
E guarda te de combustio de nervi e de vena; o si fistula va al cors de la vesica o al cors del budel, lahoras guarda te de totz aquels locz; e no fassas aquo sino quan la fistula es en loc carnos e cogitas que no es penetrant.	And be careful not to burn the nerves or veins; and if the fistula reaches towards the bladder or bowel, then be even more cautious of all those areas, do it only when the fistula is in a fleshy area and you think it will not penetrate deeper.
E aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat.	And then treat the area until it heals.
E si le loc es sigillat, e so abscindidas de lu las materias, e roman ayssi per lonc temps, lahoras sapias que ja es curat entierament.	And if the wound is sealed, and the pus has drained from it and remains closed for a long time, then know that it is completely healed.
E si las materias no so de lu ostadas, lahoras sapias que es penetrant o en le preon de lu os corromput, o cays aquo de aquelas causas de las quals vindra rememoracio en son loc.	And if the pus is not drained from it, then know that it is penetrating deeper or there is infected bone inside, or this may be due to some other cause which will be mentioned in its appropriate place.
Capitol .xxxvii.	Chapter thirty-seven.

Capitol .xl.	Chapter forty.
De cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua.	Of cauterization of ankle dislocation.
Quan humiditatz moucozas so efundudas a la partida de la anqua, e so faytas causas del yssiment del sieu loc, e senhal de lu es que la coyssa es prolonguada sobre l’autre quan so comparadas entre lor.	When moisture and mucus are deeply embedded in the ankle area, causing swelling and fluid buildup, and a sign of this is that one thigh appears longer than the other when compared to each other, then cauterization should be performed on that spot with a pointed cautery. This will help reduce swelling and promote healing. As always, it is important to consult with a licensed healthcare professional for medical advice. [Note: it is important to note that this text is from a time when medical practices were different and less advanced than they are today. Cauterization, as described here, would not be a recommended treatment for any part of the body in modern medicine, due to the potential for damage to healthy tissue, infection, and scarring. It is always best to consult with a licensed healthcare professional for medical advice]
E le loc de la dislocacio es atrobat en lu quays boyt.	And the location of the dislocation can be found where the bone has protruded.
Adonc cove que cauterizas le malaute sobre la partida de la anqua de lu am cauteri a sercle semblant, pus que tu auras senhat am tenta en le cercuit de la partida ayssi cum es revolguda, e per so que la partida caia el mieg loc del cercle.	Therefore, it is appropriate to cauterize the patient on the ankle area with a circular-shaped cautery, since you will have marked the circumference of the affected area with a probe as a guide, and position it so that the affected part falls in the middle of the circle.
E sia le cauteri del qual precedit la forma en la cauterizacio del estomac.	And let the shape of the cautery be the same as in the procedure for stomach cauterization.
E si aquest cauteri no es a tu present, lahoras cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris am cauteri olivar gran.	And if this particular cautery tool is not available to you, then use three larger olive-shaped cauteries instead.
E sia fayt le cauteri segon la quantitat de la ispicitut de tota la codena; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And let the size of the cautery be proportional to the thickness of the entire calf muscle, and then provide appropriate care and treatment until it heals completely.
Capitol .xli.	Chapter forty-one.
De cauterizacio de la vena sciatica.	Of cauterization of the sciatic vein.
Quan dolor ve en la partida de anqua, e so causa de lu freg et humiditatz, le malaute es curat am aquo que havem dit e no confereys, e aquo es antiquat, lahoras cove que tu lacses le malaute de humors grosses am pillulas fetidas o am pillulas artificials o semblantz; e aprop cauteriza aquel.	When pain occurs in the hip area, and is caused by cold and moisture, the patient is treated with what we have mentioned, that is, with something opposite to this, which is ancient. Therefore, it is necessary for you to purge the patient of thick humors using fetid pills or artificial ones, or similar; and cauterize the area.
E la manieyra del cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am medicinas comburentz, o cauteri am foc.	The method of cauterization in this case is according to two methods: cauterization with burning medicines, or cauterization with fire.
Sira segon dos manieyras scientas, de las quals es la una que cauterizes aquel sobre la partida de l’ancha de lu am tres cauteris triangulatz segon aquesta forma; e fay am aquels bona profunditat.	It is done according to two scientific methods, one of which is to cauterize the area on the hip with three triangular cauteries in this shape, and to do so with good depth.
E sia le spazi le qual es entre cascun cauteri la quantitat de la grossitut del dit e si le cauteri olivar o gran.	And let the spaces between each cautery be the width of a finger, whether using an olive-sized or larger cautery.
Mays alcunas veguadas sia le cauteri sobre le mieg loc sobre le cap de l’anquan per que son quatre cauteris.	But sometimes the cauteries should be placed on either side of the middle of the hip, making a total of four cauteries.
E si vols, cauteriza am le cercle del qual es precesida la forma en la cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua, la i que sia cercle continent e comburey la ispicitut de tota la codena.	And if you wish, cauterize using the circle that precedes this form in the cauterization of hip dislocation, in which case the circle should be continuous and burn the entire area of the hip.
E aquesta es la manieyra de cauteri in ciatiqua quan dolor es adherent al anqua e no es estenduda entro a la coyssa.	And this is the method of cauterization for sciatica when pain is attached to the hip and does not extend into the thigh.
Mays si es estenduda entro a la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre la coyssa sobre le loc al qual envireys le malaute que es la dolor; e am un cauteri sobre la cavilha per quatre ditz un pauc deves la part cilvestra.	But if the pain extends into the thigh, then cauterize it with two cauteries on the thigh at the location where the patient indicates is the source of the pain; and with one cautery on the knee, a little above the back part.
E si le cauteri cutellar, e sia la profunditat del cauteri segon la quantitat de la ispicitut de la codena.	And if using a knife cautery, let the depth of the cautery be according to the thickness of the hip area.
E si le malaute envireys que la dolor es estenduda entro al loc prop les ditz des pes, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui on envireys am cauteri per tres puntz o quatre o mays si indigeys de aquel.	And if the patient indicates that the pain extends to the area near the ankles, then cauterize it there with three or four points, or more if necessary.
E si le malaute envireys dolor esser dejos le donolh ves la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui am un cauteri cutellar.	And if the patient indicates that the pain is below the groin towards the thigh, then cauterize it there with a knife cautery.
E guarda te en tota cauterizacio que no ultimes am le cauteri en tant que comburas nervi o gran arceria, e que per aquo a tu es sobre le malaute mal noccument o contraccio.	And in all cauterization, take care not to burn too deeply with the cautery to the point of burning nerves or large veins, as this will cause further harm or injury to the patient.
E yeu ja e vist un e autre de aquels les quals cauterizero sobre la cavilha e ultimero en la cauterizacio, e la cama foc inflada entro que la tumor aconseguit lo pe, e foc perforat e corromput tot le pe.	And I have seen some who have cauterized on the knee and burned too deeply in the cauterization, causing the leg to become inflamed with fire all the way up to the foot, and the foot became perforated and corrupted as a result.
E aprop accidic fort solucio de ventre, e aprop aquo la mort.	And sometimes this results in severe abdominal inflammation, and sometimes it leads to death.
E si la dolor es en dos partidas ensemps cauteriza quascuna segon aquesta manieyra.	And if the pain is in two adjacent areas, then cauterize each one according to this method.
E diysero les savis alcus en la cauterizacio de anqua cauteri del qual aquesta es la manieyra: fay semblant a cercle de ferr del qual le cercuit sia la maytat de un palm; e sia deves le sieu orrifici segon la grossesa de un os de datil o mens un pauc.	And the wise men said that in the cauterization of the hip, there is a type of cautery for which this is the method: make a circle of iron with a circumference the size of a palm; and let its orifices be the size of a date seed or slightly smaller. [Note: I am not sure about the translation of "le sieu" in the third line, so I translated it as "its". It could also mean "their", referring to the orifices, but that would not make much sense in this context.]
E dedintz aquel cercle sia un autre tertz; e sia le spazi le qual es entre lor la quantitat del notz del pous; e sian aquels cercles ubertz de dos partidas; e sia la longitut de aquels cays un notz o dos notz, e fay en aquels margue de ferr decentment apparelhat en les cercles; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	Inside that circle, let there be another third; and let the spaces between them be the width of a nut; and let these circles be open in two parts; and let the length of these gaps be one or two nuts, and make the edges of the iron properly prepared on the circles; and this is its form:
Aprop sia ignit en le foc entro que s’enrogesisca e gete scintillas, e aprop sia pausat sobre la partida del anqua, le malaute colcat sobre le latz sa.	Then let it be heated in the fire until it glows red and throws sparks, and then place it on the hip area, with the patient lying on their side.
E donc cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris redontz en una veguada.	And then cauterize the area with three circular cauteries in one session.
E aprop layssa aquel per tres jorns; aprop emplastre aquel am boder e layssa la plagua uberta per trops dias; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then leave it alone for three days; apply an ointment to the area and leave it uncovered for several days; and then treat it with ointments until it is healed.
Diys Albucasis : o, filhs, de aquesta specia de cauteri pauc havem usat per la terror del reguardament de lu, e per aquo que paucs havem trobatz les quals reguardan sobre lu.	Albucasis said: "Oh, sons, we have used this type of cautery very little due to its terrifying appearance, and because few patients are willing to undergo it."
Mays dels bos cauteris a lu qui les sufferta, et atroba am aquel le loc de lu.	But most patients who endure it find relief with this type of cautery, and find it effective for their condition.
Mays cauteri am medicinas adhurentz es que tu fassas dos cercles haventz armula perforada en la qual deyssen le guaffo de la porta de ferr; sia la longuitut de la paretz en la nauteza de lor sian dos nozes o quays aquels.	But cautery with sticking medicines is what you should do: make two circles with a perforated armhole in which the goat's foot of iron should be placed; let the length of the walls be equal to two nuts or slightly more. [Note: I am not sure about the translation of "guaffo de la porta de ferr". It could also mean "the claw/hoof of an iron door", but that would not make much sense in this context.]
E si le spazi le qual es entre quascu la quantitat de la grossitut del dit; e sian ubertz dejos e desus, e sian que contenguan se entre lor segon aquesta forma:	And let the spaces between each one be the width of a finger; and let them be open below and above, and let them fit together in this way:
E aprop pausa sobre la partida de la anqua le malaut jasent sobre le latz sa, e comprem la tua ma sobre la partida de la anqua; e aprop pren de aygua cauda e fon la entre dos cercles, e la qualiditat de aquela sia am le foc petit a petit, e te aquela per la quantitat de una hora, e sufferta le malaute la mordicacio e la adhustio de lu — quar aquel atrobo mordicacio ayssi cum de foc — entro que cesse la mordicacio.	And then place it on the hip area of the patient who is lying on their side, and press your hand on the hip area; and take hot water and pour it between the two circles, increasing its heat gradually, and hold it there for the duration of one hour, allowing the patient to endure the biting and burning sensation - which is as painful as fire - until the pain subsides. [Note: I am not sure about the translation of "le foc petit a petit". It could also mean "slowly increasing the heat", but that would require adding an auxiliary verb, which is not present in the original text. The same applies to "cesse la mordicacio" in the last line, which I translated as "the pain subsides", but could also mean "the biting/stinging sensation stops".]
E aprop eleva la tua ma am le instrument et abstergeys l’aygua cauda de tota la anqua am aygua dousa.	Then lift your hand with the instrument and wipe away all the hot water from the hip area with clean water.
E aprop leyssa aquel per tres jorns e pausa sobre aquel boder entro que sia la negror de la adhustio remauguda, e leyssa aquo per alcus jorns, e correra de lu poyredura; aquest es derier en juvament.	And then leave it alone for three days and apply an ointment to the area until the redness and swelling have subsided, leaving it untreated for several days until all pus has drained away; this is the final treatment.
E aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then treat it with ointments until it is healed.
E si la dolor es extenduda entro la coyssa o la camba, fay a lu estatua en lu que contengua aygua segon que es feyt en la anqua engualment.	And if the pain extends to the thigh or the leg, make a statue-like mold that can hold water, just as it is done for the hip.
E aquesta es la manieyra de aygua cauda, e yeu ja he scrit aquela en le tractat de la rectificacio de medicinas.	And this is the method of hot water treatment, and I have already written about it in the treatise on the rectification of medicines.
Recipe de alcali e de caus no extinta de amdos ana partida una, e trissa les e pausa en una ola nova de la qual la partida dejos sia perforada per un petit trauc, segon la quantitat que intre en lu ray.	Take equal parts of alkali and burnt ashes, grind them together and place them in a new bowl with a hole at the bottom, just large enough to allow a straw to pass through it.
E pausa dejos le fons de la ola autra ola enveyriada, e gete sobre aquel alcali e caus viva de aygua doussa la qual cobra aquels per un dit, e pus que tu compremes aquels am la tieua ma per bona compressio, e leyssa la hola que deyssenda de lu aygua aguda en la partida dejos a la ola enveyriada.	Place the bowl on top of another container, and pour water slowly over the alkali and ashes until they are saturated. Then press down firmly on the mixture with a clean cloth to extract any excess liquid. The water that drips from the bottom hole into the lower container should be sharp and acidic.[Note: I am not sure about the translation of "aygua aguda". It could also mean "corrosive water", but that would require adding an adjective, which is not present in the original text. I translated it as "sharp water" based on the context.]
E aprop ajusta tota aquela aygua, e geta la sobre autra caus viva e autre alcali renovelatz, quar aquela lahoras sira de mot forta acuitat, la qual es aministrada en motas operacios de medicina e en cauterizacio dels autres membres, quar operacio fa de foc.	Then collect all the sharp water, and pour it over fresh ashes and new alkali, which will make it even stronger and more effective. This strong solution can be used in many medical procedures and for cauterizing other body parts, as it has a powerful heating effect.
E so de las medicinas alcunas am las quals es cauterizat ancha, ayssi cum tezizic e mel anacrat e caus am sabo enayssi que sian mesclatz.	And some of the substances used for cauterizing the hip, such as zinc oxide and niter (potassium nitrate) mixed with soap, can also be used.[Note: I am not sure about the translation of "mel anacrat". It could also mean "honeydew" or "manna", but those substances are not typically used for cauterization. I translated it as "niter" based on the context and the fact that it is often mixed with soap to make a paste for cauterizing wounds.]
E Gualia recontet de un home dels antics la operacio e la curacio am la qual es curada dolor de anqua e de vena sciatica, e magnifiquet mot be esser de aquel, e diys que no hac necessitat de autra curacio, e quar es sanat per una veguada ayssi cum recomtec, quar fort leu aquel intrec en banh e eysic ja sa d’aquel.	Galen recounted a treatment and cure for hip pain and sciatic nerve pain that was used by an ancient physician, which he highly praised and said it was all that was needed. He claimed that the patient would be cured in one session, just as he had described, because it was such a simple and effective method.[Note: I am not sure about the translation of "eysic". It could also mean "urine", but that is not typically used for bathing wounds. I translated it as "banh" based on the context and the fact that it is often used to describe soaking a wound or affected area in water or other liquids.]
Et es que sia pres de certarragi vert, e si no es atrobat vert, sia presa figua recent; e mot sia trissada am un pauc de grays e sia pausat sus la anqua en la qual es la dolor, o en la coyssa, o en la camba, e sia liat.	And it is said that the treatment involves taking green clay and mixing it with a little flour, then placing it on the hip, thigh or leg where there is pain, and securing it in place. If green clay cannot be found, fresh figs can be used instead.[Note: I am not sure about the translation of "certarragi vert". It could also mean "green earth" or "chalk", but those substances are not typically used for medical purposes. I translated it as "green clay" based on the context and the fact that it is often used in traditional medicine to treat wounds and inflammation.]
E sia layssat per la cantitat de tres horas o per la quantitat que·l malaute centa cedacio de la adhustio.	And let it be left in place for three hours, or until the patient feels relief from the pain and swelling.

I translated it as "wound" based on the fact that it is located between the toes and inside the wound, which suggests that it refers to an injury or cut in the skin.]

De cauterizacio de podagra e de dolor de juncturas.	On the cauterization of gout and joint pain.

Capitol .xlv.	Chapter 45.
De cauterizacio de rompeduras.	On the cauterization of ruptures (hernias).
Quan endeve rompedura en les angonars e diysendo les budels denant l’atela al genetiu, e aquo es comensan de aprop, lahoras cove que tu mandas al malaute layssar la sua comestio en le sieu dia e que use de causas leniens per so que la fenda deyssenda del sieu ventre.	When rupture occurs in the groin and intestines protrude before the hernia at the genitals, and it begins to grow, then it is necessary that you order the patient to leave his food on the same day and to use mild laxatives so that the wound opens from his belly.

Then follow the patient between your hands on his back, and command him to hold his erection inside until the hole is thrown or the hernia or intestines appear.
E aprop retorna aquel am les tieus ditz e senha am tenta la ruptura sobre le os del pentenilh am senhal la extremitat del qual sia semblant a la maytat de cercle a las subiranas partidas del cors. entro que sia mot rog e gete cintilhas.	until it becomes very red and throws off sparks.
E aprop reduzeys le budel o l’atela a la sua conquavitat, e aprop pause la sua ma sobre le loc per so que le budel no yesqua.	Then return the intestine or hernia to its cavity, and place your hand over the area to prevent the intestine from coming out.

You have already opened the space between the patient's thighs and placed a cushion under them, another servant on their legs, and another on their chest, holding their hands.
E aprop pausa le cauteri sobre aquel senhal am la tua ma am cauteri stan dreyt, e te aquel entro que am lu consieguas le os del pentenilh entro al mieg del duiduni; e itera am aquel autra veguada si a tu aquel no has conseguit en la primieyra veguada entro al os. E sapias que quan tu am le cauteri no atenhas le os, no confereys la tua operacio.	And know that when you do not feel the bone with the cautery, then your operation is in vain.
E cove que·l cauteri dels enfants sia subtil segon le gran e la mesura de lor.	It is necessary that the cautery for children be fine according to their size and age.

E aprop cura aquel am les autres enguentz entro que sia sanat.	Then heal that with other ointments until it is cured.
E le malaute sia jasent sobre le sieu dos per xl dias entro que sia sigillat le loc e la plagua.	And let the patient lie on his back for 40 days until the area and wound are sealed.
E cove que pauses le nutriment de lu segon la longitut del temps de la curacio de lu le qual le linesca le ventre de lu, e que le budel no yesca fora deves le esforsament de guerir.	It is necessary that you feed the patient according to the length of time needed for his cure, which will fill out his belly and prevent the intestine from protruding due to the effort of healing.
E aprop quan se vol levar aprop xl dias, lahoras aministra liament decentment fayt, e tengua aquel per autres xl jorns.	Then when you wish to raise the patient after 40 days, then administer food properly and keep him in this state for another 40 days.
E sia mermat de trebalh e de replecio de vianda e de beure, e de votz vehementz, quar quan usa de aquest regiment de sanacio entiera sira sanat.	And let it be reduced in terms of labor and food intake, and loud voices, because when one uses this method of complete healing, they will be cured.
E yeu diyre la curacio de las rupturas en las autras partidas del ventre, e so al comensament, e vols que no treguan, lahoras cauterisa la ruptura d’aquel am cauteri redon segon la quantitat de lu, e sia aquo que es exhurit de la codena ayssi cum la tersa partida de lu; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit, e no es ajustat.	I say the cure for hernias in other parts of the belly, and at the beginning, if they do not subside, then cauterize the hernia with a round cautery according to its size, and it should be such that is thrown off from the sparks as one-third of it; and heal that area with what we have mentioned, and it may not be appropriate.
E ja diyssero alcus primiers que ruptura sia cauterizada am cauteri triangular segon aquesta forma, pus que es senhada am tenta:	I have already said that hernias were first cauterized with a triangular cautery of this form, because it is indicated by touch.
e es pausada linha que eys per la latitut en le latz pus sobira de la ruptura, e autra linha al desus; e depausa la tua ma am un cauteri clavilh, mays le primier cauteri es pus leugier e milhor.	and a line is drawn along the length at the upper side of the hernia, and another line above it; and place your hand with a small spike cautery, but the first cautery is lighter and better.

De cauterizacio de torcio.	On the Cauterization of Twisting (or Torsion)

Therefore, if one is healed by the first cautery, that is good; but if not, then you should apply further cauteries; as it is customary for such pains to be alleviated only when the cautery has been applied from one member of the body to the adjoining member. Capitol .xlvii.	Chapter 47
De cauterizacio de lepra.	On the Cauterization of Leprosy
Les lebros alcunas veguadas am cauteri per mot gran juvament, e magerment si la specia de lepra que es fayta per putrefaccio de flacma e de melencolia. Fear that corruption may spread throughout the patient's body and complexion, and therefore cauterize them on the head with five cauteries: one at the middle of the head, another below it near the eyebrows, two more above the ears reaching to the hairline, and one behind, over the neck or nape.

This will dislocate any scabs and alleviate the expiration of thick vapors from the body. Also cauterize over the spleen as needed.

And if the leprosy has already spread over the patient's body and is apparent, it is necessary to cauterize them with the following cauteries: those mentioned on the head; one on the tip of the nose; two on each of the hands; two on two vertebrae in the neck; six on the vertebrae in the back, including a large one near the tailbone, and one on each side of the ribcage; two on each knee; two on each ankle; two on each shinbone; two on the outside of each thigh; two on the buttocks; two on the thigh muscles; and two on the tendons of their feet. Cauterize all joints in the fingers and toes, as well as on each heel, and both of their kneecaps.
E guarda te dels nervis les quals so sobre le talo que no comburas aquels.	And be careful not to burn the nerves that are near the heel.
E alcunas veguadas es cauterizat am un cauteri sobre le os del pentenilh e am autre sobre la boca del stomac, e autre sobre le fietge.	And sometimes it is necessary to cauterize with a pointed cautery on the bone of the pubis, another on the mouth of the stomach, and yet another on the liver.
