And know that the more cauteries you apply, the more beneficial and effective it is; also know that the patient does not feel pain from the cautery as they do from other injuries, for their body is already stupefied by it.
E cove que les cauteris sian grans o paucs segon les membres e las juncturas segon que es precedit de las specias dels ferramentz.	It is necessary for the cauteries to be large or small according to the members and joints, as dictated by the types of iron instruments mentioned previously.
E aprop cura le cauteri am farina de errs coyta am mel e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And it is important to care for the cautery by applying a mixture of crushed herbs, honey, and other remedies until it has healed.
Capitol .xlviii.	Chapter 48
De cauterizacio de stupor.	On the Cauterization of Stupor (or Numbness)
Quan alcun membre es stabozit o adormit e es curat am medicinas, olis e emplastres, e no es sanat, lahoras tu cauteriza aquel membre stabozit am cauteris segon que merita la grandesa del membre o la parvitat de lu.	When any limb is benumbed or asleep and has not been healed by medicines, oils, or poultices, then you should cauterize that numb member with cauteries appropriate for its size or smallness.
E sia lo tieu cauteri intrant la ispicitut de la codena un pauc.	And let your cautery penetrate a little into the spine.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And care for it with ointment until it has healed.
E alscunas veguadas es cauterizada alcuna stupor le qual endeve a las mas e als pes, e als spondils del dos e ves le eysiment dels nervis les quals mavon aquel membre, e es remauguda la stupor.	And sometimes stupor (numbness) in the hands, feet, and vertebrae of the back is cauterized due to pressure on the nerves that cause numbness in that limb, and the numbness returns.
Mays no prusuma sobre aquo sino aquel que es savi en la anotomia dels membre e de la egressio dels nervis tot le cors moventz.	But do not assume this without the knowledge of a skilled anatomist, who understands the structure of the body and the course of its moving nerves.
Capitol .xlix.	Chapter 49
De cauterizacio de albaras que es morfea.	On the Cauterization of Scars, or Morphea
Quan albaras es antiqua e no comfereys a lu alcu dels enguentz de medicina, lahoras tu cauteriza sobre aquela am cauteri preon un pauc segon la quantitat de la specitut de la codena entro que sia remauguda la blancor e la color de lu, e la color de lu sia mudada.	When a scar is old and does not respond to any medication or ointment, then cauterize it with a heated cautery slightly according to the depth of the spine until the whiteness and color of the scar fades away and its color changes.
E aprop cura aquel am farina de errs e de lentilhas am oli rozat e am folhas de arnagrosa, e am sanc de colomba o am sanc de yronda, da cascuna sia una partida e totas sian mescladas, e aprop sia linit un drap e sus le loc sia pausat entro que sia sanat.	And care for the scar with a mixture of crushed herbs and lentils with rose oil, and leaves of arnica, as well as colombine or ermine blood, equal parts of each mixed together. Apply the mixture to a bandage and place it over the area until healed.
Capitol .l.	Chapter 50
De cauterizacio de cranc.	On the Cauterization of Cancer
Quan canser es comensan e vols aquel ostar, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri de cercle en le circuit de lu ayssi cum es revolgut.	When cancer is in its early stages and you wish to remove it, then cauterize it with a circular cautery following the circumference of the growth as closely as possible.
E diysero les savis que sia cauterizat am lo derier cauteri en le mieg loc; mays a mi no es vist aquo, quar temi que sia ulcerat, e yeu ja e vist aquo alcunas veguadas.	And the wise men said that it should be cauterized with the last (most advanced) cautery in the middle of the growth; however, I have not seen this done, as I fear that it may become ulcerated, and indeed, I have seen such cases before.
E es pus dreyturier que sia cauterizat en le circuit de lu am cercle ayssi cum avem dit, o am motz cauteris.	It is more appropriate to cauterize around the circumference of the growth with a circular cautery, as we have said, or with many cauteries.
Capitol .li.	Chapter 51
De cauterizacio de adubilati.	On the Cauterization of Ulcers
Quan alcun adubilati es tardat en maturacio, e aysso es per la superfluitat fazen aquela, o per etat del malaute, quar es vielh en decrepitat, de pauc sanc, o per le temps, e tu vols festinar en la maturacio de adubilati; lahoras cauteriza en le circuit de lu am motz cauteris petitz punctan; e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela fastinara en maturacio.	When any ulcer is slow to mature, it may be due to excessive pus or the patient's weak condition, such as old age or anemia, or simply because of time. If you wish to hasten its maturation, then cauterize around the circumference of the ulcer with many small puncturing cauteries, and leave it alone so that it may mature more quickly.
Mays si tu vols la perforacio de lu am cauteri, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: e depausa aquel en le mieg loc de adubilati entro que penetre la codena.	If you want to make an incision with the cautery, then heat the cautery to the right temperature until it can pierce the skin.
E si le cauteri en aquel loc que es pus dejos, per so que le cors del brac sia alleujat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if you cauterize in the location that is lower down, so as to relieve the body of the arm; and then treat the inside so that it heals.
Capitol .lii.	Chapter II. (or: Capital of LII)
De cauterizacio de corrodent.	On cauterization for ulcers/corrosion.
Corrodent es corrupcio ambulant en le membre, la qual corrodeys aquel ayssi cum a foc comedent lenha secca.	A corrodent is a wandering corruption in the member, which corrodes it just as fire consumes dry wood.
Donc si vezes aquel corrodent en loc le qual sufferte cauteri am foc, lahoras tu igneys cauteris clavils motz paucs, e grans segon que es convenent en aquel loc en le qual es corrodent.	Therefore, if you see this corrosion in a location that can tolerate cautery with fire, then heat the pointy tips of the cauter or scalpel, making them few, large or small according to what is appropriate for the location of the corrosion.
E aprop cauteriza aquel de tota partida entro que erradiques tota la corrosio e no romangua alcuna causa de lu.	And then cauterize all around it until you eradicate all of the corrosion, leaving none of it behind.
E aprop leyssa aquel per tres dias, e pausa sobre les locs cauterizats solpre trissat am oli mesclat entro que las scaras sian totas eradicadas e tota la corrupcio.	And then let it be for three days, placing a dressing on the cauterized locations with three hundred measures of oil mixed in until all scabs are eradicated and all corruption is gone.
E aprop cura aquel am enguentz carn engendrantz.	And then treat it with flesh-generating ointment.
Mays si aprop tres dias vezes que la carn nasca sana en la qual no es corrupcio, bo es; mays sino, lahoras itera le cauteri sobre aquo que es romas en les locs corrumputz.	But if after three days you see healthy flesh growing in the location without corruption, that's good; but if not, then reapply the cautery to the soft locations of the corrupted areas.
E corrodent es medicat alcunas vetz am medicina aguda, quar aquela es meza en loc de cauteri.	And sometimes a corrodent is treated with sharp medicine instead of cauterization because that serves as a substitute for it in certain locations.
Mays empero cauteri am foc es de pus leugier juvament.	However, cauterization with fire is a more minor help.
E yeu ja e dit la curacio de lu am medicina aguda en la divisio, e donc pren aquela quan de lu auras endegencia.	And I have already said that treatment of it with sharp medicine can be done in the division (or: cut), and so take that when you find it necessary.
Capitol .liii.	Chapter III.
De cauterizacio de claus e dels autres semblants.	On cauterization of abscesses and similar things. [*Note: "claus" can also mean nails, but here it likely means abscesses or boils.]
Motas veguadas endeve a las partidas dejos del pe malautia que s’apela clau, e es causa grossa, fentrada, la qual ladeys le pe; e cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, so es cauteri am foc e cauteri am aygua cauda.	Many times abscesses appear in the lower parts of the sick foot, which are called "clau", and they cause a large, open hole that disfigures the foot; and cauterization is done for them in two ways: cautery with fire and cautery with hot water.
Mays cauteri am foc es que igniscas le cauteri concau semblant a pena de voltor, le qual sia feyt de ferr segon la quantitat la qual contengua le clau de tota partida, e sia de subtils marguas.	However, cauterization with fire is when you heat the concave cautery until it's as hot as a vulture's beak and it should be made of iron according to the size that can contain the abscess from all sides, with fine edges. [*Note: "pena de voltor" = beak of a vulture, here used metaphorically.]
E aprop pausa aquel ignit sobre le clau, e aprop revolveys la tua ma am le cauteri en le circuit del clau entro que·l cauteri pervengua a la profunditat del clau.	And then place the heated cautery on the abscess and rotate your hand with the cautery along the circumference of the abscess until the cautery reaches the depths of the abscess. [*Note: "la tua ma" can also mean "your hand".][
E leyssa aquel per tres dias entro que comense getar brac.	And then leave it for three days until it begins to discharge pus.
E aprop emplastre aquel am malvas salvatges trissadas am sal, e leyssa le emplastre sobre aquel per una nuoyt, quar aquel sira eradicat de las suas razitz.	And then apply an emplaster made from wild mallows, three hundred measures of it with salt, and leave the emplaster on it for one night, because this will eradicate its roots.[*Note: "trissadas" can mean "three times as much", but in this context, it likely means "three hundred".]
E aprop cura le loc am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanat.	And then treat the location with flesh-generating ointment until it is healed.
E si so no-convertitz, e motas veguadas accideysso en la superficia del cors, majorment en las mas e les pes, lahoras cove que tu aministres en aquels cauteri am aygua, e es que prenguas una quannula de eram o de ferr o de pena de voltor, e pausa aquela sobre le clau; e aprop geta en la quanula de aygua cauda pauca cantitat, e rete la tua ma, e tu revolveys aquela am compressio de la tua ma de tot, e sia enpremut le marge de la canula en la razit del clau, e atrobara la aygua cauda via al preon de la razit del cau; e espera le malaute un pauc la mordicacio de l’aygua cauda per una hora, e aprop remau aquela, quar le clau am las suas razitz sira erredicat.	And if it's not converted (into an ulcer), and many times abscesses occur on the surface of the body, especially in the hands and feet, then you must apply cautery with hot water, by taking a small piece of iron or steel or a vulture's beak and placing it on the abscess; and then let a small amount of hot water flow through the hole in the end of the cannula and press your hand firmly around it, making sure that the edge of the cannula is pressed into the root of the abscess and leaving a way for the hot water to reach its depths; and have the patient wait an hour while they feel the bite of the hot water, and then remove the cannula because the abscess with its roots will be eradicated.
E ayssi fe am aquels la i aprop l’autre entro que venguas sobre totz les quals de lor so en le cors.	And do this for all of them until they are all treated, which is when the abscesses will be eradicated from their locations in the body.
E aprop cura aquels pus que las razitz dels claus so erradicadas am aquo dels enguentz les quals la carn ve engenran.	And then treat the pus that remains in the roots of the abscesses with the ointments that generate flesh. [*Note: "las razitz" can also mean "their roots", but it's unclear whether this refers to the patient's or the abscesses' roots.]
Capitol .liiii.	Chapter IIII. (or: Capital of LIII)
De cauterizacio de tremor.	On cauterization for tremors.
Quan endeve ad alcu tremor per freg en le nervi o per febre de causa frega, o per autra causa semblant, lahoras cove que tu cauterises aquel am quatre cauteris o am v sobre les spondils del dos, entre quascun spondilh am un cauteri; e am cauteri en le pietz de lu, e sobre l‘estomac de lu, am cauteri olivar.	When a tremor occurs due to cold in the nerves or fever from some other cause, then it is necessary to cauterize with four or five cauteries on the vertebrae of the back, between each vertebra with one cautery; and also cauterize on their feet and over the stomach with an olive-shaped cautery.
E la tremor de lu se repausa e festina la sanetat de la malautia frega.	And the tremor in them will be relieved and their illness from cold will quickly heal.
Capitol .lv.	Chapter LV. (or: Capital of LV) [*Note: This is the Roman numeral for 55, not 50.]
De cauterizacio de albati accidentz al cors.	On cauterization for whitening of the body (or: appearance).[*Note: "albati" can also mean "white", so this could also be interpreted as "on cauterization for white appearances in the body".]
Quan en le cors so espellitz albati, e so pustulas fendas las quals so feytas de materias grossas corruptas; donc cove al comensament cum apareyso, que sia cauterizat sobre tot cap de la fistola am cauteri subtil am fustz de mirt, la extremitat del qual es estenduda am foc; o am razitz de erestologia longua; o am cauteri lentecular.	When the body becomes discolored white and there are pustules with cracks that are made from thick corrupted matter, then it is necessary as preparation to cauterize the top of each fistula with a fine-pointed cautery made from myrtle wood, the end of which is extended with fire; or with a long scalpel; or with a lenticular cautery. [*Note: "fistola" can also mean "fistula", but here it likely means "cracks".]
E alscunas veguadas es cauteri ademamil al comensament de la sua expulcio segon aquesta manieyra; e no so cregudas, e es disrumpuda la superfluitat fazens aquels, et sana de aquels.	And sometimes it is necessary to cauterize in the beginning of its expulsion in this manner; and they are not trusted (or: believed), and the excess matter is broken up making them heal from that. [*Note: "es" can also mean "are", but it's unclear whether this refers to the white spots or something else.]
Mays empero cove que aquo sia fayt aprop evacuacio am fleubotomia.	However, it is necessary that this be done in conjunction with venesection (or: bloodletting).
Capitol lvi.	Chapter LVI. (or: Capital of LVI) [*Note: This is the Roman numeral for 56, not 50 or 60.]
De cauterizacio de fluex de sanc accident per incisio de arceria.	On cauterization of bleeding from a vein by incision with an arc. [*Note: "fluex" can also mean "flow", but here it likely means "bleeding". Also, "arceria" can also mean "archery", but here it likely means "a curved knife or scalpel used for making incisions in veins".]
Tropas veguadas endeve fluex de arceria que es inciza deves la plagua la qual endeve deforo, o deves la incizio de apostemas o cauteri del membre, e alor semblantz, e es dificil remaura aquel.	Many times there is bleeding from an arc-shaped incision made near the wound that occurs outside of it, or from the incision of abscesses or cautery of a limb, and it is difficult to stop that. [*Note: I changed "it" to refer back to the bleeding.]
Donc cum accideys ad alcu aquo, lahoras tu·t coyta am la tua ma a l’orrifici de la arceria, e pausa sobre aquel le tieu dit endic estrenh aquel motas veguadas entro que sia ostat le fluex del sanc dejos le tieu dit, e que non yesqua.	Therefore, when something happens, you should place your hand on the opening of the artery and press down firmly with your finger to stop any excessive flow of blood that may be causing the problem, and prevent it from getting worse.
E aprop pausa en le foc les cauteris olivars paucs e grantz, per nombre motz, e exsuffla sobre aquels entro que sian mot ignitz.	Then place the olive-shaped cauteries, both large and small, in the fire and heat them up. When they are glowing hot, blow gently on them to remove any remaining ash or debris.
E aprop pren de aquels un petit o un gran segon le loc e la plagua en la qual es rompuda la arteria, sobre aquela vena festinantment pus que auras remaugut le tieu dit, e te le cauteri entro que sia abcindit e restreyt aquel sanc.	Then take one of the heated cauteries, either small or large depending on the location and severity of the injury to the artery. Quickly place it over the vein that you have identified, and hold it there until the bleeding has stopped and the area has been cauterized.[«DONE»]{.tag} E aprop fay aquel de quascuna part del cors que es dolorosa e duresa, per lo qual se pusez le cauteri sobre aquels locs on es la dolor, e si los locs son en lo ventre o en le costas o en lur interiors, abans fay un peytiment de miel e de gresill.
E si le sanc es expellit de l’orrifici de la arteria quan tu remaues le tieu dit e extringeys le cauteri, lahoras pren la un autre cauteri coytadament dels cauteris les quals en le foc son preparatz, e donc no cesses fer aquo un aprop autre entro que le sanc sia restrengit.	And if blood continues to flow from the opening of the artery after you have applied pressure and used the cautery, then quickly take another heated cautery from those that are prepared in the fire. Continue this process, alternating between cauteries, until the bleeding has stopped.[«DONE»]{.tag} E si le sanc de l’orrifici de la arteria non es restrengut, e venen encara fluexes grandes, fay aquo: pren una agulla de ferro e fay un forat al cors prop del loc on es la rompura de la arteria.
E guarda te que no comburas le nervi que aqui es, e que vengua sobre le malaute autra malicia.	And be careful not to burn the nerves in this area, as doing so may cause further harm or injury to the patient.
E sapias que quan de l’arteria flueys sanc, lahoras no es possible en aquels restrenge la sanc, e majorment quan l’arteria es gran, si no am una de quatre manieyras: o am cauteri ayssi quo dit havem, o am extraccio quan no es extrayta, quar quan es extrayta las extremitatz de lu miels son comburidas e es restreyt le sanc, o que sia liat am fiel o am liament per fort strectura, o que sian pausadas sobre lu medicinas de las quals la vertut es restringir la sanc; e sian strengudas am pulvinar am costriccio decent.	And know that when blood flows from an artery, it cannot be stopped in those areas by simple pressure, especially if the artery is large. There are only four ways to control the bleeding: by using cautery as previously described, by surgically extracting the damaged section of the artery (which can cause further damage to the surrounding tissue), by tying off the artery with a strong ligature such as suture or wire, by applying medicines that have the power to constrict blood vessels and slow bleeding, or by elevating the affected area and applying pressure.
Mays aquel que aministra restriccio decent de lu am liament e am strictura am draps o per posicio de causas comburentz e de semblantz, no comfereys sino tart.	However, those who administer control by means of ligatures, tight bandages or the use of heated instruments and similar methods should be cautious and not act hastily, as this may cause further injury or damage.
Mays si aquo endeve ad alcu e no sia le metge present ni medicina, lahoras obre am pausament del dit indic sobre le orrifici de aquela vena ayssi cum havem dit, e entenda a la gran costreccio de lu entro que le sanc sia ostat de la sobirana partida de la plagua, e sobre la arceria le dit no sia remaugut; e de sobre la arceria sia aspergit am aygua frega de mot gran fregiditat entro que·l sanc sia congilat e engrossat; e mays cossire en que ha de cauteri o de medicina necessitat.	However, if something happens and the doctor is not present, then use your index finger to apply pressure to the opening of the vein as previously described. Continue applying pressure until the bleeding stops completely and the blood vessels have constricted. Do not press on the artery directly. Instead, sprinkle cold water over the area above the artery until the bleeding slows down and the blood has thickened and coagulated. Be sure to consider whether cautery or other medical interventions are necessary in this situation.
Comensa la segonda partida.	Here begins the second part.
De incisio e perforacio e ventozas e de fleubotomia e de plaguas e de lor semblants.	This section discusses various medical procedures, including incisions, punctures, bloodletting, venesection, and wound care.
Aquestas son paraulas de Albucazis.	These are the words of Al-Zahrawi (also known as Abulcasis), a renowned Muslim physician and surgeon who lived in the late tenth and early eleventh centuries. He is considered one of the greatest surgeons of the Middle Ages and is credited with writing the first comprehensive textbook on surgery. Many of his surgical techniques, including those described in this text, were widely used by physicians throughout Europe for several centuries after his death.
Ja havem dit en le primier capitol tota malautia en la qual cauteri am foc es convenient e am medicina comburent, e las occasios e las causas de lu, e les instrumentz en aquels necessaris am las formas dels cauteris; e he ordenatz les capitols de la subiranetat del cap entro als pes.	I have already discussed in the first chapter all the diseases for which cautery with fire and heat is appropriate, as well as their causes, symptoms, and the necessary instruments and forms of cauteries. I have also organized the chapters in order from head to toe, discussing various medical conditions and treatments for each part of the body.
E yeu procesire en aquest capitol per aquela meteysa guisa, per que sia alliujat lo querent aquo, lahoras sobre aquo que aura demandat.	In this chapter, I will proceed in the same manner so that the reader may find what they are looking for, and then continue on to other topics of interest. (Note: The text suggests that the author will continue to discuss various medical procedures and treatments as previously described, but with a new focus on the specific topic requested by the reader.)
E denant que yeu comense aquo, cove, fils, que aprenguatz que en aquest capitol es per terror aquo que es en le capitol primier de cauterizacio.	Before I begin, dear reader, it is important to note that the material in this chapter deals with the topic of cautery and its use as a medical treatment, which was discussed in detail in the first chapter. (Note: The text warns the reader that this chapter will continue to discuss the topic of cautery, which may be distressing or difficult for some readers.)[«DONE»]{.tag} E doncs, en lo primer del capitol nos farem remembransa de le cause per que·l cauteri es bo e a qual malautia es util; e desi apres direy com lo cauteri se fay e en quel manere se deu tenir abans e despues quan yeu s’aplica.
E per aquo que cove que sia en lu gran cautela, quar en la operacio la qual es en aquest capitol motas veguadas catz evacuacio la qual es am sanc am le qual esta la vida deves la aspersio de la vena o incisio sobre l’apostema o apercio de exsitura o puracio de la plagua o extraccio de sageta o incizio de peyra e a lor semblantz.	Therefore, it is important to exercise great caution in the procedures described in this chapter, as they often involve causing significant bleeding and other bodily evacuations that can be life-threatening if not performed properly. This includes procedures such as venesection (bloodletting), incision of abscesses or boils, purification of wounds, removal of foreign objects like arrows or splinters, and surgical incisions for the treatment of various ailments.
E de totz aquels so acompanhatz temor e tremor e en le mas de lor catz la mort.	And with all these procedures comes fear, trembling, and in many cases, even death itself. (Note: The text acknowledges the gravity of medical procedures and their potential risks.)[«DONE»]{.tag} E aquo que yeu vos direy sobre le cauteri e sobre lor formas, no es per coxa que lo farem, quar de les causas del cauteri havem parlat en le primier capitol; mas perque·l metge sia avisat en la operacio en aquel loc on se ha d'aplicar.
E yeu amonesti vos que sobre vos no caia aquo en le qual es esitacio, quar alcunas veguadas cazo deves vos manieyras de homes am manieyras motas de malautias.	I urge you to be careful and avoid hesitation in your medical practice, as some diseases may require you to act with great confidence and skill, just like a seasoned physician. (Note: The text advises the reader to be confident and skilled in their medical practice.)
E de lor es alcu que s’irays am la sua malautia e es leugiera deves lu la mort, e aysso per la vehemensia de aquo que troba de sa malautia, e per longuesa de la malautia de lu, e am la malautia es paor la qual significa mort.	And some patients will become angry with you because of their illness and may even threaten your life, due to the severity of their condition or fear of death. (Note: The text warns that medical practitioners may face anger and hostility from patients who are suffering from severe or life-threatening illnesses.)
E de aquels es le qual dona a tu son aver e ditta, tu esperant am aquel sanetat, e la sieua malautia es perniciosa.	And some patients will offer you their wealth and praise in exchange for your medical expertise, while all the while hiding the true severity of their condition. (Note: The text warns that some patients may deceive or manipulate medical practitioners in order to receive treatment.)
E donc no cove que tu consentas en aquel que ve a vos del qual es aquesta manieyra; e la vostra cautela sia major que covesitat e la vostra rapacitat; e no presumatz alcuna causa sobre aquo sino aprop sciencia certa la qual virifica aquo deves vos, e al qual perve successio lausabla.	And so, it is important not to be swayed by such patients and to exercise caution that goes beyond mere prudence or greed. Do not presume anything without solid evidence, but instead rely on verified knowledge and careful observation. This approach will lead to praiseworthy results and success in your medical practice. (Note: The text advises the reader to be cautious and discerning when treating patients and to rely on verified knowledge and careful observation.)
E usatz en la curacio de totz vostres malautes de pronosticacio e indicacio de lu al qual es salut convertida, quar en aquel es a vos ajutori sobre adquisicio de fama e de memoria, de lausor e de gloria.	And in the treatment of all your patients, use prognosis and diagnosis as tools for healing, for it is through these that you will gain fame, reputation, praise, and glory. (Note: The text advises medical practitioners to use their diagnostic skills and knowledge of prognosis to help heal their patients and build a positive reputation.)
O, filhs, Dieus en vos spire le sieu entendement e no oste a vos direccio e proteccio, quar aquo es en la sua ma.	Oh, my sons, may God grant you understanding and guide your actions with his direction and protection, for it is in His hands that all things lie. (Note: The text concludes with a prayer for divine guidance and protection for the reader.)[«DONE»]{.tag} E aquo es tot lo que havem vos dit sobre le cauteri e sobre lor formas, e over aquels locs on se ha d'aplicar; e desi prenatz nota de lu et estudiatz la causa del malautia en la qual sia util.
E yeu e ordenat aquest capitol distingent per capitols segon que precedit en le capitol de cauteris, de la cura del cap entro als pes, per que sia a vos alleujat aquo que demandatz de aquo e del qual havetz necessitat.	And I have organized this chapter into separate sections based on the previous discussion of cauteries and medical procedures, in order to make it easier for you to find what you are looking for and meet your needs. (Note: The text has divided the chapter into several sections based on the topics discussed earlier in the text.)
Capitol primier.	Chapter One. (Note: This is the beginning of a new section or chapter in the text, as indicated by the heading "Capitol primier.")
De la curacio de aygua la qual es contenguda en le cap dels enfantz.	Chapter One: Treatment for Water on the Brain in Infants. (Note: This chapter discusses a medical condition known as hydrocephalus, which is characterized by an abnormal accumulation of cerebrospinal fluid in the brain.)[«DONE»]{.tag} E aquo es aquella malautia la qual es apelada hidrofalos o aquella en que la testa dels enfantz es grossa e le sienes son protrahudas, e per lo qual no puschen les fontanelles sobre lor os; e aco es causat per aquel exces de aquela aygua la qual esta contenguda en le cap dels enfantz.
Sapias que aquesta malautia motas veguadas endeve als enfantz deves le enfantament e quan la noyrissa estrenh le cap del enfant ses livitat.	You should know that this illness often affects children around the time of childbirth, especially when the wet nurse roughly handles the child's head.
E alcunas veguadas endeve per causa amaguada la qual no es saubuda.	And sometimes this illness occurs due to hidden causes which are not known.
Mays yeu no vi aquesta malautia sino en les enfantz; e a totz aquels les quals yeu vi se coytec la mort, e per ayssi es a mi vist layssada obra en aquels.	I have never seen this illness except in children; and in all those that I have seen, it is as if death is lurking, and thus, it seems to me that there is no cure for them.[im-data-marynuuk-response-footer] Sure! Let me know if you need help with anything else. Here to help.
E yeu e vist que un enfant le cap del qual era d’aygua omplit, e·l cap de lu era totjorn ayssi magnificat entro que ceser no podia sobre si meteys per la grandesa del sieu cap, e mays que la humiditat fe aucmentada entro que foc mort.	And I have seen a child whose head was filled with water and it was always swollen to the point where they could not lift their head due to its size, and as the wetness increased, it led to a deadly outcome.
E aquesta humiditat o es agreguada entre la codena e l’os, o es agreguada dejos le os sobre le ciphac.	And this wetness is either collected between the skull and the bone or it is gathered beneath the bone at the base of the skull. (My translation)
Quar la operacio en aquel si la humiditat es entre la codena e l’os e le apostema es pauc, lahoras cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am una fissura en la latitut, e sia la longitut de la fissura cays dos notz entro que corra la humiditat, e aquesta es la forma del spatum:	Therefore, the procedure in this case, if the wetness is between the skull and the bone and the abscess is small, is that you should make an incision in the middle of the head with a fissure of a length of two fingers so that the wetness can drain out. And this is the shape of the incision: (My translation) [im-data-marynuuk-response-footer] Sure! Let me know if you need more help or have any questions about my translations. I'm here to assist you.
E donc si la humiditat es mays augmentada e l’apostema es major, lahoras son aqui dos fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	And so if the wetness is more increased and the abscess is larger, then there should be two incisions made in this manner: (My translation)
E si la humiditat es dejos le os, senhal de lu es que tu vezes la comissuras del cap ubertas de tota partida e l’aygua es spremuda quan tu compremes aquela am la tieua ma a las partidas dedintz e no es aquo a tu amaguat.	And if the wetness is beneath the bone, a sign of this is that you see the seams of the head open from all sides and water comes out when you press it with your hand from the inside, and this is not hidden. (My translation)
Cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am tres fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	It is necessary to make an incision in the middle of the head with three cuts in this manner: (My translation)
e aprop la inscizio extratz ne tota la humiditat; e aprop strenh las fissuras am draps e plumassols; e aprop enbroca aquo de sobre am vi e oli entro al quint dia, e aprop deslia le liament e cura la plagua am tentas e enguentz, e strenh le cap am equalitat; e mange le malaute am vianda secca de pauca humiditat entro que·l membre sia confortat e sanat.	and clean out all the wetness with the incision; then strengthen the cuts with cloths and feathers; then apply a mixture of vinegar and oil to it for five days; then loosen the sutures and treat the wound with bandages and ointments, and bandage the head evenly; and feed the patient dry food with little moisture until the limb is strengthened and healed. (My translation)
E es autra manieyra de incisio, que consideras hon apar la magnitut del apostema e la colleccio de l’aygua, quar alcunas veguadas es mays en le occipicii, o en la partida denant, o en la destra, o en la sinistra; e donc aten am la incizio on appar le apostema e la replecio de l’aygua, e fen aquo segon que a tu es miels possible.	And there is another method of incision that depends on the size of the abscess and the collection of water, because sometimes it is larger in the occipital region or in front or to the right or left side, so pay attention to where the abscess is and its swelling with water, and do what you think is best. (My translation)
Et observa que no inscindas la arteria e endevengua flueys de sanc e mora le malaute per aquel flux de sanc am evacuacio de humiditat.	And pay attention to not cut the artery and cause a flow of blood, because the patient will die due to this evacuation of wetness through bleeding. (My translation)
Capitol .ii.	Capital II.
De inscisio de las arterias las quals so aprop las aurelhas, apeladas hilasseysse.	On the incision of the arteries which are close to the ears and called "temples."
Capitol segon.	Chapter two.
Quan endeveno ad alcu catars o raumas als huelhs o al pietz, e es antiquat aquo, e no confereys en aquo la curacio de las medicinas, lahoras la deriera curacio en aquest es incizio de aquelas dos arterias.	When catarrh or rheum forms in the eyes or feet and it becomes chronic and does not respond to medical treatment, then the last resort for this is an incision of those two arteries. (My translation)
E donc cove quan tu vols inscidir aquelas que le malaute raza lo sieu cap, e aprop fregua le loc am drap aspre per so que aparan las arcerias, e aprop sia strengut le col del malaute am alcu drap; e aprop considera on polsa la vena; e les locs de quascuna sobre les locs les quals so aprop las aurelhas depremutz, e tant se occultan sino en alcus homes.	And therefore, when you want to incise those arteries, it is necessary that the patient bends their head and wipes the area with rough cloth to reveal the arteries. The patient's neck should be strengthened with a cloth and one should consider the pulse of the vein. The location of each artery is close to the temples and is somewhat hidden, except in some people. (My translation)
E aprop senha sobre la arceria am tenta, e aprop inscideys quascuna am le spatum de quascuna partida agut am inscizio pervenient entro al os, e sia aquo per la latitut del cap.	And then place a bandage over the artery with a bandage, and then incise each one with a sharp knife, making an incision that reaches the bone through the width of the head. (My translation)
E si vols, entromet le spatum dejos la arteria e trenqua aquala a las inciden a las partidas desus.	And if you wish, insert the knife underneath the artery and cut it by making an incision in the parts above. (My translation)
E sia la longitut de la inscizio cays dos ditz ajustatz, quar quan alcuna vena es inscizida le sanc es eyssit am egressio pulsatil, le qual saut deforo per saut frequent.	And let the length of the incision be two fingers' width, because when a vein is cut, blood comes out with a pulsating flow and it jumps outside very often. Mays si la arceria no apareys al cintiment, lahoras cove que tu mesures de la aurelha la quantitat del spazi de tres ditz, e aprop senha am tenta, e fen entro al os.	But if the artery does not appear in the measurement, then measure three fingers' width from the ear and place a bandage there, and cut through to the bone. (My translation)
E aquo que cove getar del sanc es quantitat de vi unc., e fort leu ne geta de lu mays o mens, e tot aquo es segon la quantitat la qual appareys de la vertut del malaute e de la replecio de la arceria de lu.	And what is necessary to drain of the blood is the amount of one ounce. And it is necessary to drain just a little more or less of it, and all this depends on the quantity and strength of the patient's condition and the swelling of the artery. (My translation)
E aprop considera la plagua, e donc si reman sobre le os alcuna causa del ciphac, lahoras inscindys aquo per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	And then observe the wound, and if there is any remaining cause of inflammation on the bone, then incise it to prevent the formation of a dangerous abscess. (My translation)
E aprop strenh la plagua am plumassols e am liamentz de drap de li, e aprop cura aquela am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then strengthen the wound with feathers and strips of linen cloth, and treat it with ointments until it is healed. (My translation)
Capitol .iii.	Chapter three.
De extraccio de las arcerias las quals so en las templas.	On the removal of the temporal arteries.
Quan ad alcu accideys emigranea antiqua o catertz agutz, per humiditatz agrimonials e per qualiditat en les lacertz des templas, o sodo antiqua vehement e semblantz ad aquels, e es medicat am las manieyras de curacio de medicina e aquo no comfereys, lahoras nos hem sproatz en aquestas malautias extraccio de las arcerias en les templas, o cauterizacio de aquelas ayssi cum havem mostrat.	When some chronic migraine or severe headaches occur due to the presence of cold and dry humors in the temples or hardened veins similar to those conditions, and medical treatment methods do not work, then we resort to removing the temporal arteries or cauterization of them as previously shown. And if the artery is large, then it is necessary to tie it in two places with strong double thread of silk or with long strings so that it does not become infected and cause bleeding before the wound heals. And it is better that the patient does not have a fever or has a hot constitution; because cauterization is one of those methods that help with drying up the wetness, and therefore it is better to use it as a remedy. And if while operating blood starts to flow from the artery, then you should quickly stop the bleeding by either applying a tourniquet or cauterization or filling the location with a scab and placing your hand on it until the bleeding stops. And if none of the above methods are available to you, then place your finger over the location until the blood clots, and then apply hot water to the area until the swelling subsides, and strengthen it as needed. Capitol quart.	Chapter Four.
De la cura de cors de lagremas agudas e aciduas dels huels.	On the treatment of acute and sour teary eyes.
Quan so lagremas aciduas, e es le cors de aquelas venas las quals so sobre le test del cap deforo, e no comfereys en aquo alcuna causa de la curacio de medicina, e vezes la cara del malaute ja enrogesir e sent en le sieu front deambulacio ayssi cum si era deambulacio de formiguas, e·ls huels de aquel so extenuatz, humitz enayssi que ja les pels de lor son conodutz, e las parpelas so scalfadas per la acuitat de las lacrimas, les antics agro mesties en la curacio de aquelas de aquesta operacio, e nompnero aquela curacio am spassa.	When the eyes are teary and sour, and this is due to the veins that are above the forehead, and medical treatment does not work, then sometimes the face of the patient becomes red, and they feel a sensation in their forehead as if it was crawling with ants, and the eyelids become swollen, moist and so wrinkled that the skin has changed, and the eyelashes are wet. The old remedies for treating this condition include using spittle, but the best method of treatment is cauterization. And the instruction is for the patient to shave the hairs on their forehead, and then make three incisions of equal length on the forehead that are spaced evenly apart according to its length. Mays que sia continuada la inscizio ad aquo appar de la codena, e aprop fay aquo en la fissura migana entro al autra fissura.	"The incision should be continued to the point where it reaches the head of the cobra, and then done in the middle groove between the other grooves."

Capitol .v.	"Chapter 5."
De la cura de lagramas per catartz e als huels descendentz de las partidas dedintz del cap.	"On the treatment of headaches with catharsis and the descending humors from inside the head."
Quan ad alcu veno catartz agutz e continuantz, e vezes les huels del malaute extenuatz petitz, e ja le reguardament de lor es debelitat, e las palpebras ulceradas e de lor cazo les pels, e en le preon del cap es dolor aguda ledent e extrenutacio consequent, lahoras sapias per aquestz accidentz que las materias e catartz no veno sino de motas venas de las partidas dedintz procedent.	"When the veins are cut and continuous catharsis is applied, and sometimes the patient's humors become weak and diminished, and their appearance shows debility, and their eyelids are ulcerated and peeling, and there is sharp, aching pain in the temples and subsequent exhaustion, then know from these symptoms that the matter and catharsis do not come from small veins but rather from large veins within."
E la milhor curacio en aquels es aquesta: que comandes al malaute que raza lo sieu front, e aprop inscideys en aquel una fissura al mieg loc del front, un petit per la latitut (e comensa am la fissura del templar senestre entro al dextre templar; e sia inscisio entro al os; e eslongua la tua ma dels lacertz del templas lesquals son maugutz deves la mastigacio), entro que sia le os descubert.	"And the best treatment for this is as follows: order the patient to raise their forehead, and then make an incision in the middle of the forehead, a small one by width (starting from the left temple and going to the right temple; and let it be deep into the bone; and keep your hand away from the temples which are weakened due to chewing), until the bone is exposed."
Exsicca tot le sanc am espongua o am drap secc e aprop repleys entre las doas labias de la fissura am coto vielh o am draps de li.	"Dry up all the blood with a sponge or a dry cloth, and then fill the space between the two lips of the incision with an old cloth or cloth strips."
E aprop estrenh desus am polvils enbegutz en vi e oli per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	"And then tighten it with powders mixed with wine and oil to prevent infection."
E quan deslias aquo e veses que l’apostema ja es diminuit, lahoras cove que fregua le os entro que comensa en lu nayser carn, e aprop cura aquel am regiment exsiccatiu le qual fassa neysser la carn, ayssi cum si tu prenes de farina de froment dos partidas e de colofania quatre partidas e mescla o, e de lor sia fayt emplastre e sia aministrat en aquestas plaguas a de la carn nativitat.	"And when you see that the swelling has decreased, then it is necessary to scrape the bone where the flesh begins to grow, and then cure it with a drying regimen that promotes the growth of flesh, such as taking two parts flour and four parts colophony and mixing them together to make a plaster, which should be administered to the wounds at the site of the new flesh."
Capitol .vi.	"Chapter 6."
De la cura de aquo que catz en las aurelhas.	"On the treatment of what collects in the ears."
Tota causa que catz en las aurelhas es una de quatre specias, quar o es peyra mineral o causa semblant a peyra, ayssi cum ferr e veyre, o es de planta ayssi cum ceze o fava, o es causa fluxtibla ayssi cum aygua e vi agre e a lor semblantz, o alcuna bestia.	"The cause of what collects in the ears is one of four types: it is either mineral stone or something similar to stone, such as iron and glass, or it is from a plant like wax or beans, or it is a fluid substance like water and vinegar, or it is some kind of animal."
E donc quan peyra catz en l’aurelha o autra causa semblant de aquelas causas que no ajustan ne creysso en l’aurelha, e pausa la aurelha al solelh, e si vezes la peyra, lahoras distilla en aquela alcuna causa de oli violat o sizami, e aprop aministra la extraccio de lu, e fay le stornudar am condizi, e oppila las nars deve le aveniment de stornutacio.	"And so when stone or some other similar cause collects in the ear, which is not suitable or compatible with the ear, then place the ear in the sun, and if you see the stone, then distill on it a little bit of lavender oil or rose oil, and then administer extraction for it, and make the person sneeze with caution, and cover their nose during the sneezing."
E aprop pausa en le circuit de la aurelha alscunas pessas de drap o lana, e dextendas la aurelha a las partidas desus, quar motas veguadas es foro-getada am aquestas causas.	"And then place some cloth or wool compresses in the ear canal, and gently pull the ear upwards, because many times these substances are pushed out with this method."
E si no n’es getada, lahoras aministra extraccio de lu am le instrument apelat gesti epicicarios subtil del qual aquesta es la forma:	"And if it is not removed, then administer extraction for it with the instrument called an ear scoop, which has this form:"
E si es foro-getada am gesti, bo es; e sino, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am onci subtil de pauca duplicacio.	"And if it is removed with the ear scoop, that's good; and if not, then administer extraction for it with a thin probe of two layers."
E donc si no es foro-getada per aquo, lahoras fay una canula de aram e entromet la extremitat de la canula en le trauc de la aurelha e claus a l’enviro de la canula am cera e am oli mollificada per so que no sia ubert sino la canula.	"And so if it is not removed by those means, then make a cannula from silver and insert the end of the cannula into the opening of the ear canal, sealing around the cannula with wax and softened oil so that only the cannula enters."
E aprop extratz am le tieu vent am fort atraccio, quar tropas veguadas cum aquo que havem recontat.	"And then extract it with your breath with strong suction, because often times this is effective."
Mays si no es foro-getada en aquesta manieyra, lahoras pren de halka alumbat o de vecz aparelhat am le qual son preses les ausels una patita quantitat, e pausa aquel en la extremitat de ray, e aprop envolopa sobre aquel coto decentment pausat.	"But if it is not removed in this way, then take a piece of alum or an old device with which birds' feet are pressed with a small amount, and place it on the end of the probe, and then cover it with a suitable dressing."
E aprop entromet aquel en le trauc de la aurelha am facilitat, e aprop excicca la aurelha de la humiditat.	"And then insert that into the opening of the ear canal gently, and then dry the ear of moisture."
E donc si no es foro-getada am totas las causas las quals havem recontadas, lahoras tu coyta a talhar aquela denant que endevengua apostema caut o espasme.	"And so if it is not removed by all of the means that we have discussed, then you must consider cutting it out before it becomes infected or causes spasms."
E la manieyra de talhar aquela es que tu al comensament sancnes le malaute de la vena sephasica e extratz del sanc segon la mannieyra de la vertut de lu, e aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas e converteys l’aurelha a las partidas desus, e fen am petita fissura en la razit de la aurelha deves lo greys de lu en le loc be premegut de lu.	"And the method of cutting it out is to first anesthetize the patient with the saphenous vein and extract blood according to its virtue, and then place your hand on the person's ear and make a small incision in the root of the ear where it is most swollen."
E sia la fissura de figura lunar entro que pervengua a la peyra, e, la peyra atrobada, osta aquela si podes am instrumentz apropriatz; e aprop cos la fissura en aquela hora am velocitat, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	"And make the incision in the shape of a moon so that it reaches the stone, and once you have found the stone, remove it with appropriate instruments; and quickly close the incision at that time, and care for it until it heals."
E si la causa cazent en la aurelha es un dels gras que creysso e so inflatz, lahoras aministra la curacio e la extraccio de lu; mays si no obezeys a tu ad eyssiment, lahoras tu pren spatum teune subtil segon aquesta forma:	"And if the cause of the blockage in the ear is one of the fats that grow and become inflamed, then administer treatment and extraction for it; but if you do not obey this command, then take new wax with this shape:"
e aministra am aquel la abscizio de aquel gra lo qual es cazut en l’aurelha.	"And use that to perform the abscission of the fat that has fallen into the ear."
E no fassas aquo quan cogitas que aquel ja es humectat per la vapor del aurelha, e pausa aquel en motas pessas, e prop extratz ne aquelas am les oncis o am gesti subtil, o ab inscizio ayssi co dit havem, quar es alleujada la extraccio de lu.	"And do not do this when you think that it has already been softened by the steam of the ear, and place it on many compresses, and then extract it with thin probes or gentle suction, or with incision as we have said, because extraction will be easier in this way."
Mays en l’aygua la qual es intrada en l’aurelha cove que·l malaute use de sternutacio am condizi al comensament, e omple la sieua aurelha am alcu coto vielh, e jagua sobre aquela aurelha en la qual es l’aygua, e si per aquo es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, lahoras pren tropas peyras teunas e leons segon la longitut del dit, e calfa aquelas en le foc un pauc, e le pacient entrometa una de aquelas en le trauc de la sua aurelha e saute sobre la un pe sieu de aquela partida e percussia am una autra peyra sobre la peyra la qual es dintz la aurelha.	The patient should sniff in water through the ear opening, which will cause sneezing and help expel the water; if this does not work, take four peony and lion-shaped stones, heat them in the fire, insert one of them in the ear hole, jump on one foot while striking the outside of the ear with another stone.
Donc no cesse aquo am peyra entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada.	And continue doing this with the stone until all the water is expelled.
E ja l’aygua sira foro-getada enayssi que tu prenguas de papier o de gonc .i., e met la una extremetat de lu en l’aurelha e estendas l’autre extremitat am foc entro que sia comburit le may de lu.	And when the water is completely expelled, take some paper or cloth. and put one end of it in the ear and light the other end until it is mostly burned out.
E prop met i autre gonc e fay aquo tantas veguadas entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada, e stratz aquel am canula ayssi co desus es dit de la peyra extrasadora.	And then insert another piece of cloth and do this repeatedly until all the water is expelled, using a cannula as previously mentioned with the stone.
Mays en la extraccio de bestia intrant en aquela aurelha, si es a petit cos, ayssi piussa e a lu semblant, cura aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio; mays si es de gran cos la qual causa apar al sen del vezement, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am gesti e oncis, e la causa de lu es pus leugiera de totas las autras causas que cazo en l’aurelha.	But for the removal of an animal that has entered the ear canal, if it is small and similar in appearance, cure it as mentioned in our previous division; but if it is large and causing damage to the eardrum, perform the extraction with gentle traction and suction. And the cause of this condition is usually easier to treat than other causes that can occur in the ear.
Mays en la extraccio de verm engendrat en la aurelha, quan tu curas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e en le tractat de distillacios e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu reguardes la aurelha al solelh.	But for the removal of a worm born in the ear, when you cure it with what we have mentioned in our division and in the treatise on distillations and not infusions, then it is necessary to look at the ear in sunlight.
E donc si apar aqui alcuna causa dels verms, lahoras extratz aquel am gesti o am onci subtils, mays si no apar deguna causa, lahoras pren una canula dejos streyta e desus ampla de la qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And so if any cause of the worm is apparent, then extract it with gentle traction or fine suction; but if no such cause is visible, then take a cannula that is narrow below and wide above, with this shape:
E entromet la extremitat subtil en la aurelha segon la quantitat la qual suffertar puesca le malaute; e aprop sucgeys am aquela per succio fort, e fay aquo motas veguadas, entro que totz les verms sian foro-gitatz.	Insert the slender end of the cannula into the ear according to the amount that the patient can bear; then apply strong suction with it and do this repeatedly until all the worms are expelled.
Mays si no obezeysso a tu al ayssiment, lahoras tu opila e claus en le circuit de la canula am cera ayssi cum havem dit; lahoras aministre distillacios las quals han ja esproadas les antics en la curacio dels verms, e atrobaras aquo en le tractat de distillacios.	But if the patient does not follow your advice, then you should seal and close the opening of the cannula with wax, as we have mentioned; and then administer distillations that have been proven effective by ancient physicians in the treatment of worms, which can be found in the treatise on distillations.
E sia la tua efusio am la qual efundas les olis medicinas en la aurelha am aquest strument del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And let your effusion be the one with which you pour medical oils into the ear using this instrument, of which this is the shape:
E fay aquela de argent o de eram, dejos streyt, en le qual sia un petit trauc, e am pla desus.	And make it from silver or copper, narrow below with a small hole and flat on top.
E donc sia cum empellent a que es en la conquavitat de la canula de continent aqui on sira necessari.	And so let it be like a funnel that fits into the concavity of the cannula, which will be necessary here.
E si vols, pren le ray e envolveys en la extremitat de lu decentment coto, e aprop gieta oli en la concavitat del auziment, o suc de alcuna herba, o aquo que vols de aquestas medicinas en la canula — e aquela es en la aurelha —, e aprop entromet le ray am coto desus e exprem am la tua ma aquel am compressio temprada de lu entro que l’oli sia expellit en la concavitat del auziment e le malaute senta le oli dedintz.	And if you wish, take a thin piece of cloth and wrap it neatly around the end of it; then pour oil or the juice of some herb, or any medicine you choose, into the concavity of the funnel (which is in the ear); and place the wrapped cloth over the opening of the cannula, gently pressing on it with your hand until the oil is expelled into the concavity of the funnel and the patient feels it inside.
E aquo que sia enfundut en la aurelha sia ja scalfat am foc un petit.	And what has been inserted into the ear should be slightly burned with fire.
E guarda te que la causa la qual distillaras en l’aurelha no sia trop frega, quar las medicinas de aurelha no suffertan aquo.	And take care that the cause which you will distill in the ear is not too cold, because medical treatments for the ear cannot withstand this.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter 7.
De curacio de opilacio de aurelhas.	Of the cure for obstruction of the ears.
Alcunas veguadas alcus enfantz yeysso dels ventres de lors mayres no-perforatz, e aquo ja accideys en alcus homes, opilacio en le meat de la aurelha per plagua o per carn nada en aquela; e aquesta opilacio alcunas veguadas es fayta en le preon del trau de la aurelha la qual no consiec le vezement, e alcunas veguadas es en las partidas defora.	Sometimes children who are born from the wombs of their mothers do not have perforated ears, and this can also happen to some men; obstruction in the meat of the ear may be caused by illness or flesh grown into it. This obstruction sometimes occurs in the passage of the ear canal without affecting the eardrum, while other times it is located on the outside of the ear.
E aquela que accideys en le preon de lu, la qual no comprehen le vezement, es en las majors disposicios de dificil sanacio.	And the one that occurs in the passage without affecting the eardrum is often difficult to cure.
E en aquela en qual consegueys le vezement, cove que tu pauses la aurelha del malaute al solelh e reguarda en aquela.	And in the case where you can see the eardrum, it is necessary to place the patient's ear towards the sun and look inside.
E donc si vezes oppulacio apparent, obre aquela am espatum subtil del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And so if you see an obstruction, open it up with this thin spatula, of which this is the shape:
Si’ la extremitat de lu en la qual sia petita la latitut, del qual la una partida sia aguda e l’autra no; e le spatum sia de dos latz leon per so que no fassa lizio al aurelha.	The end of the spatula should be narrow with a sharp edge on one side and a blunt edge on the other, and it should be two finger-widths wide to prevent injury to the ear.
E donc si la opilacio es per carn nascuda en la aurelha o en le meat de lu, lahoras te aquela am oncis subtils e incidiys aquela vehement facilitat entro que sia ostada tota la carn.	And so if the obstruction is caused by flesh grown in the ear or its meat, then use fine forceps and cut into it with great ease until all the flesh is removed.
E si opilacio es en le preon de la aurelha, lahoras pren ray subtil leon e escalfa aquel am foc un pauc, e aprop met aquel en le meat de l’aurelha.	And if the obstruction is in the ear canal, then take a thin piece of cloth and heat it slightly over the fire; then place it in the ear canal.
E donc si as scentit oppulacio am aquo que le malaute atroba am facilitat, per gravetat de ausir, esforsa la oppressio de lu am facilitat; e guarda te que no plagues les nervis del aurelha.	And so if you have detected an obstruction through the patient's difficulty in hearing, gently relieve the pressure with ease and be careful not to harm the nerves of the ear.
E aprop pausa en l’aurelha drap de li segon la quantitat del ample del trauc lo qual tu as envolvutz en l’enguent egipciac; e fay aquo per alcus jorns entro que sias segur de la consolidacio de la plagua; o que prenguas qualgua e enfon aquela en ayguaros e pulveriza sobre lu segi trissat e usa de lu; e si vezes la aurelha ja esser apostemada, lahoras cove que tu estraguas la qualgua e permutes aquela am autra qualgua la qual tu envoloparas en cerot que sia fayt am oli rozat, entro que sia le apostema caut cedat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then place a piece of cloth in the ear according to the size of the opening that you have covered with Egyptian wax; do this for several days until you are sure of the healing of the infection, or take some and soak it in rose water, then pulverize it and use it; and if you see that the ear has become abscessed, then you must lance it and replace the cloth with another that you have wrapped in wax made with rose oil until the abscess subsides; and then cure it until it is healed.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, lahoras submergeys esponga o drap en aygua frega e pausa sobre la aurelha, e usa del autra curacio la qual restrengeys le flux del sanc, la qual es dita en le tractat de distillacio.	But if bleeding occurs, then immerse a sponge or cloth in cold water and place it on the ear, and use the other treatment that constricts blood flow, which is mentioned in the treatise on distillations.
Capitol .viii.	Capital VIII
De cura de athezil le qual endeveno a las palpebras.	On the treatment of blepharitis, which occurs in the eyelids.
Athezil les quals endeveno a las paupebras dels huels alcuna veguada so humitz, alscunas veguadas son secs.	Blepharitis, which sometimes occurs in the eyelids of the eyes due to either being wet or dry.
Donc cove que tu tenguas aquels am tenhalhas o am onci, e inscindas aquels am espatum de las suas razitz, e aprop pausa sobre les locs segi trissat.	Therefore, you should have hot compresses or woolen bandages at hand, and break those into pieces with a spatula from their radices (roots), then place them on the affected areas for 130 counts.
Mays si dolor am flux de sanc veno, lahoras tu cauteriza aquels am cauteri lanticular subtil.	But if there is pain with a flow of blood, then you should cauterize those areas with a subtle lacrimal cautery.
E la milhor cauterizacio es aprop las inscizios e tropas veguadas retornam quan reman alcuna causa de sas razitz; e quan so cauterizadas am foc, aquelas razitz son comburidas e no retornan.	And the best cauterization is to return to the incisions and wounds frequently, as long as there remains any cause of their roots (radices); and when they are cauterized with fire, those roots are burned off and do not return.
Capitol .ix.	Capital IX
Cura de grandeyssa que veno a las palpebras dels huels.	Treatment for swelling that occurs in the eyelids of the eyes.
Motas veguadas endeve en las palpebras dels huels alcuna causa la qual es asemblada a grandissa en sa fortalicia e duricia, e per so grandissia es apelada.	Swelling frequently occurs in the eyelids of the eyes due to some cause that is similar to swelling in its firmness and hardness, and because of this, it is called "grandissia."
E es agreguacio de humiditat grossa en la palpebra dejos e desus.	And it is an accumulation of thick moisture in the eyelid, both above and below.
Donc la opperacio en lor es que consideras lahoras si la grandissia es procedent en lu en aquo que apar de la palpebra e es mauguda a tota partida; e la causa de lu es leugiera.	Therefore, the operation in this case is to determine whether the swelling (grandissia) originates from the patient and spreads beyond the eyelid, affecting all parts of it, and if its cause is mild.
Donc fen sobre aquela am fissura per la latitut, e aprop escorga aquela de tota partida am facilitat entro que evasesca, e aprop suspen aquela am onci e abscindeys aquela.	Therefore, make an incision in that area with a scalpel along its length, and then scrape all around it with ease until it dries up, and then suspend it with a bandage and cut off the remaining part.
Mays si a tu no es apparelhada la incizio de lu si no pus que penetras la palpebra am inscizio pauc a pauc, lahoras aquo no notz en deguna causa.	But if you are not prepared to make an incision in it, then you can only penetrate the eyelid gradually with small cuts; this will not harm in any way.
E si la figura es gran, lahoras tu l’ajusta am sutura; e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And if the wound is large, then you should adjust it with stitches; and take care of it until it heals.
E si es pauca, a tu no sobrevindra mal per aquela quar l’anguent de lu restaura aquela e encarna.	And if it is small, then there will be no harm in leaving it alone, as the ointment will restore and heal it.
E si la grandissia es declinant a las partidas dedintz de la palpebra deves la superficia dedintz, lahoras evesa la palpebra e suspen la grandissia am onci, otra que tu indigescas de incizio, e prem aquela de tota part, e si la palpebra per inscizio es alonguada, aquo no notz en deguna causa.	And if the swelling (grandissia) is declining towards the inner parts of the eyelid, then turn over the eyelid and suspend the swelling with a bandage from the inside, using an incision that you deem necessary. Apply pressure all around it, and if the eyelid is too long due to the incision, there will be no harm in any way.
E aprop la incizio, lava le huel am aygua salada; e cura le loc am aquo que encarna entro que sia sanat.	And after the incision, wash the eye with saltwater; and care for the area until it heals, using ointment that promotes healing.
Capitol .x.	Capital X
De la cura axcirnah en la palpebra desus del huel.	On the treatment of chalazion (axcirnah) in the upper eyelid (palpebra desus del huel).
Axcirnath es grays le qual es engendrat en las tunicas de la palpebra desus, e majorment endeve als enfantz, agrava les huels de aquels et accideyso a lor catartz le mayti; e no podon reguardar la claror del solelh per aquo quar lagremas se coytan ad aquels.	Chalazion (axcirnath) is an inflammation that occurs in the tunics of the upper eyelid, and it is more common in children. It can cause swelling in the eyes, leading to tearing and difficulty seeing clearly. The text suggests that chalazion can interfere with a child's ability to look directly at the sun, causing their tears to dry up due to the inflammation.
E per so tu vezes aquels jaser sobre les lors caras tot temps, e sobre les lors caras dormen; e so a las palpebras de lor dejos les sobrecils humidas, las quals ja ha cuberta imflacio, e iminencia de accernac apparent es en l’uelh; e que quant tu premes le loc am les tieus ditz, tu centes accernac entro aquels.	Therefore, you should observe the child's eyes constantly, and they should sleep with their eyes closed. If there is excessive moisture in the lower eyelids, then inflammation has already occurred, and the risk of chalazion (accernac) is high. Moreover, if you press the affected area gently with your fingers, you can feel a lump or swelling in the eye.
E alcuna manieyra de opperacio es en aquel que le malaute pausa le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop pausa drap de li e de lu fay calgua, e fay de lu cercle segon la quantitat la qual contena arthernach de tota partida, e aprop pausa aquel sobre aquela e prem am les tieus ditz de tota per que sia agreguat arcernac en le mieg del cercle, e aprop fen en le mieg de aquela humiditat am spatum inscident am fissura per la latitut, e la fissura no sia major que la fissura que es fayta en flaubotomia.	One approach to treatment is for the patient to place their head on your lap, and then place a cloth over them and warm it up. Create a circle around the affected area based on its size, and then place that circle over the swelling, pressing it gently with your fingers to encourage chalazion (arcernac) to form in the center of the circle. Then make an incision in the middle of the moisture with a spatula, cutting along its length, but not making the incision too large, similar to that made during bloodletting.
Mays en le preon cove que tu fendas la codena tota entro que pervenguas ad arcernach, quar en las mays desposicios proceseys arcernach per fissura segon la forma de grayseza blanca.	However, in the case of a preon (pus), it is necessary to cut through the skin completely until you reach the chalazion (arcernac), as in more severe cases, the chalazion can spread through the incision along the shape of white pus.
Donc extratz aquela am draps los quals tu as envolopatz entre les tieus ditz a las partidas deforo e revolv entre la ma dextra e sinistre entro que sia dispargut.	Therefore, remove the cloth that you have wrapped around your fingers with your right and left hands, turning it between your hands until it is clean.
E guarda te que no ajustes en la fissura per so que am le spatum no pervenguas al huel e ladescas aquel.	And be careful not to adjust the incision too much, as you may accidentally cut the eye with the spatula and cause further damage.
Mays si no apar a tu arternach en le comensament de la fissura, mays que tu ajustes en la fissura un petit am fecilitat entro que procesisca arternach; e aprop extratz aquela ayssi quo havem dit; e aprop submargeys draps de li en aygua e vi agre e pausa les sobre le loc e estrenh aquels am polvils.	However, if you do not see the chalazion (arcernach) at the beginning of the incision, then adjust the incision slightly to encourage its appearance; and remove it as we have described earlier. Then soak a cloth in water, vinegar, and honey, and place it over the affected area, securing it with bandages.
E so alcus que trissan sal e pausan aquel en la conquavitat de la fissura per so que aquo que es remas de aquela humiditat.	And place a small piece of cloth soaked in three times the amount of salt and place it in the concavity of the incision to absorb any remaining moisture from the affected area.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And take care of it until it heals completely.
Mays si accideys en le loc apostema caut, lahoras cura aquel am emplastres cedatils entro que sia sanat.	If a boil in the location of the cautery appears, then cure it with seditive plasters until it is healed.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter 11. (This is an assumption as there is no context provided)
De manieyras de tactimi del huel.	On the methods of cauterization using fire.
Quan en las palpebras dels huels so natz pels ajustatz dejos les pels naturals e so antiquatz, lahoras aquels noso al huel e fan endevenir manieras de malautias ayssi cum lacrimas assiduas e mollificacio de palpebras e tela entro que aquo sia causa de destruccio del huel que s’apela tactinir del huel, e cura se en quatre manieyras: o per cauteri am foc; o am medicina acuta segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri; o es fayt atactini per inscizio e sutura; o per cannas segon que yeu diyre.	When eyelashes are lost due to the adjustment of the eyelids' natural and old lashes, then such a condition affects the eye and leads to various illnesses such as constant tears, swelling of the eyelids, and formation of tissue within which causes destruction of the eye, known as "eye tactini." It can be cured in four ways: through cauterization with fire; through acute medicine as mentioned before in the chapter on cautery; by making an incision and suturing; or by using canes as I will explain.
E donc cove que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se; aprop converteys la palpebra del uelh am la tua ma sinistra, e si es convertida, bo es; e sino, entromet agulha en aquela en la qual sia fiel de la partida pus dejos de la palpebra, e fay penetrar la agulha am fiel desus, e aquo sia — prop del marge de la palpebra en le qual naysso les pels — prop dels pels, e tira le fiel a las partidas desus am la palpebra, e converteys aquela am le ray.	And so it is necessary for you to place the patient's head towards you; then turn the eyelid of the eye with your left hand, and if it is turned, good; and if not, insert a needle in the one below the eyelid, put some bile on the tip of the needle, and place it near the edge of the eyelid where the lashes grow, then pull the skin upwards while holding the eyelid with the needle.
E aprop fen en la partida dedintz de la palpebra dejos les pels ajustatz am spatum inscidentz del lacrimal major entro al lacrimal mendre; e aprop extratz le fiel e pausa dejos la palpebra polvilhs petitz de coto o de drap, e aprop senha sobre la palpebra am tenta, e sia ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirt.	And then make an incision in the inner part of the eyelid below the lashes using a sharp spatula from the lacrimal bone to the lacrimal duct; and then extract the bile and place it under the eyelid with small pieces of linen or cloth, and then apply a bandage over the eyelid with tents, and so that it resembles the shape of a myrtle leaf.
Mays empero cove que sia la figura segon la quantitat de helevacio de la palpebra, quar aquo ja es diversificat en les homes, quar de aquels es le quals indigeys que sia inscidit de la palpebra gran quantitat segon la quantitat per la qual la palpebra es mollificada.	However, it is necessary that the shape be according to the degree of swelling of the eyelid, as this varies from person to person, as some require a large incision in the eyelid according to the degree of swelling.
E aprop fen am le spatum sobre las doas linhas las quals has senhadas, e comensa del lacrimal major entro al lacrimal menor.	And then make an incision with the spatula on the two lines that you have marked, starting from the lacrimal bone to the lacrimal duct.
E si’ la tua fissura prop dels pels naturals ayssi cum es la grossetut del rey.	And if your incision is near the natural lashes, as thick as a king's crown. (I assume "grossetut del rey" refers to something of great size or thickness, but it is unclear from the text provided)
E aprop met le onci en un dels dos angles de la codena, e aprop excoria aquela tota, e aprop ajusta am la scitura las doas labias am gula o fiel de lana subtil, e abstergeys le sanc, e fay adherir aquo que superflueys dels fiels sobre dos sobrecils am alcunas causas enviscans, si voles far aquo, e sino, non cures.	And then place the ounce in one of the two corners of the eyelid and excise that completely; then adjust both lips with the incision using fine woolen bile or saliva, and wipe away the blood, and if you wish, attach the excess bile to the eyebrows with some adhesive causes, otherwise, do not care.
E aprop leyssa la sutura dels fiels entro a tres dias o quatre, e aprop cura aquo.	And then leave the suture of the eyelids for three or four days and take care of it.
E si vols, layssa la plagua ses sutura, e cura aquela am aquo que exsicca e constrenh, quar la palpebra es alevada deves la sigillacio de la plagua e la agreguacio de lu; mays sutura es milor E donc aysso diysso les antics de taxanir.	And if you wish, leave the wound without sutures and cure it with drying and constricting agents, as the eyelid swells due to the sealing of the wound and its accumulation; but suturing is better. This I say according to ancient methods of cautery.
Mays empero en lu sia sollicitut sobre le malaute, e es de bona operacio, e no es en lu temor.	However, the patient should be reassured and it is good practice, and there is no need to fear in them. (I assume "en lu" refers to "in him/her")
E es autra manieyra en taxmir, e es que senhes sobre la palpebra figura ayssi cum fuelha de mirt, e aprop eleva la palpebra am tres uncis segreguatz e congreguatz segon aquesta forma:	And there is another method of cauterization, which is to mark on the eyelid the shape of a myrtle leaf, and then raise the eyelid with three separate and gathered hooks according to this form:
Mays si no es possible aquo, tener les uncis, e aquo no es engualhat, lahoras pren una agula en la qual haia fil e met aquela en le mieg de la figura, e entromet le autre fiel prop le lacrimal major, e·l fiel segon prop le lacrimal mendre, e ajusta entre les tieus ditz les fiels am equalitat, e aprop am aquels eleva la tua ma am elevacio engual, eleva tota la codena sobre la qual es senhat ayssi cum havem recomtat.	But if that is not possible, take hooks with thread and attach them in the middle of the marked shape; then insert bile near the lacrimal bone on both sides, adjusting the hooks evenly between your fingers, and then raise your hand with a firm grip to raise the entire eyelid as we have described.
E aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then adjust both lips of the wound with suture and cure it until healed.
Mays si accideys apostema deves la tua inscizio o la tua fissura, seda aquel apostema am cerot e a lu semblantz, e am enguentz.	And if a boil occurs in your incision or cut, soothe it with wax and similar substances, and with ointments.
E alcunas veguadas endeve a la palpebra que·ls sieus pels sian convertitz, adonc cove que tu uses en aquela de aquo que havem dit de inscizio; mays sutura en quascus es mays artificial.	And sometimes the eyelashes turn, then it is necessary to use the incision method that we mentioned earlier; but suturing is more artificial in each case.
Ataxinir am cannas es segon aquesta forma:	Cauterization with canes is according to this form: (Note: It seems there is a missing part of the text, as it does not mention what "this form" refers to)
e es que tu convertas la palpebra e scindas la figura qu’es dedintz segon que he recontat; e aprop per art fay doas cannas o doas astelas subtils de las quals longitut sia segon la longitut de la palpebra e la latitut de lor sia mendra de la latitut del spatum.	And it is done by turning the eyelid and cutting the inner shape as I have mentioned; and then artificially make two thin canes or rods with a length equal to that of the eyelid and smaller in width than the spatula.
E tu ja has inscidit en las extremitatz de quascunas partidas, la on tenes les fils.	And you have already made incisions at the ends of each part where the threads are. (I assume "fils" refers to "threads")
Aprop agregua quascuna am subtilitat subre aquo que superflueys de la palpebra del huel, e constres las cannas de quascunas partidas am fort strictura, e layssa aquela per alcus jorns, quar la codena per la strictura morira e sira denegada e se poyrira entro que per si meteyssa cayra.	Then attach each cane with subtlety on top of the excess skin of the eyelid, and tightly constrict the canes of each part with strong tension, leaving it for several days; as the eyelid will die due to the tension, become necrotic, and shrink by itself until it falls off.
Mays si es tardat, lahoras trenca la am las toroyras, e aprop cura la plagua entro que sia sanat.	But if it takes too long, then break the canes with forceps and cure the wound until it is healed.
Donc cum es solidada, la palpebra es elevada e les pels no pungo.	And once it is healed, the eyelid is raised and the lashes do not poke (the eye).
E aquesta es la forma de doas cannas las quals faras segon aquesta forma:	And this is the form of two canes that you will make according to this form: (Again, it seems there is a missing part of the text)
e haia la quantitat de la longitut e de la latitut ni mays ni mens.	It should have the length and width neither greater nor less than necessary. (I assume "la" refers to "the quantity")
Capitol .xii.	Chapter 12.
De elevacio de pels pungentz en le huel am agula quan le pel es dur.	On the lifting of sharp-pointing eyelashes with a needle when the hair is hard.
Quan son pels no-naturals, durs e aspres e pungentz les huels, lahoras la operacio en lu es que tu prenguas agula subtil e pauses en aquela fiel de ceda subtil e leon, e aprop que tu ajustes las extremitatz de lu e nozes quascu en manieyra mot subtil.	When the eyelashes are not natural, hard, rough and sharp to the eyes, then the operation is to take a fine needle and dip it in subtle bile of cedar or lion, and then adjust the ends of it very subtly. (It seems "leon" refers to some kind of animal substance) [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cedarwood\_oil](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cedarwood_oil)
E sia la longitut dels fiels de quantitat de una palma.	And let the length of the threads be one palm in length. (I assume "fiels" refers to "threads" and "palma" refers to a unit of measurement, usually the width of the hand)
E aprop tu compon2 autre fiel subtil dejos lu en breu, e nuza las extremitatz de aquel si tu·t vols.	And then you make another fine thread below it in a short time, and attach the ends of it if you want to. (It seems "nuza" refers to "attach")
E aprop pause le malaute le sieu cap en le tieu se, e sia prop del solelh per que la tua obra sia declarada, quar es operacio subtil e menuda.
