And then have the patient place their head towards you and near the sun so that your work is visible, as it is a subtle and fine operation. (I assume "siele" refers to "his/her" and "solelh" refers to "sun")
E aprop intromet la agulha en la razit del pel ajustat la qual ha necessitat de engen, e fay aquela penetrar en la palpebra festinantment entro que extraguas aquela desus le pel natural.	And then insert the needle into the root of the eyelash that needs adjusting with care, and quickly push it into the eyelid until you pull out the natural eyelash.
E aprop tire le pel entro desus e intromet aquel en alixati, e sian les pels un o dos o tres e no mays.	And then pull the eyelash upwards and insert it into the incision, and let there be one or two or three eyelashes, but not more. (It seems "alixati" refers to "incision")
E aprop tira la tua ma am aquel entro que·l pel sia fora-gitat am alixolati en la palpebra am le pel natural.	And then pull your hand with the eyelash outside of the incision in the eyelid with the natural eyelash, using the incision as a guide. (I assume "fora-gitat" refers to "pulled out")
Mays si es atirat alixalati e non es gitat le pel, atiraras alixati a las partidas dejos am le fiel le qual tu has compost am aquela, entro qu’en sia gitat alixalati del trau sobira.	But if it is pulled by the incision and the eyelash is not pulled out, then pull the incision downwards towards the lower parts with the thread that you have made until the eyelash is pulled out from above. (I assume "trau" refers to "opening")
E vegas aquela am la visio del huel, quar lahoras tu gitaras alixati e lo fiel, e grotan quascu e clautz le huel, e laysse le claus per dos dias o tres, entro que·l pel adheresca al sieu loc e nasque sobre aquel bona carn.	And then close the eye with your fingers as you pull out the incision and thread, so that each person closes their eyes and seals it for two or three days until the eyelash attaches to its place and new flesh grows on it. (I assume "clautz" refers to "seal")
E si es mays breu le pel, lahoras tu ajusta un pel lonc dels pels naturals, e es elevat am aquel, o que·l leysses entro que sia alonguat aprop alcu spazi, e lehoras tu eleva aquel.	And if the eyelash is shorter than natural, then attach a longer eyelash to the natural ones and raise it with that, or let it grow for some time until it lengthens; then you can raise it. (I assume "alonguat" refers to "lengthened")
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter 13.
De la cura de ehacratir la qual ve en la palpebra desus.	On the treatment of ecchymosis that appears on the eyelid. (I assume "ehacratrit" refers to a medical term for bruising, possibly derived from Greek "ἕμαθρον", meaning blood clot or swelling)
Quan ve en le huel ehacratir, e es contraccio de la palpebra quan es contrayta en sus, o a dextra o a sinistra partida, per mala consolidacio de plagua o de seccio o de cauteri, e es apelada leporina, e aquesta ahercrati o es natural o accidental, e es fayta per consolidacio de plagua o de seccios o de cauteri, o per semblantz a lor malcuratz.	When ecchymosis appears on the eyelid and there is contraction of the eyelid upwards or to the right or left side due to poor healing of wounds or incisions or cauterization; it is called "leporina," and this bruising can be natural or accidental, caused by poor healing of wounds or incisions or cauterization, or similar maladies. (I assume "malcuratz" refers to "similar diseases") [https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/lepra#Latin](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/lepra#Latin)
May la manieyra de la operacio en lu es que tu fendas aquela consolidacio e que separes las labias de lu, e pauses en lu en aquo que es entre aquelas una meca de drap de li, e ligues aquelas entro que sian sanadas.	The method of operation is to cut the consolidation and separate the lips of it, place a piece of linen cloth in between them, and bind them together until they are healed. (I assume "meca" refers to "a piece")
E no cove que tu uses de curacio de lu de las causas las quals exsiccan, constrenho; quar si tu fas aquo retorna alixacratir pus mal que nulh temps no foc habantz.	And it is not necessary to use drying or constricting agents for healing, as this will worsen the ecchymosis and make it worse than before. (I assume "alixacratrit" refers to a medical term for bruising)
Usa en aquela de causas que mollifico ayssi cum es fenugrec, e embroca am la aygua en la qual son coytz altea e semensa de li, o enguent dyaquilon, le qual sia liquefayt am alcu dels olis, e submergeys en aquel la meca, e cura am aquel.	Use agents that soften the ecchymosis, such as fenugreek, and soak it in water with crushed althea root and seeds of fenugreek, or use a diacylon ointment dissolved in one of the oils, and submerge the cloth in this liquid and cure the ecchymosis with it. (I assume "diacylon" refers to an ointment) [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fenugreek](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fenugreek)
E lo tesaur de la tua curacio es que tu perforsses am tot engen que no sia consolidat segon la forma que foc al comensament.	The key to your treatment is to perform with great care and attention to detail, ensuring that there is no consolidation or thickening as was the case at the beginning of the procedure. (I assume "perforsses" refers to "perform" and "consolidat" refers to "thickening")
E aquesta operacio la qual havem dita, no es sino alcuna rectificacio de ehalixacrati que no retorna la forma del loc segon que foc denant.	And this operation that we have described is nothing but a correction of ecchymosis that does not restore the shape of the area as it was before. (I assume "ehalixacrati" refers to a medical term for bruising)
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter 14.
De la cura de ehacrati le qual es fayt en la palpebra dejos.	On the treatment of ecchymosis that appears on the lower eyelid. (I assume "ehacrati" refers to a medical term for bruising)
Aquesta alxacrati la qual es fayta en la palpebra dejos, la qual es nompnada vertadierament alxacrati; e es de lu alcuna natural, autra accidental.	This ecchymosis that appears on the lower eyelid is called true ecchymosis, and it can be either natural or accidental. (I assume "vertadierament" refers to "true") [
Mays accidental es fayta per plagua o per scissura o per cauteri o per autres semblantz.	But accidental ecchymosis can be caused by wounds or incisions, cauterization, or similar conditions. (I assume "scissura" refers to a medical term for a cut or incision)
E la via de la operacio de lu es que tu prenguas una agula en la qual haga fil doble, e fiques aquela en la carn, e que la fassas passar del lacrimal de senestre entro al lacrimal dextre, entro que·l fil pervengua en las doas extremitatz de la carn.	The method of treatment for ecchymosis on the lower eyelid is to take a needle with double thread and insert it into the flesh, passing it from the lacrimal bone on the left side to the lacrimal bone on the right side, so that the thread passes through both ends of the flesh. (I assume "lacrimal" refers to the bones near the inner corner of the eye) [
E aprop exten la carn a las partidas desus am la agula e cus aquela am la agula, e inscideys am spatum ample.	And pull the skin up at the edges with a needle and cut that with the needle, and make an incision wide with a scalpel.
E donc si retorne la figura de la palpebre segon que cove, bo es; e sino, pren le ray e pausa aquel en la figura fenduda, e am aquel converteys la palpebra, e fen las doas fissuras en le latz de la palpebra dejos.	And so if the shape of the eyelid returns as it should, that is good; but if not, take a thread and place it in the slit of the divided eyelid, and with that turn the eyelid, and make two incisions on the edge of the lower eyelid.
E sian las extremitatz de las doas fissuras de dos angles de la inscizio, la qual has fayta entro que concurren, e sia de lor fayt angle entro que quan se congreguan sia fayta figura de lor.	And let the ends of the two incisions be at two angles of the incision which you have made where they converge, and let the making of these angles be such that when they come together, a figure is formed by them.
E aquesta figura es letra greca: la landa.	And this figure is the Greek letter lambda.
E aprop osta la carn aquela per la quantitat que es le latz de lu agut dejos de lu, aquo que siec la palpebra.	And then cut away the flesh to the extent of the slit at the sharp edge beneath it, so that the eyelid is severed.
E aprop ajusta las partz seperadas e cos aquelas am le fil de lana; e aprop cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit de las medicinas mollificativas e de las calguas entro que sia sanat.	And then align the separated parts and sew them together with wool thread; and then treat those with what we have said of softening medicines and with bandages until it is healed.
E si alxacrati endeve per fissura o sutura o cauteri, lahoras cove que tu fendas am fissura plana sobre les pels de la palpebra segon que es precedit.	And if the eyelid becomes inflamed at a slit or stitch or cauterization, then it is necessary to make an incision with a flat blade over the hairs of the eyelid as described above.
E aprop separa am la calgua entre doas labias segon que havem dit.	And then separate with bandages between two lips as we have said.
En la suma del sermo de la cura de alxacrati quan es desus o dejos, que corra en lu operacio, segon que es preparat de la forma de alxacrati, e aquela es en forma de motas diversitatz.	In summary, in the treatment of inflammation that is above or below, let it run as in the operation, according to the preparation of the type of inflammation, and that is in the form of diverse swellings.
E le artifexs savi totz temps prepara engen en quascuna manieyra la qual es possibla a lu entro que fassa retornar la figura a la forma natural, o prop de aquela, e aquel malaute segon que a lu conveneys de la operacio e dels strumentz en las majors disposicios.	And wise artisans always prepare tools in every way that is possible so as to restore the shape to its natural form, or close to it, and this according to what is suitable for the patient in terms of the operation and the instruments used in the best conditions.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter 15.
De la adherencia de la palpebra am la conjunctiva o am la cornea.	Chapter 15: On the Adhesion of the Eyelid to the Conjunctiva or Cornea.
Quan accideys aquesta consolidacio a motz homes enayssi que sia solidada la palpebra pus desus am le album del huel, e sia prohibida de la facilitat del movement e de las suas obras naturals, donc cove que tu entrometas la extramitat del ray dejos la palpebra, e eleva en sus aquela, o exten aquela am le unci.	When this adhesion occurs in some men such that the eyelid is stuck above to the white of the eye and is hindered in its ease of movement and natural functions, then it is necessary to insert the end of a thread beneath the eyelid and lift it up or stretch it with a hook.
E aprop tu inscideys la adherencia am spatum subtil, le qual no sia am acuitat de las inscisios, habantz obtus un petit per so que·l malaute no sia inquietat deves la operacio, e remau le spatum que no ledesca le huel am la sua acuitat.	And then you make an incision in the adhesion with a fine scalpel that is not too sharp, so as not to cause discomfort to the patient during the operation, and leave the scalpel in place without touching the eye with its sharpness.
E sia la tua inscizio quays excorjan aquela adherencia am facilitat entro que sia retornada la palpebra segon la sua forma natural e que sia sanada tota la adherencia.	And let your incision be such that it removes the adhesion easily, so that the eyelid returns to its natural shape and all of the adhesion is healed.
E aprop tu met en le huel aygua salada am la qual tu laves; o distilla en lu de zunia dissolvut en l’aygua.	And then you place salt water in the eye, with which you rinse it; or distill juniper dissolved in water on it.
E aprop separa entre la palpebra e l’huel am calgua de li, e pausa sobre le huel lana infuza en album de huou, e aprop le tertz jorn usa de causas consolidativas entro que sia sanat.	And then separate between the eyelid and the eye with a bandage, and place on the eye wool soaked in white of egg, and then for three days use solidifying causes until it is healed.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter 16.
De inscizio de ungla e de eminencia de carn dels lacrimals.	Chapter 16: On Incision of the Nail and Prominence of Flesh around the Tear Ducts.
Sapias que ungla es segon dos manieyras, quar o es nervosa, e es semblant a ciphac dur subtil; o es no-nervosa, semblant a humiditat blanca congilada, la qual quan ferr la toca, o es forsat aquela prendre am onci, es abscindida e le onci no es ficat en lu.	Know that the nail is of two kinds, for it is either nervous or non-nervous. A nervous nail is similar to a hard, thin bone; a non-nervous nail is similar to congealed white moisture, which when cut with a knife either splinters or is easily lifted with a hook and then removed without the hook becoming embedded in it.
E amdos las specias no comensan sino del lacrimal major entro que va petit a petit que cobre la vista e prohibeys le lum e·l movement de huel.	And both types of growths do not begin at the major tear duct, but rather gradually cover the field of vision and obstruct it, preventing light and movement of the eye.
Mays la manieyra del obrar en la inscizio de lu es que·l malaute pause le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop obre les huels de lu, e eleva la palpebra am la tua ma, e aprop colligeys la ungla am onci de pauca duplicacio e exten aquela a las partidas desus.	But the method of working in the incision of it is that the patient places their head on your lap, and then you open their eyes and lift the eyelid with your hand, and then gather the nail with a hook of little curvature and stretch it upwards.
E aprop pren una agula e entromet en aquela un pel de cavalh o de buou o de vaqua, o de semblantz, o de fiel fort, o duplica la extremitat de la agulha petit a petit e fica aquela en le mieg de la ungla, e penetra aquela am la agulha, e lia am fiel la ungla; e exten aquela a las partidas desus, e excorja am le pel le latz de la ungla lo qual siec la pupilla.	And then take a needle and insert a horsehair or cowhide or oxhide, or something similar, or strong bile, or double the tip of the needle slightly and place it in the middle of the nail, and penetrate it with the needle, and bind the nail with bile; and stretch it upwards, and remove with the hair the edge of the nail that cuts the pupil.
E ayssi tu sieguas aquela am le pel entro al derier de lu.	And similarly, you continue with the hair to the back of it.
E aprop tu inscideys le romanent en la razitz del lacrimal am spatum subtil o am petitas forfexs, e leysa la carn del lacrimal natural per so que per inscizio de aquela no endevengua fluxs de lagremas continuabla.	And then you make an incision in the remainder in the root of the tear duct with a fine scalpel or small scissors, and leave the flesh of the tear duct natural so that through the incision of it there does not come continuous flow of tears.
E alscunas vetz la ungla am le sol onci estenduda o am fiel, ayssi co havem dit, e aprop sia excurjat am spatum leon del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And sometimes the nail with only one hook extended or with bile, as we have said, and then it is removed with a scalpel of this shape:
E guarda te que am le spatum no toques la tunica cornea e que avengua en lu ruptura, e que la pupilla sia perforada.	And be careful that with the scalpel you do not touch the corneal membrane and that there is a break in it, and that the pupil is perforated.
Aprop la inscizio geta en le huel un pauc de sal trissa o di cief fayt de siniar, e leyssa aquel entro al autre dia; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove entro que sia sanat.	And then the incision is placed in the eye a little salt or a piece of crushed onion, and that is left in for another day; and then it is treated with what is necessary until it is healed.
E si la ungla no es nervoza e no podes metre la agulha, ni es ficada en aquela le onci, lahoras motas veguadas aquesta specia de ungla es curada am medicinas, e es sanada ayssi cum yeu e recomtat en la divisio.	And if the nail is not nervous and you cannot insert the needle, nor has it been embedded in it with the hook, then many times this type of nail is cured with medicines, and it heals just like an eye and is commended in the division.
E si tu vols inscindir aquela, lahoras tu obre le huel del malaute e pren spatum subtil leon de freul acuitat segon aquesta forma:	And if you want to incise that one, then you open the patient's wound and take a thin spatula of sharpened iron in this shape:
am subtilitat.	with thinness (or precision).
E si vezes que aquela es rarificada e es confugida e empren en aquela razit, lahoras distilla de la tua ora en le huel de cief fayt de siniar o am cief rog o am sal trissat, e opila le huel entro a l’autre dia.	And if sometimes that one is rarefied and protruding and has taken on a bluish color, then distill from your horn in the patient's wound either sulfur oil or rosin or triple salt, and fill the wound with it for a day.
E aprop itera sobre aquela la operacio entro que sia remaugut tot aquo que es de lu, sino que·l contrari apostema caut sia en le huel, quar lahoras tu leyssa aquela, e cura al comensament la apostema entro que sia sanat.	Then repeat the operation on it until everything that is in it has been expelled, except for the opposite abscess that may be in the wound. In that case, you leave it alone and treat the abscess first until it has healed.
E aprop itera la tua operacio sobre aquela am razo entro que sia sanat.	Then repeat your operation on it with judgment until it is healed.
La emenencia de la carn lacrimal, si notz en le huel per gran nocument, sia suspendut am onci; e inscideys aquela de aquela una partida, e no ultimes la inscizio per so que no inscidesqua fluxs de lagremas.	The eminence of the lacrimal carn, if noticed in the wound as a great harm, should be suspended with a lancet; and incise it partially, but do not complete the incision so that you do not cut the flow of tears.
E aprop distilla en le lacrimal cief rog e fayt de siniar entro que sia sanat.	Then apply rosin to the lacrimal wound and sulfur until it is healed.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter 17.
De inscizio de alguazardenic e de aquo que es nascut de carn ajustada en le huel.	On incisions of abscesses and things born from constrained flesh in the wound.
Alcunas veguadas en les huels de alcus es nascuda carn roga, e es sobre-pausada entro que cobre la pupilla, o apropinqua o estrenh sobre las palpebras e fort leu comprem las palpebras a las partidas deforo e es assemblada a roza de balaustra.	Sometimes in the corners of eyes, flesh that is red and swollen has been born, and it covers the pupil or approaches and presses on the eyelids so that they are compressed towards the outer parts and resembles the tip of a column.
Mays la operacio en lu es que·l malaute pausa le sieu cap en le tieu se; e aprop obre les huels de aquel e colligeys tota aquela carn am oncis convenientz ad aquo, e te aquo am una forcep o am cesti; e aprop inscindiys la carn el comensament entro que tot sia finit am le encisori, e guarda te del huel que no ledescas aquel deves la tua operacio.	But the operation for this is that the patient places their head on your lap; and then you open the corners of their eyes and collect all the swollen flesh with appropriate lancets, and hold it with forceps or a basket; and then you incise the flesh at the beginning until everything is finished with the scalpel, and be careful not to injure the eye while performing your operation.
E sia la tua inscizio am la qual inscides aquelas o am espatum le qual nos havem recomtat en la inscizio de la ungla, o am petitas forfexs am las quals es colligit ascebel segon que vindra la forma de lu aprop aquest capitol.	And let your incision be the one with which you incise those (swellings) or with the spatula that we have mentioned in the incision of the nail, or with small forceps with which the pus is collected according to their shape as will be described later in this chapter.
Donc cum es complida la tua inscizio e es remauguda tota aquela carn, lahoras omple le huel de sal trissa, o destilla en lu polvera roga e semblantz a lu de las medicinas corrossivas, e pausa sobre le huel deforo coto am album de huou entro que sia asegurat de apostema caut.	When your incision is completed and all the flesh has been expelled, then fill the wound with triple salt or distill powdered rosin on it, similar to corrosive medicine, and place over the wound a bandage of white cloth until it is healed from abscess.
E si roman alcuna causa de alguardenici e es senhoragat sanc caut, e temes apostema caut, lahoras leyssa le huel e cura aquela apostema am aquo que ceda aquela apostema, e aprop itera sobre aquel am operacio entro que sia sanat, e semblantment fay en la carn ajustada la qual accideys en le huel de aquesta especia.	And if some abscess remains and is bleeding corrupted blood, and you fear an abscess, then leave the wound alone and treat that abscess with what will subdue it, and repeat the operation on it until it is healed, and similarly do for constrained flesh of this kind that occurs in wounds.
Mays empero tu cove que alienes tota curacio del huel freul per via natural o per via accidental, obran am ferr, e no metas la tua ma en alcuna de aquestas operacios entro que veges que aquel membre sia suffertant aquela operacio.	However, you must ensure that all treatment of the wound is done naturally or accidentally with iron, and not with your hand in any of these operations until you see that the member can tolerate the operation.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter 18.
De colleccio de sabel en le huel.	On collecting pus in wounds.
Sabel so venas rogas las quals son testudas sobre le huel e prohibeysso al vesement la sua operacio, e develican le huel am longitut de dias.	Pus is hot and red swellings that are hard on the wound and prevent urination by hindering its function, and they cause a delay in healing of many days.
Donc necessari es al comensament que tu consideres si le huel en le qual es sabel es fort e en lu no es autra malautia que sabel, lahoras tu colligeys aquel sabel.	Therefore, it is necessary at the beginning to consider whether the wound in which there is pus is strong and does not have any other illness but pus, then you should collect that pus.
E es que tu comandes al malaute que pause le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop suspen aquelas venas am un onci o am dos segon la tua prudencia; e sia aquel onci de subtil duplicacio segon aquesta forma:	And it is necessary that you instruct the patient to place their head in your lap, and then suspend those veins with one or two lancets according to your judgment; and let that lancet have a fine point as described below:
o so dos oncis gradantment en un cos segon aquesta forma:	Or two lancets, one larger than the other, in one piece as described below:
E aprop sian colligidas aquelas venas am forses subtils, am subtilitat, e abstergeys le sanc hora aprop hora, entro que vegas aquelas venas esser remaugudas del huel e sian revolgudas.	And let those veins be bound with gentle force and subtlety, and wipe the blood away frequently until you see those veins become engorged with heat and get reddened.
E guarda te que tu no ledes le huel am las extremitatz del spatum; e si’ la tua operacio en le miegjorn denant le solelh, e sias mot ferm en la tua operacio que no inscidas sino aquelas venas.	And be careful not to harm the patient with the edge of your lancet; and perform your operation in the southern side while facing the sun, and be very firm in your operation so that you only pierce those veins.
E quan tu auras complitz, lahoras tu distilla en le huel cief vert o rog per que am sa acuitat corrodesca aquo que es remaugut del sabel.	And when you have finished, then distill on the wound a decoction of vervain or red rose to dissolve with its sharpness what has been engorged by the blade.
Mays si aquo no es a tu possible colligeys tot en aquela hora, e lahoras tu emplastra tot am aquo que cede la dolor de lu, e leyssa lu per alcus dias entro que sia sedada la dolor de lu e que sia asegurat de apostema caut.	But if that is not possible for you to do at that time, then bandage everything up at once, and apply a compress made of something that alleviates the pain, and leave it on for several days until the pain subsides and there is no danger of abscess.
E aprop itera sobre lu segon que la mateyssa manieyra entro que sia sanat.	And then repeat the procedure in the same manner until it is healed.
E aquesta es la forma de las forfexs:	And this is the shape of forceps:
Capitol .xix.	Chapter 19.
De reduccio de arizati al nas.	On reducing polyps in the nose.
Quan tu curas arisati am cauteri o am medicina aguda comburent segon que es precedida la narracio de lu e no es sanat, lahoras no es engen en lu sino que fendas sobre le apostema deves la maturitat de lu, e que extraguas tota la humiditat la qual es en lu e·l poyre entro que sia descubert le os.	When you treat polyps in the nose with a cautery or sharp medicine as previously described and it is not healed, then do not be afraid to cut into the abscess in order to ripen its maturity, and drain all of the moisture that is inside it until the bone is revealed.
E donc cum es descubert le os e vezes en lu corrupcio o negror, lahoras tu ratz lu am un sturment del qual aquesta es la forma:	And so when the bone is revealed and you see corruption or blackness in it, then use an instrument of this shape to scrape it:
E es nompnat de aspre cap, e sia feyt de fer indi, e sia le cap redon ayssi cum asir le qual sia fayt punctat per punctacio de lima o aliskalfati per punctacio subtil (ayssi cum es en la forma seguent).	And it is named "aspre cap," and should be made of iron, and its head should be rounded like a razor, which should be made sharp by filing or honing with a fine stone (as in the following form).
E pausa aquel sobre le loc corrumput del os, e aprop revolveys aquel entre les tieus ditz, e prem la tua ma petit a petit entro que sapias que aquela corropcio es rasa.	And place it on the site of corruption in the bone, and then move it gently between those tissues mentioned above, and press your hand softly until you feel that the corruption has been scraped away.
E aquo sia fayt alcunas veguadas, e aprop restaura le loc am causas exsiccativas e stipticas.	And this should be done several times, and then restore the site with drying and styptic agents.
Donc si·l loc es consolidat e es en lu nascuda bona carn e es abscindit le cors de la sania e roman per xl dias, e no es renovat e no es apostemat e no accideys en lu accident, lahoras tu sapias que es sanat.	Therefore, if the site is healed and healthy flesh has grown there, and the body is separated from the pus, and it remains for forty days without being renewed or becoming abscessed or experiencing any other complication, then you will know that it has been cured.
E sino, lahoras no es en lu engen sino reduzir la fissura a la forma del nas, e segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu descuebras de segon os am ferr o am medicina acuta, e cum sira descubert le os, lahoras tu pren tribo segon aquesta forma:	And if not, then do not be afraid to reduce the fissure to the shape of the nose, and follow this method: that is, you should uncover the bone with either a scalpel or sharp medicine, and when the bone is exposed, then take a probe of this form:
Sia la extramitat de lu ferr triangulada, e·l fust de lu sia prim extenuat entro a la extremitat ayssi cum vezes assi.	Let the outer end of the probe be triangular in shape, and let its stem taper gradually toward the tip, as you can see here.
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le os, e sia aquel prop del lacrimal; e alongua la tua ma un pauc del huel, e aprop revol la tua ma am le tribo entro que penetre tot le os, e aquel sente le malaute per asso que atroba vent yssir per so quan te la sua ma.	And place the probe on the bone, and let it be near the lacrimal; then move your hand slightly away from the wound, and gently rotate your hand with the probe, so that it penetrates deeply into the bone, and you will feel the patient react as they sense the probe moving within them.
Donc lahoras restaura le loc am medicinas stipticas exsiccantz ayssi cum t’e eyssenhat.	Therefore, restore the site with styptic and drying medications as you have been instructed.
Donc cum nays la carn e·l loc es endurazit, lahoras la materia la qual effundia a las partidas deforo retorna al nas, donc aquo es pus leugier sobre le malaute.	When the flesh is removed and the place hardens, the matter that was spreading to the parts returns inside, which is lighter on the patient.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter 20.
De reduccio de la eminencia del huel.	On reducing the swelling of the eye.
Quan le huel emineys am la sua totalitat e no accideys en le vezement nocument ni diminuacio, lahoras cove que laxas le malaute, e aprop que·l segues, e aprop que pausas ventozas en le cervitz ses scarificacio e succa per bona succaccio; e aprop pausa sobre le huel liniment le qual sia fayt de acatra e aloe e enses e sarcocolla, e aprop strenh le emplaustre sobre le huel am motz polvils.	When the eye swells up completely and does not cause any significant harm or reduction in vision, then it is appropriate to relax the patient, have them look towards the swelling, and place warm compresses on their forehead without scarification and with good suction; also, place a liniment made of acacia, aloe, pitch, and gum tragacanth on the eye, and strengthen the poultices applied to the eye with powdered herbs.
E la manieyra dels polvils es que prenguas draps de li leons motz, e quascun drap sia duplicat en quatre plecs; e fay de aquels motz.	And the method for making powders is to take strips of linen cloth and fold each one into four layers; then make powder from these strips.
E aprop pausa aquels la un sobre le autre segon la quantitat de la qual ha le huel necessitat.	Then apply these powders in layers according to the amount needed for the eye swelling.
E aprop strenh sobre aquels am drap dur am fort strictura; e itera las ventosas am succio ses scarificacio; e aprop osta las ventosas e leyssa le huel streyt le dia e la nueyt.	Then strengthen the poultices with a hard cloth that is tightly bound, repeat the warm compresses with good suction but without making incisions, and then remove the compresses and leave the eye exposed for a day and a night.
Mays si entretant le liguament es mollificat, lahoras cove que sia mot streyt.	But if during this time the ligament becomes weakened, then it is necessary to keep it tightly bound.
E aprop osta le liament aprop le dia e la nueyt ayssi cum havem dit.	Then remove the ligaments during the day and night as I have said.
E si vezes le huel ja esser redusit, bo es, e sino, lahoras itera le emplastre am les polvils e la strictura e las ventosas entro que sia sanat.	And if sometimes the eye swelling has already been reduced, that is good; but if not, then repeat the poultices with powders and tight bandages and warm compresses until it is healed.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter 21.
De la inscizio de la eminencia de la tunica uvea.	On incising the swelling of the choroid coat (tunica uvea).
Quan endeve disrupcio en la tunica uvea, e aprop es eminent e procezeys fora las palpebras ayssi cum un gra de rasim, e es orrazada la forma de home per aquo, e vols aquo inscidir, lahoras la operacio en lu es ayssi cum havem recomtat, que tu entrometas la agula en la razitz de la uvea de la partida dejos en la partida desus, e aprop met la agula autra en la qual sia fil doble de la part del lacrimal, e fay aquela penetrar e leyssa la primieyra agula segon la sua disposicio; e aprop inscideys le loc del fiel doble e leva am aquel la partida de la uvea en le circuit de la agula, e strenh aquela mot.	When there is a rupture in the tunica uvea and it becomes prominent and protrudes outside the eyelids like a raisin, and its shape resembles that of a human being, and you wish to incise it, then the operation should be performed as I have described: insert the needle into the edge of the uvea from the lower part towards the upper part, and insert another needle with double thread on the side near the lacrimal gland, and make this one penetrate and leave the first needle in its place; then cut the area where the double thread is and lift up the torn part of the uvea along the path of the needle, and strengthen it with that.
E aprop extratz la agula e pausa sobre le huel lana infusa en album de huou e leyssa entro que cayha le fil am la uva.	Then pull out the needle and place wool soaked in egg white albumen over the eye, and leave it until the double thread falls off with the torn part of the tunica uvea.
E aprop cura le huel am aquo que conforte aquel entro que la plagua sia sanada.	Then cure the eye with whatever is suitable to comfort it until the wound heals.
E alcunas veguadas aduna de tota partida am cercle de drap entro le huel ajuste eminencia gran, e aprop sia perforat am le spatum subtil que vengua al preon del huel, e corra la humiditat albuginea, e descen le huel e intra tantost.	And sometimes it is necessary to gather all the torn parts with a circle of cloth around the swollen eye and adjust its prominent elevation, and then make a small incision with a sharp instrument that reaches the cornea and allows the humor vitreous to flow out, and reduce the swelling and enter quickly.
E aprop strenh entro que sia sanat.	Then strengthen it until it heals.
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter 22.
De curacio de alconati.	On the treatment of inflamed eyelids (alconati).
Aquesta malautia que es apelada alconati no es sino sania la qual es ajustada en le huel semblant a aygua dessendent e no es aquela.	This condition known as "alconati" is not simply watery discharge, but rather inflammation or infection that accumulates in the eye and resembles water flowing downwards, although it is not actually water.
Mays la manieyra del obrar en ela es que fasses le malaute sezer sobre la sela aparelada e dreyta, e aprop pren le cap sieu en las tuas mas de doas partz e mau aquel entro que veias la sania pervenir a las partidas dejos, e aprop sia siccada e no descenda, e sia ostat le lum, e·l malaute veia las causas ayssi cum vezia.	However, the method of working with it is to have the patient sit on a prepared and straight chair, and then take hold of their head with both hands so that you can see where the discharge or fluid is coming from, and prevent it from flowing downwards by holding the lower eyelid up, while allowing the patient to see as usual.
E si no descendra en jos, sapias que es aygua.	And if it does not flow downwards, then you will know that it is water or other harmless fluid.
Mays si no es preparat le descendement a la sania am aquo que havem dit, lahoras fay le malaute sezer entre las tuas mas e aprop pren spatum subtil e fen am aquel sobre le pannicol cernent un petit deves la continuacio de la conjunctiva am la tunica cornea en la corona (entro al loc vuet), entro que sia fora-getada la sania.	However, if the flow of discharge or fluid is not prepared with what I have said, then have the patient sit between your hands and take a thin spatula and make an incision with it on the edge of the conjunctiva near the cornea in the corner of the eye, until the accumulated pus or other infectious material is released.
Donc cum es fora-getada, lahoras tu distilla en le huel aygua cauda en la qual has mesclat mel o aygua en la qual ja has bulit fenugrec e mel.	Therefore, when it is released, then you should distill water with warm chicken fat in which you have mixed honey or water that you have boiled with fenugreek and honey into the eye.
E aprop sia curat am las autras causas entro que sia sanat.	And then it should be treated with other causes until it is healed.
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter 23.
De la curacio de la aygua descendent del huel.	On the treatment of watery discharge from the eye (la aygua descendent del huel).
Ja havem dit las specias de la aygua en la divisio e qual conveneys a perforar am sermo declarant, lahoras aquel segon la sanetat.	We have already discussed the species of water in the division and which ones are suitable for incision with explicit words, therefore do so according to the health status (of the patient).
Lahoras cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute entre las tuas mas sobre un cayrat e lia le sieu huel sa, lu mot stringent.	Now it is necessary that you place the patient in a sitting position between your arms on a chair and tie his hands securely.
E aprop pausa prop de la palpebra del sieu huel la tua ma senestra, si le huel en le qual es l’aygua es le huel senestra; o am la tua ma dreyta, si le huel es le dextre.	Then place your left hand close to the patient's eyelid of the watery eye, if the watery eye is on the left side; or use your right hand if it is on the right side.
E aprop am la tua ma dextra pren almagda, si le huel es senestre; o am la tua ma senestra, si le huel es de dreyt.	Then take an almond with your right hand if the watery eye is on the left side; or use your left hand if it is on the right side.[Translation note: "almagda" may refer to an almond-shaped tool used in medicine, but here I'm assuming it refers to an actual almond as a remedy for eye issues, as was common in medieval medicine]
E aprop pausa la extremitat de almagda prop de la corona per la grossesa del ray en le album del huel de part del mendre lacrimal, e aprop enpelleys almagda am vertut e revol la tua ma am aquel.	Then place the end of the almond near the crown (ridge) of the eye, at the outer edge of the smaller tear duct, and roll the almond gently with your hand using its power to apply pressure.
E aprop penetre en le album del huel e sentas que almagda ja es pervenguda a causa vueda.	Then press the almond into the eye's tissue, feeling when it has reached the desired depth.
E cove que sia la masura del cami de almagda al preon la mesura del spazi le qual es de la pupilla entro a la fi de la negror, e es la corona del huel; quar tu veyras am aquel pupilla am la visio de l’huel per la clartat de la tunica cornea.	It is necessary that the almond's path to the pressure point matches the space between the pupil and the end of the eyebrow, so you can see the pupil with the vision of the eye through the clarity of the corneal tissue. [Translation note: this is a somewhat confusing sentence, but it seems to be suggesting that the almond should be inserted in line with the space from the pupil to the edge of the brow, allowing the healer to see the patient's pupil and assess any changes in vision]
E aprop pausa almagda entro al loc en le qual es l’aygua, e aprop tu la atira en jos una veguada aprop autra, e donc si la aygua descen tantost, lahoras vetz le malaute aquo sobre le qual huebre la sua vista tantost, e almagda en le sieu huel.	Then insert the almond into the area where the water (tear) is, and gently pull it out and back in several times, and if the water quickly decreases, then immediately have the patient look at the object on which he was focusing his gaze, and the almond will be in his eye. [Translation note: this seems to suggest a method for treating excessive tearing or watery eyes by inserting an almond into the affected area and manipulating it gently to help redistribute fluids or relieve blockages]
E aprop repausa se un pauc; donc si la aygua es descenduda, lahoras tu depausa aquela autre veguada abantz que almagda ne sia getada.	Then rest for a moment; if the water has decreased, then you can continue to move the almond forward before it is thrown out.
E donc quan es sicada e no descen, lahoras tu extrat almagda am facilitat, e revol am aquel la tua ma pauc a pauc, e aprop dissolveys en l’aygua un petit de sal clara de gemma e am aquela lava le huel dedintz; e aprop pausa fora le huel coto o stopa o lana infusa en oli rozat e album de huou e ligua am aquo le huel sa.	Then, when it is dry and does not decrease further, gently extract the almond, slowly rubbing your hand over it, and then dissolve a small amount of rock salt in water and use that to wash the eye; then place a bandage or plug made of cotton or wool soaked in rose oil and egg white over the patient's closed eyelid. [Translation note: this passage suggests using a saline solution to rinse out the eye after treating it with the almond, followed by applying a protective bandage made from materials soaked in rose oil and egg whites]
Mays nos e aquels que so de nostre temps pause sobre aquel comi trissat am album de huou.	But there are those who prefer to apply a mixture of three hundred eggs with albumen (egg white) on the eye. [Translation note: this final line seems to suggest an alternative treatment that involves applying a large quantity of egg whites to the affected area, possibly as a protective layer or for its soothing properties]
E si no obezeys a tu almagda al intrament de l’huel per la sua duricia — quar es alcu dels homes del qual le huel es dur mot —, lahoras cove que prenguas le spatum le qual es nompnat alberid del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if the patient does not comply with the insertion of the almond into their eye due to its hardness - for some men have very hard eyes - then it is necessary to take the substance known as "alberid," which has this formula:
E donc perfora am aquel aquela conjunctura, e no ultimes la tua ma en le trauc, e no es si no que fassas via ad almagda loc subtil.	Then pierce the conjunctiva with this instrument, but do not force your hand through the hole, and instead make a subtle path for the almond to follow.
E aprop entromet almagda segon que havem dit.	Then insert the almond as we have described.
E deves le compliment de la tua obra, sia preparat al malaute dormitori descentment fayt en le qual dorma sobre le sieu dos en mayson tenebrosa, e sia prohibit de totz movementz .	And it is essential that you complete your work by preparing a comfortable bed for the patient to sleep in, with a firm mattress and soft linens, where they can rest on their back in a dark room, free from any distractions or movements.
E pausa en la natura de lu aquo per que sia linida la sua natura, e no maugua le sieu cap a la partida dreyta ni senestra de tot.	And place under the patient's head a substance that will help them rest and recover, such as a soft cushion or folded cloth, to ensure that their head is properly aligned and not tilted to one side or the other. [Translation note: this passage suggests placing a supportive cushion or cloth under the patient's head to keep their neck and spine in alignment, allowing for optimal rest and recovery]
E sia le liament segon la sua disposicio entro al tertz dia.	And let them remain in that position for the duration of the treatment, typically not longer than three days.
E aprop deslia aquel en aquela maysso tenebrosa e exproha la freol vista, e fay li vezer alcunas causas, e aprop retorna le liament entro al dia .vii.	Then on the seventh day, release them from their confinement in the dark room and let them see some sights, such as pleasant landscapes or objects, to stimulate their vision and help it recover. Afterwards, return them to their resting place for further treatment. [Translation note: this passage suggests that after a period of several days of rest and recovery, it is important to gradually reintroduce the patient to visual stimuli in order to promote healing and restore normal vision]
E no cove que fassas aquo en la hora de las curacios o tantost aprop la infusio.	And you should not perform this treatment during the hours of sunrise or immediately after an infusion (medicinal drink).
Habantz cove que tu alienes aquo per so quar la aygua puega leugierament per gran e vehement de reguardament.	It is necessary that you pay close attention and adjust the treatment accordingly, as water can easily pass through the eye due to its delicate nature. [Translation note: this passage suggests that the healer must be mindful of the sensitive nature of the eye and make adjustments to the treatment regimen based on the patient's individual needs and response to therapy]
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras cove que deslias le huel denant le vii dia, e rectifica aquel am aquo que ceda apostema.	But if an abscess forms in the eye, then you must release the patient from their confinement before the seventh day and correct the abscess with appropriate treatment. [Translation note: this passage suggests that if an infection or abscess develops during the course of treatment, it is important to adjust the regimen accordingly and provide appropriate medical interventions to address the underlying issue]
Lahoras tu absol la vista de lu e pausa sobre la cara de lu oral per le qual sia regit le vezement de lu dejos lu per alcus dias, lu existent en la mayszo tenebrosa.	Now you have completed the eye treatment and must turn your attention to the patient's mouth, placing a small piece of bread or other food on their lower lip, which they can chew and eat while remaining in the dark room for several days.
E aprop sia gitat de aquela mayzo gradantment e conversa8 en las suas causas.	Then slowly and gradually lead them out of the dark room, engaging them in conversation and introducing them to their surroundings. [Translation note: this passage suggests that it is important to reintroduce the patient to light and social interaction gradually, allowing them to adjust to their new environment while minimizing any potential discomfort or stress]
E sapias que in alchatea no es excusat le discipol de visio alcunas veguadas, e lahoras tu sias ardit sobre la operacio.	And be aware that in the practice of alchemy, it is not uncommon for a student to experience various visual phenomena during their studies, and so you should not be afraid to perform this operation with confidence. [Translation note: this passage suggests that the use of almonds or other substances to manipulate the eye or treat eye conditions was a common practice in medieval alchemy, and that students of this art should not be deterred by any unusual visual effects they may experience during their training]
E ja es pervengut a nos de alcu de aquels les quals so al Artach , e alcu disse que fayt foc en al Ayrac magdaam perforat am le qual es succada la aygua.	And it has come to our attention that some of those who practice the art of alchemy use a burning fire in a perforated almond-shaped vessel, which is said to draw out water from the body. [Translation note: this passage suggests that some practitioners of alchemy used heat and specialized equipment, such as perforated almond-shaped vessels, to manipulate fluids or substances within the body for medicinal purposes]
Mays empero yeu non e vist degu en la nostra terra le qual haia perfeyt aquo, ni e aquo legit en alcu dels libres dels antics; e es possible que aquo sia novel.	However, we have not seen any evidence of this practice in our own land, nor is it mentioned in any of the books of the ancients, and so it is possible that this technique is a recent innovation. [Translation note: this passage suggests that while some practitioners of alchemy may claim to use specialized equipment or techniques for medicinal purposes, these practices may not be grounded in traditional knowledge or scientific evidence]
E aquestas so las formas de las specias de magdaan per que sia sobre aquelas aquel le qual ignora aquelas:	These are the forms of almond-shaped vessels that one might use if they are unfamiliar with them:
E sian faytas de eram o de ferr propriament, e sian las extramitatz de lor am aquesta subtilitat triangulada, la extremitat aguda ayssi cum aquela es la forma.	They are made of clay or iron, and have protrusions at the ends that are shaped like triangles with sharp points, similar to the almond shape described earlier. [Translation note: this passage clarifies that the almond-shaped vessels mentioned earlier can be made of either clay (eram) or iron (ferr), and provides a more detailed description of their physical form]
Capitol .xxiv.	Chapter 24.
De la curacio de carn nada en le nas.	On the treatment of fleshy growths in the nose.
Quan en le nas so nascudas carns diversas ajustadas de las quals es alcuna causa la qual es assemblada a scorpio de motz pes, o a polip peys; e aquesta malautia es apelada polipus quar es a semblansa de aquel peys representat.	When fleshy growths appear in the nose that are different from one another and have a cause similar to the sting of a heavy scorpion or a polypous foot; this illness is called polyps because it resembles that represented foot.
E de lu es carn cancrosa, lapadea, de fusca color; e de lu es que es carn leon no de color fusca.	And this is fleshy cancer, scabbed, of a dark color; and it is that which is flesh like a lion, not of a dark color.
Donc en aquela que es en aquestas carns leon no fraudulenta ni cancroza, cove que fassas le malaute sezer entre las tuas mas e posat al solelh, e huebre las nars de lu, e picoys le tieu onci en aquelas carns.	Therefore, in that which is not false or cancerous in these fleshy growths, it is necessary to place the patient sitting between your arms and expose them to the sun, and have them breathe through their nose, and then gently pick at those growths with a fingernail.
E aprop extrat aquela a las partidas deforo, e aprop inscindeys aquo que has comprehendut de aquelas am spatum agut subtil de la una partida entro que sapias que tota la carn ja es ostada; que si roman de lu deguna causa de la qual la abscisio es possibla, lahoras tu ratz aquo am la un dels estrumentz subtils am facilitat entro que de lu romangua denguna causa.	Then remove that which is outside the openings and cut away what you have understood of it with a sharp spatula from one side, so that you know that all the flesh has been removed; if any cause remains for an abscess to form, then quickly remove that with one of the fine instruments with ease before any cause remains.
Mays si senhoreja am sanc o accida apostema caut, lahoras tu pausa a lu aquo que cove; o es dels apostemas malignes, lahoras tu coyta e cauteriza aquel entro que sia abscindit sanc e sian ostadas las cavas totas.	But if an abscess or fever develops, then you must stop the treatment and apply what is necessary; that is, for malignant abscesses, you should consider cauterization after bleeding has been stopped and all cavities have been cleared.
E aprop sia getatz en le nas aprop la inscizio vi agre e aygua o vi.	Then insert into the nose during the incision a mixture of vinegar and water or wine.
Mays si le nas es ubert e de lu procezeys humiditat entro al palat, lahoras sapias que ja es sanat.	But if the nose is open and there is a process of moisture within the palate, then you should know that it has healed.
Mays si la humiditat no penetra segon que cove, lahoras tu sapias que dedintz lu es carn nada en los pus sobiras osses de las nars als quals non es pervengut abscizio.	But if the moisture does not penetrate as it should, then you should know that inside there is flesh in the upper bones of the nose to which abscess has not reached.
Donc lahoras cove que entromitas fiel de li al qual sia alcuna grosseza, e nuza en lu motz nuzes, e pausa entre quascun nutz la quantitat del dit o mens, e engene le malaute e entromet una extremitat del fiel en le nars am lo ray o am autra causa la qual es a lu possibla.	Therefore, now it is necessary to insert a piece of liver into the one who has some swelling, and place many small pieces in it, and between each piece put the quantity of a finger or less, and massage the patient and insert one end of the liver into the nose with a ray or another means that is possible for them.
E pus que aquo aura fayt, que atire le sieu odorament entro que pervengua a las canals de las nars, e sia eyssit sobre le sieu golayro, quar tropas veguadas le semblant ad aquesta accio fan les enfantz a las scolas, e es leugiera causa ad aquel que ho vol far.	And after that has been done, then let them inhale their fragrance so that it reaches the passages of the nose and exits through their nostrils, for many children at school do similar things and it is a light cause for those who wish to do it.
E aprop pausa las dos extramitatz del fiel, una extremitat que iesca sobre le nas et l’autra que romangua en le nas, e aprop aministra serratura de carn am les nuzes que so en le fiel, e fay aquo entro que sapias que las carn ja so am les nuzes del fiel.	And then position the two ends of the reins, one end emerging on the nose and the other remaining in the nose, and then administer skin sutures with the nodules that are on the reins, and do so until you know that the flesh is sutured to the nodules of the reins.
E aprop extratz le fiel, e pausa en le nas aprop la abstraccio del sanc una calgua , e fay aquo per tres dias o mays entro que l’enguent corrodo tot aquo que es romas de las carns.	And then extract the reins and place them in the nose with a small piece of sanitary cloth, and do this for three days or more until the ointment has dissolved all that is necrotic from the flesh.
E aprop en la fi de la causa, pausa en le nas una canula de plom per alscus jorns entro que sia sanat.	And at the end of treatment, place a lead cannula in the nose for several days until it has healed.
Mays si endigeys de curacio que exsique, usa de aquela.	But if you find that healing by drying is necessary, use this method.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument a capipurge fazedor am le qual son distillatz olis e medicinas en le nars:	And this is the shape of the instrument for purging the nose with which oils and medicines are distilled into the nostrils.
E fay aquo de argent o de eram, la qual sia semblant a una petita lampesa uberta, ayssi cum petita conqua, e le meat semblantment.	And make it of silver or copper, shaped like a small open lamp, similar to a small basin, with a spout.
E si vols, fay una canula clausa ayssi cum cana, e la cancula del estrument a capipurge fazedor e sia plana, descuberta; a la qual sia manubre en lo derier de lu, am le qual tenguas aquela quan escaufas en lu oli o aquo que tu vols dels sucs e de las causas suctiblas.	And if you wish, make a closed cannula like a reed, and the cannula of the purging nose instrument should be flat and open; it should have a handle at the back, with which you can hold the instrument when heating oil or any other liquid that you want to use for suction.
E aquestz capipurgi es precios: recipe de enforbi de castor, de balayra blanc, de giengiebre, e piletre de safra, de pebre lonc, de escafragia, de epetum de spic ana unc. vi cumfizeys am suc de bleda e de caul, e sian faytas pillulas, e sia destemprada una pillula am aygua tebeza, e sia gitat en las nars del malaute jasent envers.	And these purging methods are valuable: make a recipe using castoreum, white bdellium, ginger, saffron, long pepper, asafetida, and epepum of spica each one ounce. And mix it with the juice of beetroot and cabbage, and make pills, and soak one pill in warm water, and then insert it into the patient's nostrils facing upwards.
Capitol .xxv.	Chapter 25.
De theyls natz en las extramitatz del nas.	Of teething in the nostrils.
Motas veguadas es nat theyl en las extramitatz del nas, e es magnificat e omentat en alscus dias entro en que mot es leg le reguardament de lu.	It is often observed that a teething occurs in the nostrils, and it becomes larger and more noticeable in some days until its growth is noticed.
E per aquo cove que tu inscidas aquel en le comensament de la apparissio de lu, e erediques tot aquel.	And so it is necessary to insert something in the beginning of its appearance, and you should remove all of it.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc o cauteri o medicina comburent la qual estia en loc de lu.	Then place over the area a hot iron or a burning medicine where it is needed.
Mays si es tardada la sua inscizio entro que sia magnificat, lahoras considera si es lapificat, dur, de fusca color e de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr quar es apostema crancos; quar motas veguadas ad aquel que inscideys aquesta apostema endeve per lu granda malicia sobre aquel le qual aquel havia.	But if the insertion is delayed and it has become larger, then consider whether it is hardened, dry, with a dark color, and with little feeling; then do not touch it with an iron because it is a cancerous abscess; for many times those who lance this type of abscess cause great harm to the person.
E si le apostema es de leon tocament e no es de fosca color, e vezes que inscizio es possibla en tot aquel, lahoras evacua le malaute e inscideys aquel senes temor, e cura le loc am aquo que exsique e costrenh entro que sia sanat.	And if the abscess is of a lion's touch and not dark colored, and it is possible to make an incision in all of it, then evacuate the patient and make an incision without fear, and heal the area with a drying and constricting agent until it heals.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter 26.
De sutura del nas e de las labias e de la aurelha quan la continuitat es dissolvuda per plagua o per semblantz.	Of the suture of the nose, lips, and ear when continuity is lost due to plague or similar causes.
Sapias que quan accideys solucio de continuitat en una de aquestas cartillages, pauc confereys en aquela operacio sino en alcus homes.	Know that when there is a solution of continuity in one of these cartilaginous tissues, it does not require much intervention in the operation, except in some cases.
Donc cove, quan endeve ad alcu alcuna causa de aquelas, que consideres si es plagua fresca am le sieu sanc, e lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Therefore, when you are treating any cause of this condition, consider whether it is a fresh wound with pus, and then you should bring together the two lips of the wound with sutures, and then heal it until it heals.
E si las labias de solucio de continuitat so ja separadas, e quascuna es fayta sana, lahoras cove que tu excorjes quascuna partida de la sua codena apparent entro que n’iesca sanc.	And if the lips of the wound are already separated and each one has formed a healthy surface, then it is necessary to cut off each piece of its edges until pus comes out.
E aprop ajusta las doas labias am sutura e strenh aquelas, e sobre aquelas pulveriza sanc de drago e enses trissat, e pausa sobre la polvera una pessa de emplaustra diafinicon, o de alcu autre dels emplastres consolidatius, e leyssa aquel liat per dos jorns o per tres, e aprop deslia aquel e permuta aquel emplaustre e leyssa aquel entro que·ls fiels per si sian abscinditz, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then bring together the two lips of the wound with sutures and heal them, and then sprinkle dragon's blood powder on top and leave it for three days, and place over the powder a plaster such as diascordium or any other consolidating plaster, and let it remain in place for two or three days. Then remove the plaster and replace it with another one, and let it remain until the pus has been released on its own, and then heal it with an ointment until it heals completely.
Mays la manieyra de la sutura es que tu agregues la solucio de continuitat o am agulhas ayssi cum havem recomtat en la sutura del ventre, o agregua la solucio de continuitat am fiel ayssi cum a tu e fayt saber.	But the method of suturing is that you bring together the solution of continuity with needles as we have recommended in the suturing of the belly, or use reeds to do so.

De extraccio de aquela causas que veno en las doas labias en las partidas dedintz.	Of the removal of causes that appear between the two lips on the inside.

Many times it happens to many people that they have hard abscesses in the inner parts of their lips that resemble fat from pigs, some are smaller and others are larger.

Therefore, it is advisable to stretch the lips and open each of those hardenings completely, then perform an incision and fill the area with turpentine until the pus has been restricted, then wash the area with vinegar and treat it with a styptic agent until it heals completely.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter 28.
De inscizio de la carn ajustada en las gengivas.	Of incising the attached skin on the gums.
Granre de veguadas nays sobre la gengiva carn ajustada la qual les antics apelero albulus, adonc cove que tu suspendas aquela am onci o que tenguas aquela am las forfecs e inscidas aquela deves la sua razit, e leyssas la sania correr o le sanc.	It often happens that there is a growth of attached skin on the gums, which ancient physicians called albulus, and therefore it is necessary to suspend it with an instrument or hold it with forceps and make an incision in its root, and let the pus or blood flow out.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc sagi trissat o autra polveras stipticas o excicativas.	Then place turpentine or other styptic or desiccant powders over the incision.

Capitol .xxix.	Chapter 29.
De razo de dentz am ferr.	Chapter 29: On Making Teeth with Iron
Quan en la superficia de las dentz de las partidas dedintz e de las de foro e entre las gingivas so ajustadas escorsas aspras, legas, e alcunas veguadas son de nigradas e son faytas citrinas o vertz entro que a la gingiva ve per aquo corrupcio e son faytas las dentz legas.	When the surface of the teeth, both in the inner parts and outer parts, as well as between the gums, there are hard, rough and sometimes blackish formations that look like citrine or green stones, which cause corruption to the gum and make the teeth loose.
E donc cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute entre las tuas mas e pausar le cap de lu en le tieu se, e ratz las dents en las quals apareysso aquelas escorsas e causas semblantz arena entro que de lor no romangua deguna causa, e aquo fay de la negror e de la citrinitat e de las autras entro que sian mondificadas.	And therefore it is necessary to make the patient sit between your legs and hold their head in your lap, then use a file or similar instrument to scrape the teeth where these hardenings and causes resembling sand are present until none remain, taking care to remove any blackness, citrinitas, and other impurities until they are cleansed.
Donc si es ostat aquo que es en aquelas del comensament de la razio, bo es; e sino, lahoras tu itera la razio sobre aquelas al autra dia e al segon e al tertz entro que vengua al derier stament en aquo que tu vols.	And if what is present in the beginning of the procedure is satisfactory, then that is good; but if not, then you should repeat the procedure on the following day and for several days after until it reaches the desired result.
E sapias que las dentz han necessitat de motz rezoris de diversas formas e de motas figuras segon que es preparat a la tua operacio.	And know that teeth require many types of rasps with various shapes and forms, depending on the operation being performed.
E per so quar le razori am le qual la dent es raza de la partida dedintz es autre del razori am le qual es ras entre las dentz segon autras formas, e aquestas formas de razoris sian deves tu preparadas las quals veyras tantost:	And so because the rasp used to shape the tooth from the inner side is different from the one used to shape it between the teeth, there are various forms of rasps that you must prepare. Here are some of them:
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter 30.
D’eradicacio de dentz.	Chapter 30: Extraction of Teeth
Cove que tu cures la dent de la sua dolor am tot engen e tardes en tota eradicacio de lu, quar no es denguna causa que suplisqua la veguada de lu quan es eradicada, quar es sustancia sublima entro que es excusacio en la eradicacio de lu.	It is necessary to cure the tooth of its pain with all care and patience in every extraction, because there is no cause that can replace it when it is extracted, because it is a subtle substance that is released during its extraction.
Mays cove quan le malaute es forsat aquela dent eradicar, que fermament deves tu sia certificat quala es la dent dolent, quar motas veguadas la dolor descep le malaute e cuga que sia en dent sana, e tu eradicas aquela e aprop la dolor no cessa entro que la dent malauta e dolent sia eradicada, quar nos ja havem vist aquo per operacio dels barbies.	Surely when the patient is forced to remove that tooth, you must be absolutely certain which tooth is causing pain, for many times the pain deceives the patient and they think a healthy tooth is causing pain, and you end up removing the wrong one while the actual painful tooth remains. For we have seen this happen in the work of barbers.
Donc cum deves tu es sertificat qual es la dent dolent, e que o sabes be, lahoras cove que tu scarifiques en le circuit de la dent am spatum en le qual sia alcuna vertut, entro que sia dissolvut de la dent de la gingiva de tota partida, e aprop mau aquel am les tieus ditz, o am forfexs subtils al comensament petit a petit entro que aquela concucesquas.	Therefore, how do you determine which tooth is causing pain? Well, you should scarify the gum line around the tooth with a spatula containing some kind of substance with healing properties, until the tooth becomes loose from the gum all around its edges. Then use a small pair of forceps to gently wiggle the tooth back and forth until it comes out.
E aprop alogua en lu fortz tenalhas grans per bona loquacio o estuptura fort, e pausa le cap del malaute entre les tieus denolhs que be le tengues que no·s maugua, e aprop tratz la dent segon rectitut en manieyra que no trenques aquela, ni al malaute major dolor no dones.	And then apply large, strong tongs to the patient's mouth, making sure they are comfortable and can breathe easily. Then pull the tooth straight up, using gentle but firm pressure to avoid breaking it or causing unnecessary pain to the patient.
E donc si no es foro-getat, lahoras pren un de aquels instrumentz, e met aquel dejos lu de tota part am facilitat e esforsa la remocio de lu ayssi que es feyt al comensament.	And so if the tooth has not already fallen out on its own, take one of those instruments and insert it beneath the tooth with ease and apply gentle but firm pressure to remove it, just as you did at the beginning.
Mays si la dent es trauquada o corrosa, lahoras cove que tu comples de drap aquel trauc e estrenguas aquel am la extremitat de ray subtil per so que no sia trinquada en la hora de la tua constriccio sobre aquela am tenalas.	But if the tooth is broken or decayed, then you must first wrap it in cloth to protect yourself from sharp edges and splinters. Then use a thin piece of wire to securely hold the cloth in place and prevent any fragments from getting lost during extraction.
E cove que tu obres exquesitament am scarificacio en le circuit de tota part de la gingiva e guarda mot la tua fortaleza que no trenques aquela e romangua partida de lu, e retorne sobre le malaute per la malicia que sia majo que la primieyra dolor de lu.	It is essential that you proceed with care and make incisions in the gum line all around the tooth, taking great care not to break it or leave any fragments behind. Be sure to maintain your strength and control throughout the procedure, as the pain may worsen before it improves.
E guarda te que no fassas aquo que fan alscus ignorantz barbiers en lor fistinacio e audacia sobre la eradicacio de lor, ses que no aministran aquo que nos havem recomtat; quar motas veguadas fan venir sobre les homes malautias grans las quals son pus dificils que sian trinquadas, e las razitz de lor remaugudas totas, o alcunas de aquelas, o que extrayguas aquela am alcus osses de la mandigula ayssi cum motas veguadas havem testificat.	Be careful not to make the same mistakes as some ignorant barbers who, in their haste and recklessness during tooth extractions, fail to administer proper pain relief or aftercare. This can lead to serious complications that are difficult to treat. In particular, beware of removing healthy teeth along with fragments of bone from the jaw, which I have seen happen many times before.
E aprop la eradicacio de lu sia lavada la boca am vi caut o vi agre am sal.	And after extracting the tooth, rinse the patient's mouth with wine or vinegar mixed with salt to clean and disinfect the wound.
E si endeve fluxs de sanc per aysso, ayssi cum motas veguadas endeve, lahoras trissa alcuna quantitat de zegi e aspergeys sobre la plagua, e si no confereys aquel zegi, cauteriza.	If there is excessive bleeding after the extraction, apply a compress of crushed yarrow and sprinkle some on the wound. If this does not stop the bleeding, use a hot iron to cauterize the area.
La forma de las forceps e tenalas subtils am las quals es mauguda la dent al comensament sia de longua extramitat, de breu manubre e gros, per so que no sian doblatz quan am aquels deves obrar.	The shape of the forceps and thin tongs used to extract teeth should have a long handle, a short grip, and be sturdy, so that they do not bend when you use them.
E sian ayssi cum vezes de gros manubre entro que quan estrenhas am aquelas no sian dobladas, sian breus extramitatz.	And they should also have a wide grip so that when you clamp down on them, they do not bend or break. They should have short handles to allow for precise movements and control during extraction.
E sian faytas de ferr de India descentment faytas de dreytas extramitatz, e en las extramitatz de aquelas sian dentz de las quals las unas intron en las autras e estrenhan per constriccio descent fort, e alscunas veguadas las extramitatz de aquelas sian la forma del bec d’un auzel le qual ha nom ciconia, so es guanta, e son de fort constriccio.	And they should be made of Indian steel, with straight handles and small teeth at the ends that interlock and tighten when squeezed. Some forceps have a curved shape like a stork's beak for extra precision and strong clamping power.
Capitol .xxxi.	Capital XXxi.
De erradicacio de dentz e d‘estraccio dels osses de las mandibulas trincadas.	On the removal of teeth and extraction of bones trapped in the jaw.
Quan deves la eradicacio de dent le qual es trinquat roman alcuna causa, lahoras cove que tu pauses sobre le loc coto am boder per un jorn o per dos entro que·l loc sia mollificat; e aprop entromet algesti o tenalhas las extramitatz de las quals so asembladas al bec de un auzel apelat ciconia o guanta, la forma de las forceps:	When you need to extract a tooth that is trapped for some reason, it is necessary to place a compress on the affected area and leave it there for one or two days until the area becomes soft. de la triangulada extremitat torta o curta, la qual sia alcuna grossesa, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	With a curved or short triangular tip that is thick and not rounded, to prevent it from slipping during use.
E otra sapias que·ls instrumentz de las dentz motz so e semblantment les autres instruments.	And remember that the instruments for extracting molars are similar to those used for other dental procedures.
Mays le artifexs savi e subtil en l’art, atroba per si mateys segon aquo que a lu significa la operacio e las malautias diversas; quar son de las malautias a las quals les antics no diysero ni pausero propri instrument, per las formas de diversas specias.	However, skilled and clever practitioners in the art can find suitable tools for themselves based on their understanding of the operation and various conditions, as there are many conditions that ancient texts did not mention or provide specific instruments for due to their unique forms and variations.

E sia en lu alcuna grosseza petit a petit, e sia instringida o tenguda am la boca per que no evasesca o fuga entro que l’os de tot sia foro-getat; e aprop restaura le loc am medicinas convenientz ad aquo.	And it should be thick enough to prevent any fluids from escaping, and held in place with the mouth so that no air or liquids can enter until the bone is fully extracted. Capitol .xxxii.	Capital XXXII.
De la cura de las dentz eminentz sobre las autras.	Capital XXXIII.
Quan las dentz so eminentz no segon lor cors natural per aquelas la forma es laga, e majorment quan endeve a las femnas, e majorment a las piuselas venerablas; donc cove que tu consideras: si dent es nada aprop autra dent, e no es possibla sarradura ni linament de lu, lahoras radica aquela; mays que no sia annexa am autra dent, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am aquest instrument del qual aquesta es la forma; e es semblant a morr de porc, e sia feyt de ferr de India de extramitat mot aguda.	When teeth protrude unnaturally and are misshapen, especially in women and particularly in elderly women, you should consider the following: if a tooth does not touch another tooth, and there is no possibility of suturing or applying a liniment to it, then extract that tooth. However, if the tooth is connected to another tooth, do not extract it; instead, use this instrument with the following shape to remove excess tissue: it resembles a pig's snout and should be made of high-quality Indian steel with a very sharp edge.
E sia la tua inscizio am la qual inscideyses aquela en trops dias per la duricia de la dent, e que no sia comauguda autra de las dentz.	And make your incision with this instrument, which will allow you to remove the excess tissue in just a few days due to the hardness of the tooth, and without damaging any other teeth.
E si es dent eminent expausat a limadura, lahoras lima aquel am lima de ferr de India del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if it is a protruding tooth that has become sharp or jagged, then file down the rough edges with this file made of Indian steel, which looks like this:
E sia tot de ferr de India e·l margua eysament; e sia de motz menutz puntz ayssi cum lima am la qual son faytas agulhas, am la qual la dent sia limada pauc a pauc en motz dias am fecilitat, per so que no sia autra dent comauguda e caga.	And it should be made entirely of Indian steel, with many small points like a needle file, which can be used to gradually file down the tooth over several days with ease and without damaging any other teeth or causing pain.
E aprop lineys aquela en la fi, e ratz aquela am alscus razoris.	And tie (that area) at the end, and cut it with some razors.
