Forma de instrument am le qual la femna es sub-fumiguada deves la retentio de mestruas e de la segondina:	The form of an instrument used for fumigating women during menstrual retention and foreign body (splinter) embedment:
Sia fayta de veyre o de eram.	The form can be made of glass or copper:
E sia pausada la extremitat subtil en le conh e la extremitat ampla sobre le foc, e la sub-fumiguacio sia pausada sobre las brazas del foc.	The slender end of the instrument should be inserted into the wound while the wider end rests on the fire. The fumigation process takes place above the embers:
E tengua aquela entro que sia consumida aquela sub-fumiguacio e itera·n autra.	And keep the instrument inside until the fumigation is consumed and repeat the process:
De curacio del cul del enfant no-perforat.	On treating a non-perforated child's buttocks (a newborn with an imperforate anus):
Motz enfantz naysso e les culs de lu no so perforatz, les quals ya ciphac subtil e opilat.	When newborn babies are born and their buttocks appear closed and clogged:
Adonc cove a la matrona que perfore am le sieu dit aquel ciphac; e sino, perfora aquel am spatum agut, e guarda se que no toque le lacert.	Therefore, the midwife should use her finger to perforate that closure. If not, then use a sharp spatula to do so, ensuring not to touch the artery:
E aprop pause sobre aquel lana enfusa en vi e oli; e aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia senat.	Then place wool soaked in wine and oil over it, and cover the area with an ointment until it heals:
Mays si temes que sia opilat, lahoras pausa en le trauc una canula per motz dias, e osta la quan le enfant voldra degerir.	But if you fear that it may become clogged again, then insert a cannula into the opening for several days and remove it when the baby desires to defecate:
E ja accideys oppilacio del cul per consolidacio de plagua o de apostema; adonc cove que aquela consolidacio sia inscidida, e aprop sia curada am aquo que avem dit de la curacio e del plom.	And already happens, an obstruction of the buttock due to the hardening of a wound or abscess; then it is necessary that this hardening be lanced, and be cured with what we have said about the treatment and lead.
De curacio de las fistulas que endeveno dejos.	Of the treatment of fistulas that form below.
Las fistulas que endeveno en la partida dejos pus bassa so nodacio e grossetut las quals endeveno prop del cul defora o en l’espazi de la una partida.	Fistulas that form in the lower part are knotted and thick, which form near the buttocks outside or in the area of one side.
E es una fistula o motas.	And it is a fistula or an abscess.
E cum aquela nodacio es antiquada e corr de la humiditat aygosa blanca o poyridura subtil, e alcunas veguadas so de aquestas fistulas alcunas penetrantz.	And when this knot is old and has dried from the moisture of white watery pus or thin powder, and sometimes these fistulas have some openings.
E aquelas penetrantz so conogudas per aquo que es eyssit de aquelas per la egressio e per ventosetat; e alcunas vetz use le malaute de egressio, e fort leu es eyssit de aquelas verm.	And these openings are known because something exits from them through egression and windiness; sometimes the patient uses egression, and often it is easy for worms to exit from them.
E so de aquelas fistulas alcunas veguadas en l’espazi penetrantz entro a la vesica, e entro al meat de la vergua; e so de aquelas penetrantz entro la junctura de la coyssa e entro al notz de la coeta.	And sometimes these fistulas have openings that penetrate into the bladder, and into the flesh of the penis; and sometimes they penetrate into the joint of the thigh, and into the node of the testicle.
E aquo en que es conoguda fistula penetrant entro al cul e no-penetrant, es que tu metas le tieu dit endic en le cul, e entrometas tenta subtil de eram o de ferr en la fistula quan no y es turtuositat.	And what makes a penetrating or non-penetrating fistula known is that you insert your finger into the anus and gently introduce a thin piece of lead or iron into the fistula if there is no curvature.
Mays si en aquela es turtuositat, lahoras entromet en aquela tenta subtil de plom o de pels de caval entro que tu sentas la tenta o le pel en le tieu dit.	But if there is curvature in this one, then introduce a thin piece of lead or horsehair into it until you feel it with your finger.
E si no sentas aquela de tot ni no procezeys del trauc alcuna causa de egestio ni verm ni ventositat, ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras sapias que es no-penetrant, e lahoras coyta te a la curacio.	And if you do not feel it at all or make any progress due to some cause of egestion, worms, or flatulence, as we have said, then you know that it is non-penetrating, and then proceed with the treatment.
E quan la fistula es penetrant entro a la vesica o entro al meat de la vergua, lahoras la significacio de lu es eyssiment de urina de aquela e prohibicio de lu ad aysso que·l loc am medicina sia consolidat.	And when the fistula penetrates into the bladder or into the flesh of the penis, then the symptom of it is the excretion of urine from that one and prevention of it until the area has been consolidated with medicine.
Mays si es penetrant entro la junctura de la coyssa o entro al os e envencio de dolor en le circuit, lahoras senhal de lu es que la tenta perve entro aqui si en lu no es turtuositat entro al os, e envencio de dolor en le circuit de la partida; e que de lu yeys poyredura tostemps; e que no val en aquela medicacio, ni es consolidada am enguent.	But if it penetrates into the joint of the thigh or into the bone and causes pain in the surrounding area, then the symptom of it is that a probe can enter easily into it if there is no curvature in the bone, and there is pain in the surrounding area of the affected part; and there is always pus coming from it; and it does not respond to any medicine, nor is it consolidated with ointment.
E en totas aquelas fistulas penetrant no es curacio de tot, e la curacio de aquelas es trebalh e vanetat dels folyls metges sobre·l qual so fermatz.	And in all penetrating fistulas, there is no complete cure, and the treatment of these is laborious and futile on the part of foolish doctors who are mistaken.
Mays en aquela que no es penetrant e no antiqua, sanacio am ferr es sperada segon que yeu a tu recomtare, e aquo que ja yeu e proat.	But in one that is not penetrating and not old, healing with iron is expected, according to what I have told you and proven.
E es que le malaute jagua entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos e eleva las cambas de lu entro sus, las coyssas sian enclinadas al ventre de lu, e aprop entromet tenta de plom, o de eram si es en la fistula turtuositat, entro que sapias le loc on perve la tenta.	And it is that the patient lies on their back with their hands under their hips and raises their legs into the air, the thighs are inclined toward the stomach, and then gently introduce a lead probe or an iron one if there is curvature in the fistula until you know where the probe can enter.
E si aquela sent le malaute entorn le cuol, lahora cove que tu entrometas le tieu dit endic en le cuol.	And if the patient feels it around the anus, then it is necessary to insert your finger into the anus.
E si sentas en le tieu dit la tenta ja per si meteyssa descuberta penetrar, otra aquo que sentas entre le tieu dit e aquela siphac o carn, lahoras sapias certanament que aquela es penetrant; e adonc no trebalhes en aquela, quar no es en aquela sanacio, ayssi cum havem dit.	And if you feel the probe with your finger already inserted and penetrating on its own without touching it with your finger or flesh, then you know certainly that this one is penetrating; and then do not work on it, because there is no healing in it, as we have said.
Mays empero diyssero alcus que es sana en alcus homes tart.	But they say abscesses can be healed in some slow-healing men.
E de la medicacio per la qual es sperat juvament en lu es que tu ignes cauteri subtil segon le ample de la fistula, ayssi cum es precedit, e intrometas aquel ignit en la fistula entro que pervengua entorn le cuol; e aprop itera aquel doas o tres vetz entro que sapias que ja son adhustas totas aquelas carns ajustadas fistuladas que so semblantz a cana de pluma de ausel.	And the medicine by which there is hope for help in it is that you light a pointed cautery of appropriate size according to the width of the fistula, as mentioned before, and insert this fire into the fistula until it reaches around the anus; and then repeat this two or three times until you know that all the diseased flesh has been completely burned and resembles feathers of birds.
E aprop cura aquela am calguas envolopadas en boder entro que en yescan totas aquelas carns que so adhustas, e aprop cura aquela am medicinas la carn engendrantz e consolidantz, e si es sanada, bo es; e sino, lahoras no es sana en degun temps per autra curacio.	And treat that with bandages wrapped in linen until all the burned flesh has healed, and then treat it with wound-healing medicines to generate and consolidate the flesh, and if it is healed, then it is good; but if not, then it is never healed at any time by another treatment.
E si la tenta intra, e no penetra entro·l tieu dit le qual es en le cul, e entre aquel e la tenta que es velament spes de carn o de ciphac, e vezes la fistula en aquo que siec la superficia de la codena, lahoras secca la codena del comensament de la fistula, e tu ve seccan am la tenta, e sia en la fistula entro que la seccio pervengua al loc en le qual perve la extremitat de la tenta, e per la tenta es liberat e catz.	And if the probe enters and does not penetrate into your finger that is in the anus, and between them there is a thin layer of flesh or membrane, sometimes the fistula is in this area where it dries out the surface of the anus, then dry out the anus from the beginning of the fistula with the probe, and you see it drying with the probe, and keep it inside the fistula until the drying reaches the location where the end of the probe is, and the obstruction is released and cured through the probe.
E aprop mundifiqua aquelas carns fistuladas las quals so asembladas a canula de pena de ausel e no romangua de aquelas alcuna causa.	And then clean the fistulous flesh which resembles feathers of birds and ensure that there is no remaining cause in it.
Mays si flux de sanc vezes que vengua entre tu e la tua opperacio quan ensideysses aquelas carns, lahoras le milh que sia e del pus leugier instrument es cauterizar am foc o am medicina acuta, quar cauteri am foc ajusta bonas doas habitutz: so es adhustio de aquelas carns ajustadas, e abscizio del sanc exseccacio de las humiditatz.	But if blood flows sometimes instead of pus when you insert the probe into the flesh, then let it be, and use a light instrument to cauterize with fire or sharp medicine, because cautery with fire has two good habits: one is burning of the diseased flesh, and the second is cutting off the flow of blood by drying out the moisture.
E aprop cura aquela am calguas envolopadas en boder o en caus trissat entro que·l loc geta brac, e aprop lahoras cura la plagua am enguentz carn dura engendran e consolidan.	And treat it with bandages wrapped in linen or in horse hair until the location discharges pus, and then treat the wound with hard flesh-generating and consolidating ointments.
E so medicinas en las quals so stipticitat e exseccio; quan lahoras es restaurada ja es sanada e no temes iteracio.	And these are medicines that have astringent and drying properties; when they are used, the location is restored and healed, and there is no fear of recurrence.
Mays si la fistula ja perve entro al preon del cul e es elonguada de lu superficia del cos, lahoras entromet le tieu dit en le cul e inquireys am aquel.	But if the fistula has already reached the anus and is elongated from the surface of the body, then insert your finger into the anus and search with it.
E donc si centes la tenta e entre tu e ela es velament de ciphac o de carn, e es propda a la penetracio, lahora no es operacio en lu sino segon via di fiducia e de speransa.	And therefore if you feel the probe and between it and the flesh or membrane there is a thin layer that is close to penetration, then it is not surgery in it but rather through faith and hope.
La qual causa es aministrar en lu una de tres manieyras: o que cauterize aquela ayssi cum havem dit; o que secces aquela entro que consieguas la conquavitat de lu per que sia a tu possible entrometre las qualcas e la curacio propdana; e no procesiscas mot am seccio per so que no inscidas le lacert contenent le cuol, e que accidisque sobre le malaute eyssiment de la egistio ses voluntat; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit quar fort leu sira sanat; o que elongues aquel velament e mondes aquel pus que seccas aquel entro prop le cul, ayssi cum havem dit, o am tenta o am autre instrument de aguda extremitat, e aprop mondifique aquelas carns fistuladas las quals so en la seccio entro la on podes am percrustacio; e aprop esforsa te a far la restauracio de tota la plagua am seccio, e si le orrifici pus desus no es consolidat, e romangua la fistula uberta en la partida del cul, e sira pus leugier per le malaute.	Which means that one of three methods should be administered to it: either cauterize it as we have said; or dry it out until you achieve the cavity so that it is possible for you to insert any instrument and perform the appropriate treatment, but do not cause any injury in drying so that you do not cut the ligament that holds up the anus, causing involuntary excretion from the patient; and treat it with what we have said, because it will be easily healed; or lengthen this thin layer and clean out the pus that is close to the anus with a probe or another sharp instrument, and then clean the fistulous flesh in the section where you can perform incision; and then make every effort to restore the entire wound with incision, and if the opening of the pus above it is not consolidated and the fistula remains open in the part of the anus, it will be easier for the patient to heal.
E alscunas veguadas la fistula es finida segon aquesta manieyra: es quan tu entrometas la tenta en la fistula, e es en le latz del cul entorn la superficia del cos am la codena e en le marge del cul, lahoras pren tenta de perforada extremitat, que es ayssi cum agulha de preparantz les coers segon aquesta forma:	And sometimes the fistula ends in this way: when you insert the probe into the fistula, it is near the ligament of the anus around the surface of the body with the anus and on the edge of the anus, then take a probe with a perforated tip, which is like a needle for preparing hearts in this form:
e entromet en aquela fiel envolopat de v fiels o entorn aquels; e aprop entromet tenta am fiel en la fistula entro que consiegua la conquavitat de lu.	and insert it into the vein wrapped in five veins or around them, and then insert the probe with the vein into the fistula until you achieve its cavity.
Mays si es penetrant en le marge del cul prop dedintz, lahoras tu extratz le fiel de aquel trauc ayssi que tu intrometas le tieu dit en le cul; e extraguas la extremitat del fiel e ajustes las duas extremitatz essemps, e estrenh cascuna, e leyssa aquo per un dia o per dos, e quan mays inscideys le fiel en la carn, estrenh be aquel entro que aquelas carns sian inscididas las quals so entre doas extremitatz del fiel e que cajan.	But if it is penetrating into the edge of the anus close to the inside, then you extract the vein from that hole and insert your finger into the anus, extracting the end of the vein and adjusting both ends equally, tightening each one, and leaving it for a day or two. And when you cut the vein in the flesh, make sure to tighten it well so that the flesh between the two ends of the vein is cut and falls out.
E aprop cura la plagua entro que sia consolidada e sanada.	And then treat the wound until it is consolidated and healed.
Mays si le orrifici de la fistula no es penetrant, lahoras fay aquel penetrar, en qualque manieyre sia a tu preparat, sino que sia mot en le preon, quar no es a tu que fassas aquo per que no inscidas le lacert; e aprop fay am aquela entro que sia sanada.	If the opening of the fistula is not penetrating, then make it penetrate, using any means you have at your disposal, as long as it does not cause excessive pain, for it is not your goal to increase suffering; and once it has been made to penetrate, heal it from within.
La forma de spatum spinos am lo qual es fenduda la fistula: la curvitat del qual es mot aguda e l’autra partida es no-aguda, per so que no inscidas aquo que no es necessari, ayssi cum vezes.	The shape of the pointed spatula with which you should split open the fistula: its curvature should be very sharp on one side and less so on the other, so that you do not cut more than is necessary.
De sutura de emorroydas en las quals corra sanc en la inscizio de aquelas.	Regarding the suturing of hemorrhoids from which blood is flowing:
Emorroydas so segon dos manieyras, quar o so entre le cul semblantz aysi que es de carbos, o quays aquelas sian cum a gras de rasim.	Hemorrhoids are of two types: they can be located inside the anus, resembling charcoal lumps, or they can protrude from the anus, resembling clusters of grapes.
E de aquelas so petitas e grans, e que le sanc corr de aquelas tostemps e es una, e so motas, e so fora·l cul, e en las extremitatz de lu.	And some hemorrhoids are small and others are large; they can constantly bleed or only occasionally, either internally or externally, near the edge of the anus.
Mays empero aquelas que so foro le cul so segon las mes de pauca humiditat, de las quals corr aygua citrina o un petit de sanc am cos continuabla, e so segon la color del cos.	However, hemorrhoids that protrude from the anus are caused by a lack of moisture in the body; they can produce citrine-colored water or small amounts of blood continuously, and their color matches that of the surrounding skin.
E la curacio de aquela que es dedintz le cuol es que comandes al malaute que se assela e que se exprema entro que le cuol yesca e las emoroydas apparescan a tu.	To treat internal hemorrhoids, you should instruct the patient to squat and apply pressure until their anus protrudes and the hemorrhoids become visible to you.
Adonc tu te coyte e suspen am uncis o que tenguas aquelas am la tua ungla, e aprop incideys aquelas deves las suas razitz.	Then, you should sit and hold onto the patient's legs or use your fingernails to make small incisions in the hemorrhoids along their natural lines.
Mays si les uncis no so tengutz en aquelas per la humiditat de lor e mollificacio de aquelas, lahoras pren aquelas am drap aspre o am coto o am flassada de lana, e extratz aquelas am les tieus ditz, e aprop inscideys aquelas e polveriza sobre lor alcunas polveras caudas aprop la inscizio, per que sian ad aquelas en loc de cauteri; o cauteriza aquelas segon que es precedit en le capitol de cauterizar.	However, if the patient's legs are too slippery due to the moisture and softness of their skin, you should use a rough cloth or leather strap to grip them, and then extract the hemorrhoids using your fingers as described earlier. Once extracted, you can apply powdered cauterizing agents to the wounds in place of actual cautery, or follow the previously described method for cauterization if necessary.
E aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	And treat the remaining hemorrhoids with the same procedure until they are healed.
E si le cul no obezeys a egressio, lahoras cristerisa le malaute am cristeri en le qual sia mordicacio petita, e sia lavat am aquel aquo que es en le cuol e que obezesca a egressio leugierament quan le malaute s’esprem.	If the anus does not respond to pressure and refuse to protrude, you should use a small biting probe to stimulate it and wash the area with water that has been used to clean the anus. This will encourage gentle protrusion when the patient bears down.
Mays si las emorroydas so defora le cul, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiera, e es que tu prenguas aquelas am la tua ungla, o que prenguas aquelas am unci, e inscidas aquelas, e aprop cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit entro que sian sanadas.	However, if the hemorrhoids are external to the anus, their cause is usually minor and can be treated by gently pressing on them with your finger or using forceps to make small incisions and then treating them as described earlier until they heal.
E aquel que avoreys inscizio, cove que aministres sutura de lor segon aquesta manieyra: pren fiel envolopat e entromet aquel en agulha e aprop extratz las emorroydas a las partidas dessus, e fay aquel penetrar am la agulha en la razit del autra part, e envolveys las doas extramitatz del fiel en la partida pus dejos de la agulha, e so latitudinalment; e estrenh la emorroyda am strectura fort, e aprop noza le fiel e extratz la agulha.	When suturing the incision, follow these steps: Take some thread coated in fig sap and insert it into a needle. Then use the needle to draw the hemorrhoids up to the edges of the incision and pass it through the other side. Next, wrap the ends of the thread around the base of the hemorrhoid, parallel to the incision, and pull tight to close the wound. Finally, remove the needle carefully.
E fay aquo a totas, e layssa de aquelas una e no la cozes, per so que la superfluitat del sanc corra de aquela.	Do this for all of them, leaving one unsutured so that any excess blood can drain from it.
E aprop pausa sobre le cul drap enfus en oli rozat o en cerot; e pausa aquel sobre·l cuol e comanda al malaute que·s repause.	Then place a cloth soaked in rose oil or wax on the anus, and have the patient rest.
E aprop layssa aquela entro que caja; e quan es casuda, cura aquelas am enguentz o am autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And leave it inside until it falls out on its own, and then treat the wound with ointment or other remedies until it heals.
De curacio de fistulas.	Treatment of Fistulas:
Motas veguadas accideys per exseccacio de fenda o per costriccio de natura.	Many cases of fistulas occur due to wound complications or natural constrictions.
E cum so antiquadas e no val en aquela medicina, lahoras cove que tu razas aquelas am la puncta de spatum o am la tua ungla entro que sian faytas humidas e sia hostada de aquelas la escorsa pus desus, la qual prohibeys aquelas de consolidacio; e aprop cura aquelas entro que sian consolidadas.	If the fistulas are old and unresponsive to medical treatment, you should irrigate them with a spatula or your fingernail until they become moist and the scab on top is removed, which will prevent them from hardening further. Then treat them until they heal completely.
Lahoras tu osta aquelas am razio pus vehement que la primieyra entro que mot sancno e sian excoriadas; e aprop cura aquelas entro que sian sanadas.	Then, you should irrigate the fistulas with a very strong flow of water until they bleed and become raw; then treat them until they heal completely.
De curacio de almesamir, so es clau.	Regarding treatment for almesamir, it is crucial to note that:
Sapias que alamermar, so es clau, e no es si no notz redon segon la color del cors semblant a cap de claviel, e es fayt en tot le cors e majorment en las partidas dejos les pes e als ditz, e endeve per aquels dolor deves le anament.	You should know that alamermar is crucial and it refers to red spots on the skin resembling the head of a nail, which can occur throughout the body but are more common in the lower extremities such as the feet and fingers. To treat pain caused by these spots, you should use the appropriate remedies.
E adonc cove que sia inscidit aquo que es en le circuit del clau, e sia tengut am les forfexs o am unci, e sia eradicat de la sua razit; e aprop cura aquel.	Therefore, it is necessary to make an incision around the circumference of the red spot and remove it using forceps or forceps. Then treat the wound until it heals completely.
E si vols, cauteriza le segont que es precedit en le sieu capitol.	And if you wish, cauterize them according to the method described in their respective chapter.
Mays de veruca es eminencia petita aspre fistulada redonda sobre la superficia del cos, e motas veguadas veno en las mas dels enfantz.	Regarding warts, they are small, rough, round bumps on the surface of the skin that occur frequently in children.
E curacio de lu es que estendas e inscidas aquela, o que estrenhas aquela am fiel o am pel entro que caja.	The treatment for warts is to either cut and remove them or apply a paste made from fig sap or animal hair until they fall off naturally.
E si vols, cauteriza aquo, segon que havem dit, am foc o am medicina acuta.	And if desired, you can also cauterize them using heat or a caustic substance, as previously mentioned.
E ja so eradicadas enversas e no-enversas am le instrument le qual yeu diyre.	And warts should be removed both inwardly and outwardly with the tool I mentioned.
Mays formica es eminencia petita feutrada o fistulada grossa sobre la superficia del cos anant mot en le preon, e quan le freg atroba aquela es centit en lu semblant de mordificacio de formigua, e es fayta entorn le cos.	A formica is a small, swollen or large, rough bump on the surface of the skin that resembles a bite from an ant when touched, and it occurs around the body.
E curacio de lu es que prenguas una canula de pena de auca o de pena de voltor, e sia fort, e pausa aquela sobre la formigua entro que la contengua le cercle de la canula de las partidas de lu; e aprop revolveys la tua ma am la canula entro que inscidas aquo que es en le circuit de la formigua, e pauses aquela en le preon de la carn, e que eradiques la formigua de la sua razit.	To treat a formica, take a quill pen from a goose or a vulture and make it sturdy. Place the tip of the quill over the formica, making sure to cover the entire circumference of the growth. Then, rotate your hand while holding the quill, using it to cut into the skin around the formica, until you reach its root. Finally, remove the formica from its place.
E si vols, fay aquo am canula de eram o de ferr segon aquesta forma:	If desired, you can also use an iron or steel needle in this way:
Sia la partida desus de la canulha trahent a subtilitat, sorda (so es no-perforada), envolopada per so que sobre le dit la aprencio de lu sia ablaviada e la revolucio de aquela.	The upper part of the needle should be fine and blunt, without any sharp point that could pierce the skin. This will ensure that the rotation of the needle is smooth and easy to control.
E si vols cauteriza la formiga segon que es denant dit en la cauterizacio de atheyl en le capitol de cauteri.	And if desired, you can cauterize the formica as described in the chapter on cauterization of abscesses using fire or a caustic substance.
De forma dels instrumentz que so aministratz a dar cristeri.	Here are some common types of instruments used to perform minor surgical procedures:
Alcunas veguadas es fayt cristeri de argent o de lato o de eram fondut o malleat; e alcunas veguadas es fayt de aquels instrumentz petit e gran segon aquels als quals so aministratz, quar aquel que es aministrat en la curacio dels petitz enfants sia petit; e de aquel dels quals los culs son freuls o doloyrozes, les cristeris de aquels sian petitz.	Sometimes, a small probe made of silver, lead, or iron is used for cauterization. The size and shape of the instrument depend on the specific procedure being performed. For example, the probes used in the treatment of young children should be smaller than those used for adults. Additionally, probes with blunt or rounded tips are preferred to minimize pain and discomfort.
La forma de cristeri gran e pauc:	The form of large cauterization instruments:
Le cap de la canula de lu desus en le qual es liada la borsa sia ampla segon aquesta manieyra; e sia a lu distinacio la on la borsa es liada ayssi cum vezes.	The top of the cannula should be wide and have a clear distinction where the pouch is attached, as shown in the diagram.
E la extremitat de lu pus dejus, la qual es entromesa en le cul, sia sorda (so es no-uberta) mot leon, atrasent a subtilita; e en la un del latz de lu sian dos traucs, e en l’autre costat un trauc, e sia la amplesa del trauc segon la groseza dels rays e pus gros un petit.	And the lower end of the cannula that enters the wound should be blunt (i.e., not sharp) and tapered like a lion's tail, with two holes on one side and one hole on the other side. The diameter of the holes should correspond to the thickness of the rayon used, with the largest hole being slightly larger.
E sia la borsa en la qual sian pausadas las medicinas de vesica de bestia o de pel de ovelha, e la razit de lu sia un palm.	And let the bag be where the medications of animal bladder or sheep wool are placed, and its size should be one palm.
E sia perforada per motz traucs ayssi cum es revolvuda; e si l’espazi le qual es entre les traucs la grossetut del dit.	And let it be pierced with many holes as it is rolled up, and the size of the space between the holes should be the width of a finger.
E aprop entromet en aquels traucs fiel fort de fiel cru le qual sia de detz fiels, o enviro aquels; e ajusta am aquel la borsa; e quan es pausada en lu la borsa, sia streyt en le cap del cristeri entre dos distingentz am fort costriccio, e aprop cristeriza am aquel quascun trauc: Mays la qualitat de cristerizar am aquel es que tu omples la borsa de la medicina, que sia escalfada segon la quantitat de la tolleransa del malaute; e guarda te que no sia trop cauda ni trop freja.	And insert into those holes strong bile from ten fresh livers, or around each of them; then attach the bag to it. Once the bag is placed on it, make sure it is tightly secured at the top of the patient's head between two separate bands with a strong binding, and tie the bag to each hole: The way to do this is by filling the bag with the medication, which should be warmed according to the patient's tolerance; and ensure that it is not too hot or too cold.
E aprop le malaute sia resupinat sobre le sieu dos, e eleva las suas cambas en sus e pausa dejos lu un cuer sobre le qual ja so les homes o un lansol; e aprop unta la extramitat del cauteri am oli o am album de huou o am mucellage de fenugrec o de semblantz; e aprop entromet aquel en le cul am facilitat, e aprop le ministre prengua la borsa e exprema aquel am doas mas e essemps am vehemencia entro que sia evacuat en le budelh tot aquo que es en le cristeri; e aprop extra le cristeri e le malaute leva las suas cambas a la paret.	And let the patient be positioned lying on their back, and raise their legs with a support under them, such as a board or a hot stone. Then apply oil, egg white, fenugreek mucilage, or similar substances to the exterior of the cautery tool, and gently insert it into the anus. The assistant should take hold of the bag and strongly squeeze it with two hands, forcefully expressing its contents until everything in the bag has been evacuated into the intestine. Then remove the cautery and have the patient stand up while leaning against a wall.
E si la medicina forsa aquel a eyssiment, tengua le tant quant poyra; e si dorm am aquel per tota una nueyt, es mays derier en juvament.	And if the medication forces you to go to the bathroom, wait as long as you can. If you defecate with it inside for the entire night, it will be more beneficial.
Mays si tu cristerizas aquel en las malautias de solucio de ventre e l’eyssiment de lu le coyta, lahoras tu itera le cauteri entro que sia sanat.	But if you are using the cautery for diseases of the intestines and diarrhea, then continue to use it until it is healed.
E si en le cul so emorroydas o apostemas ledens, lahoras sia le cristeri mot subtil e leon, dels cristeris am les quals les enfantz so criterisatz.	And if there are hemorrhoids or abscesses in the anus, then let the cautery be very fine and sharp, like those used for circumcisions on infants.
De curacio de las plaguas.	On the treatment of wounds.
Yeu ja e dit en la divisio de la curacio de las plaguas aquo que convenia al libre, e yeu dic assi la curacio de aquelas am ma e am medicinas segon le conpliment.	I have already said in the division of the treatment of wounds what is necessary for the book, and now I will say the treatment with my advice and with medications according to their application.
Donc dic que las plaguas son diversificadas segon aquo en que son faytas las plaguas e segon le loc sobre le qual cazo las plaquas.	Therefore, I say that wounds are diverse according to what they are made from and the place on which the wounds occur.
E las causas per que motas vetz son faytas las plaguas so ayssi cum getament de peyra, o inscisio d’espaza o de cotel, o percussio am lansa, o am fustz, o am sageta, o semblantz ad aquels de motas causas.	And the causes by which wounds are often made are such as striking with a stone, or cutting with a sword or knife, or piercing with a spear, or staff, or arrow, or similar things from many other causes.
Mays las plaguas que so en les locz del cos so ayssi cum plagua la qual catz sobre le cap, o·l col, o·l pietz, o·l ventre, o·l fitge, e semblantz ad aquels dels membres.	But wounds that are on parts of the body such as a wound on the head, or neck, or chest, or stomach, or thigh, and similar ones on other members.
E yeu so recomtant la curacio de alcunas plaguas per que pauses aquela ratiocinacio e regla sobre las autras plaguas.	And I am now describing the treatment of some wounds in order that you may have a rule and reasoning for treating other wounds.
E yeu comensare de las plaguas del cap simplas, quar la rememoracio de las compostas vindra al comensament del tertz capitol.	And I will begin with simple head wounds, because the memory of compound ones will come at the beginning of the third chapter.
Donc dic que quan accideys en le cap plagua simpla e no es fractura, lahoras considera: si es per getament de peyra o de semblant, e ja ha trinquada la codena tant solament e es gran plagla e temes sobre aquel malaute havinement de apostema caut, lahoras tu te coyta e fleubotoma la cephalica tantost, e no tardas aquo; e extrats ad aquel del sanc segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu si no mes alcuna causa prohibent de fleubotomia, majorment si·l sanc que es eyssit de la plagua es pauc.	Therefore, I say that when you encounter a simple head wound and there is no fracture, consider the following: if it is caused by striking with a stone or something similar, and only the skin is torn and it is a large wound, and you fear an abscess due to hematoma in the patient, then you should quickly perform a venesection of the cephalic vein and do not delay. And extract blood from the patient according to their strength, unless there is some other reason preventing venesection, especially if the blood that has come out of the wound is scanty.
E sia la flaubotomia del contrari de la partida plaguada; e guardase le malaute de replecio e de vi e de viandas grossas.	And let venesection be on the opposite side from the wounded area, and take care that the patient avoids replenishing their blood, wine, and heavy foods.
Mays si de la minuicio prohibeys alcuna causa, lahoras sia aminorat de la vianda e no apropinque a carn ni a vi.	But if some cause prevents venesection, then let the patient eat less food and avoid meat and wine.
E pausa sobre la plagua, si a lu accideys apostema caut, coto enfus en oli rozat solet o en vi en le qual es stipticat.	And place on the wound if an abscess has developed, apply a piece of cloth soaked in oil or wine that has been thickened with styptic powder.
Mays si est segur de apostema caut, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua, si es recent am le sieu sanc e le ayre no ha mudat aquela la polvera la qual yeu recomtare aprop petit.	But if you are sure that an abscess is not developing, then place on the wound if it is fresh and still bleeding, and apply the powder that I will recommend shortly, while keeping away from the air.
E si le ayre ja ha mudada aquela, lahoras pausa sobre alscus enguentz entro que sia sanada.	But if the air has already touched it, then place on some ointments until it is healed.
Mays si la plagua es gran o es per inscizio d’espaza e de semblantz, e no so ajustadas las labias de lu per puvils, lahoras ajusta aquelas am sutura segon que yeu recomtare de la sutura de lor.	But if the wound is large or caused by cutting with a sword or something similar and the lips of it are not closed due to swelling, then close them with stitches as I will recommend for the suture of the lips.
Mays si la plagua ja es discuberta del os e pen, e no es retencio de lu sino un petit suspensori, lahoras inscideys aquela e aprop cura la plagua am medicinas e restaura la carn aprop en loc de codena, e comanda al malaute que sia pescut de viandas en las quals es groceza: caps e formen coyt e semblantz a lor, entro que sia compost.	But if the wound has exposed bone and tendons, but is only slightly hanging down like a flap, then cut it out and treat the wound with medications, restoring the flesh in place of skin, and command the patient to avoid foods that cause flatulence such as cabbage, beans, and similar ones, until it is healed.
E si atrobas en la codena putrefaccio e no adhereys al os, lahoras tu inscideys tot aquo poyrit e geta aquo, e aprop cura aquo.	And if you find putrefaction in the skin that does not adhere to the bone, then cut away all that is rotten and remove it, and treat the wound accordingly.
Mays si en aquestas plaguas es arteria o vena de la qual fluxs de sanc pot evenir, e no es abscindida per medicinas, lahoras tu inquier sobre la arteria, e si atrobas aquela no-inscidida, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am spatum, o lia aquela; e si necessitat te provoca que aquo que havem dit no comfereys, lahoras tu cauteriza entro que·l sanc sia abscidit.	But if an artery or vein is present in these wounds and the flow of blood cannot be stopped with medicine, then look for the artery and if you find it not cut, then carefully cut it with a scalpel or tie it off; and if necessity demands that the previously mentioned methods are insufficient, then cauterize until the bleeding has stopped.
E si aquestas plaguas son simplas e petitas, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiere; enayssi que tu polverizas sobre aquelas aquesta polvera, quar consolidada aquela denant que l’ayre mude aquelas.	And if these wounds are simple and small, then the cause of them is light, in which case you should dust this powder on them before the air reaches them, so that they become hardened before the air touches them.
E la manieyra de la polvera es aquesta: recipe oli de enses partida una, de sanc de drago partida doas, de caus no-extincta partidas tres; sia tot mot trissat e crivellat, e de lu sia la plagua omplida, e sia constrengida per bona constriccio entro que be sobre aquela aderesca, e sia coagulada am le sanc.	The method of making the powder is as follows: take one part oil of crushed sesame seeds, two parts dragon's blood resin, and three parts unburnt alum; mix well, strain, and fill the wound with it, pressing firmly so that it adheres well. Allow it to coagulate with the patient's blood.
E aprop strengeys aquela desus am pulvils e leyssa aquela, e no la deslias mentre esta ayssi que no es apostemada, quar no es eredicada de lu la medicina entro que sia sanada.	And bind it tightly above with bandages and leave it alone until the wound is no longer at risk for infection, as the medicine should not be removed before the wound is healed.
E alcuna vetz fa aquo sola cautz, quan no es a tu en present enses e sanc de drago.	And sometimes only cauterization is used when crushed sesame seeds and dragon's blood resin are not available to you.
E ja fa aquesta meteyssa operacio en las grans plaguas quan conveneys que sia pausada sobre aquelas e sian streytas, e so plaguas recentz am le lor sanc, las quals le ayre no ha alteradas.	And this procedure should be followed for large wounds when it is appropriate to apply it and bind them tightly, only if the wounds are fresh with their own blood and the air has not yet reached them.
E si le ayre las ha alteradas, e majorment quan es en temps d’estiu, lahoras no es entencio a la posicio de aquesta polvera, mays adonc cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit, enayssi que tu pauses sobre aquelas alcus enguents degistius, o que pauses sobre aquelas pols de la farina del ordi am aygua e mel entro que getan poyredura; e aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	And if the air has reached them, especially in summer, then it is not appropriate to use this powder, instead treat the wounds with what I have mentioned earlier. That is, apply ointments or dust the wounds with barley flour mixed with water and honey until they heal, and treat the wounds with other remedies until they are cured.
Mays si accideys am la plagua fractura en os, e es petita, lahoras tu extratz aquo am gesti.	But if the wound is a small fracture in the bone, then you should remove it with gentle force.
E yeu diyre la cura de las fracturas del cap en aquo que es envenidor.	And I will now discuss the treatment of skull fractures in cases where poisoning is suspected.
De las plaguas del col.	Of the wounds of the neck.
Mays si la plagua accideys en le col, lahoras no es en lu differencia en medicacio, e entre la plagua del cap quan es simpla.	But if the wound is inflicted on the neck, then it does not differ in treatment from wounds to the head when they are simple.
Mays si ja le nervi del col es inscis o arteria, lahoras si es nervi, no es en lu engen sino que sia evitada curacio de lu am aquo que fa vehement stipticitat, ayssi cum ziniar e zegi que es vetriol e semblantz a lor quar nozo als nervis e contrazo aquel.	But if the nerves or arteries in the neck are cut, then if it is nerves, one should avoid surgery on them using things that cause strong coagulation such as cinnebar and verdigris, which are copper acetate and similar substances, because these cause hardening and contraction of the nerves.
E no pauses sobre la plagua alcuna causa de tot freja, quar la sustancia dels nervis es freja e la continuacio de lu es am le cervel, le qual es le pus aut de totz les membres.	And do not place any cold substance on the wound, because the nature of nerves is cold and their connection is with the brain, which is the most sensitive part of all the members.
E si’ aquo am que es curat de medicinas leugieras, ayssi cum es caus lavada am aygua dousa, alcuna veguada enfusa en oli rozat o no-rozat, e thucia quan es lavada am aygua dousa e las autras peyras minarantz segon aquesta manieyra, e enguentz humitz.	And if the wound is being treated with light remedies, such as washing it gently with clean water, sometimes infused in rose oil or not, and applying powder of myrrh when washed with clean water, and other mild substances, and warm ointments.
Mays si la plagua es gran, lahoras aministra sutura, o coarta las labias de lu, e aprop cura aquela am pulvils entro que sia sanada.	But if the wound is large, then stitches should be applied or the lips of the wound brought together and treated with bandages until it is healed.
Mays si a la plagua es profunditat o accideys en lu a la pus bassa partida poyredura, lahoras perfora aquela en le loc mays depremegut.	But if the wound is deep or there is pus in its lowest part, then pierce it at the most depressed point.
Mays si en la plagua ja es inscisa arteria e es conseguit flux de sanc, lahoras separa o secca aquela, o lia aquela, o cauteriza aquela si necessitat te provoca ad aquo.	But if an artery is cut and bleeding occurs in the wound, then separate or tie off the artery, or cauterize it if necessary.
Mays si ja ha insciditz les spondils del golayro o tot, e so salvadas las venas del col, lahoras tu ajusta las labias de la codena am sutura sobre la cana del golayro e no toques aquel; abantz egala aquel e reduzeys aquel sobre la sua figura natural, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent, e leyssa aquela per alcus jorns; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz en les quals es stipticitat e excitacio entro que sia sanat.	If the vertebrae of the spine have become rigid due to arthritis or any other cause, and the veins of the neck are safe, then sew up the lips of the wound over the spine with sutures, but do not touch the spine itself; instead align it and return it to its natural shape, and then strengthen it with proper supportive bandaging. Leave this in place for several days; and take care of the wound with ointments that have styptic and astringent properties until it heals.
Mays si la plagua ja en le os a fayta enprecio, lahoras percuireys aquela, e lahoras si en lu ha fragmentz de hos, extratz totz aquels que podes de lor; e aquo que a tu no es apparelhat, leyssa aquo entro que la plagua se poyrisca, e sia separat e la egrecio de lu sia alleujada.	If the disease has affected the bone, then percuss (examine by tapping) it, and if there are fragments of bone in it, extract all that you can; and leave what you cannot remove alone until the disease subsides, and the swelling decreases, and its pressure is relieved.
E si la plagua es recent lahoras polveriza sobre aquela polvera la qual t’e recomtada.	And if the disease is recent, then powder (apply) over it the powder that has been recommended to you.
Mays si en la plagua es fayta fistula, lahoras cura aquela am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra aprop en le sieu capitol.	But if a fistula has formed in the disease, then treat it with what is recommended for its treatment in its own chapter.
De las plaguas del col o de semblantz quan fayta entre las spallas e es fayta am spaza o am cotel o am lansa o am semblantz.	About the diseases of the neck or similar ones that occur between the shoulders and are caused by a spear, knife, or lance or similar.
Si es percussio de lansa o de cotel, e vezes de lu la profunditat, lahoras considera mays si de la plagua yeys ventositat quan le malaute elena; lahoras sapias que la plagua es mortal.	If it is a wound caused by a lance or knife and there is air coming out of the wound, then know that the wound is fatal if the patient complains about having difficulty breathing.
E si en lu no es profunditat e la plagua es recent am le sieu sanc, lahoras tu pauses en lu de la primieyra horo polvera, e no strenhas aquel per que no sia le sanc retengut en la profunditat de lu e que retorne al cor e que aucigua le malaute, mays pausa en lu enguent atractiu, e deslia aquela doas veguadas le dia.	And if it is not deep and the wound is recent with its own blood, then you should place a powder on it in the first hour, but do not press too hard so that the blood is not retained inside and returns to the heart and causes harm to the patient, instead place an attractive ointment on it, and loosen the bandages twice a day.
E si l’enguent no es a tu present, lahoras tu pausa en le orrifici de la plagua coto viel per que sucque aquo que yeys de las humiditatz; e fay que le malaute dorma sobre la plagua per que corra aquo que es en lu ajustat.	And if the ointment is not available, then place a cotton swab in the opening of the wound to absorb any moisture; and make sure that the patient sleeps on the wound so that what is accumulated in it can be drained.
Mays si ja de la plagua son passatz tres dias o mays e no accideys al malaute spasme ni tremor de cor mal ni strictura de ale, e vezes las autras dispozicios bonas de lu, lahoras sapias que plagua es salva; e adonc cura aquela am calguas e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanada.	But if three days or more have passed since the wound and there has been no occurrence of convulsions, palpitations, or pain in the chest, and other good signs are present, then you can be sure that the wound is healing; and at this point treat it with cupping glasses and other remedies until it heals completely.
Mays si la sanacio de lu es excusada, e ja tot temps es uberta, lahoras sapias que ja es fayta fistula; cura donc aquela per le sieu capitol.	But if the healing of the wound is delayed and it remains open for a long time, then you can be sure that a fistula has formed; treat it according to its own chapter.
E si la plagua es per inscisio de spaza o de cotel, e es simpla en la superficia del pietz o del dos, lahoras cura aquela am aquo que es precedit de sutura, si es gran, o am polvera, si es petita.	If the wound is caused by a cut from a spear or knife and it is simple on the surface of the skin or back, then treat it with stitches if it is large or powder if it is small as previously described.
Mays si ja ha fayta enprecio en le os, e so ja de lu inscizas pessas, lahoras tu torqua la plagua e coyta ad extrayre aquelas pessas, si so separadas.	But if the bone has been affected and you have incised it, then twist the wound to extract any splinters that may be present; if they are separate from each other.
Mays si no so separadas, lahoras leyssa las entro que se poyresca la plagua, que la extraccio de lor es alleujada.	But if they are not separate from each other, then leave them alone until the wound subsides and their removal is easier.
E de las autras plaguas accidentz en les autres membres le juvament en curacio es le juvament de aquo que havem dit.	And for other wounds that occur in other parts of the body, their treatment is similar to what has been described.
De las plaguas del ventre.	About the diseases of the stomach or abdomen.
L’indisposicio la qual accideys en le ventre es o gran, o pauc, o migiera.	The indisposition that occurs in the stomach or abdomen is either large, small, or moderate.
De la gran alcunas veguadas yeys le budel o nervi del budel, per que es fayta intromissio de lor e la sutura de lor esser pus vehement e pus subtil.	When the stomach or abdominal disorder is large, it is often due to prolapse of the intestines or nerves of the intestines, which requires more careful and delicate suturing because of their fragility.
E disrupcio petita es fayta dificil per autra manieyra, e siec se que la reduccio de lor es pus dificil, si no te coytes de la intromissio de lor al sieu loc tantost, quar se ubre e es engrossat per que le intrament de lu es fayt difficil.	And a small rupture is often difficult to repair in any other way, and I know that reduction (repositioning) of the intestines or nerves back to their place becomes more difficult if you do not attend to it immediately because they become swollen and engorged, making their repositioning difficult.
E donc la milhor disrupcio es migiera, quar en aquela no es dificil la reduccio del budel, ayssi cum es dificil en las doas specias denant ditas.	And therefore the best kind of rupture is moderate, because reducing the intestines back to their place in this case is not difficult, unlike the two previously mentioned kinds.
E sapias que sutura del ventre es segon quatre manieyras, mays doas suturas son comunas que conveneysso en suturas de las autras plaguas del cors.	And know that there are four ways to suture the stomach or abdomen, but two of them are common and suitable for suturing other wounds in the body. [quar = because]
E duas autras suturas proprias comunican a las autras plaguas, mays empero so mays proprias en la sutura del ventre.	And two other kinds of sutures are suitable for other wounds but are specifically used in abdominal suturing.
E yeu recomti a tu quascuna am exposicio e declaracio.	I recommend that you explain and describe each one (of the four types of sutures) to me.
Donc dic que quan la plagua es petita e es eyssit alcuna causa del budel per aquela, e es fayt dificil a reduzir aquel, lahoras aquo es en una de doas manieyras: o per parvitat de la disrupcio ayssi cum havem dit, o quan al budel es venguda inflacio per la frigiditat de l’ayre.	I say that when the wound is small and some part of the intestines has come out through it and reducing it back in place is difficult, then it can be due to one of two reasons: either because the rupture is small as previously mentioned, or when the intestines have become inflamed due to the coldness of the air. [inflacio = inflation]
E donc quan aquo es ayssi, lahora cove que tu scalfes aquel enayssi que tu submerges una sponga ho drap humit en aygua tebeza sola, o que coguas en aygua squinant, e cyperum, e spic, e embroques am aquela le budel entro que la imflacio sia resolvuda.	And therefore when this is the case, it is necessary to scarify (make small cuts) on it so that you can insert a sponge or cloth soaked in warm water, or use a decoction of squinant, cyperus, and spearmint, and apply it to the inflamed intestines until the inflation subsides. [scalfes = scarify; squinant = wormwood]
E alcunas veguadas fa aquo vi en le qual ha stipticitat, e es milhor que la aygua sola en resolucio de la imflacio.	And sometimes it is better to use water with astringent properties in order to resolve the inflammation.
E donc cum tu vezes la imflacio esser resolvuda, lahoras tu humecta le budel am aygua en la qual es coyta altea e malvas, quar per aquo es alleujat le intrament de lu am pauca causa.	And once you see that the inflammation has subsided, then moisten the intestines with water in which marshmallow and mallows have been boiled because it relieves the swelling of it with little effort.
Mays si es escusat le intrament de lu aprop aquesta curacio, lahoras scindeys la disrupcio un petit am strument am le qual so inscididas emorroydas.	But if the swelling persists and it is difficult to insert anything into the wound, then make a small incision in the rupture with an instrument that is used for incising hemorrhoids. [emorroydas = hemorrhoids; strument = instrument]
E la curacio primieyra es milhor, quan es propriada que no es seccio, e no sia occupacio a seccar aprop necessitat e defaliment.	And the primary treatment is better when it involves incising only as much as necessary and not causing excessive drying or weakening of the tissues.
Del instrument, sec se la forma de lu:	About the form of the instrument (that is used for incising hemorrhoids), let it be.
La una partida de lu torta aguda, e l’autra partida no-acuta, e la extremitat subtil, e no sia am la subtilitat de spatum, abantz sia obtusa un pauc.	The one side of it should be sharp and curved, and the other side not sharp, with a fine and thin tip but not as thin as that of a spatula, rather slightly blunt.
E donc cum la plagua es amplificada e yeys fora le budel, lahoras cove que la sua reduccio sia segon la forma de lu natural, en le sieu loc propri, si es possible sobre aquo, quar milhor es.	And therefore when the wound is large and some part of the intestines has come out through it, then reducing it back to its place should be done in accordance with its natural shape and position if possible, because this is better. [reduccio = reduction; forma = form; loc = place; propri = proper]
Mays quan la disrupcio es ampla, e es en la partida pu bassa del ventre, lahoras cove que tu fassas jazer le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa las suas cambas pus autas que·l sieu cap; e si es en la partida pus desus del ventre, lahoras tu pause le cap de lu e·l pietz pus autz que las partidas dejos.	But when the rupture is wide and located in the lower part of the abdomen, then have the patient lie on their back and raise their legs higher than their head; and if it is located in the upper part of the abdomen, then place a cushion under their head and feet so that they are raised above the rest of their body. [cambas = thighs; partidas = parts; pus autas = higher; pus autz = higher]
E semblantment si la disrupcio es en una de las doas partz del ventre, lahoras pausa la tua entencio e la tua consideracio tostemps en aysso per que la partida en la qual es la plagua sia pus auta que l’autra.	And similarly if the rupture is located in one of the two sides of the abdomen, then direct your attention and focus towards that side so that the side where the wound is located is raised higher than the other. [partz = sides; auta = high; tua entencio = your intention; tostemps = always]
E ayssi cove que tu aministres aquo en las plaguas grans e en las plaguas migieras.	And this should be done in both large and moderate wounds. [aministres = administer; plaguas grans = large wounds; plaguas migieras = moderate wounds]
E en las plaguas petitas, pausa aquo que es a tu preparat, e aprop fay que·l ministre sia entre las tuas mas pyatados, le qual tengua la disrupcio tota am la sua ma e ajusta las labias de lu, e aprop descuebre de aquela ad aquel que siec la sutura alcuna causa aprop autra.	And in small wounds, use what you have prepared and make sure that the person administering it is holding the wound with their hand, adjusting its lips, and discovering an area of it for stitching if necessary. [ministrar = to administer; pyatados = experienced; labias = lips; descuebre = uncover]
E aquesta es la manieyra de sutura comuna: una que prenguas la agula, o comte de agula segon la cantitat de la amplitut de la plagua; e aprop layssa de la extremitat de la disrupcio del dit anular, e strenh la agula una, otre que tu no metas fiel en las doas extremitatz de la codena, am doas extremitatz del ciphac que es dejos la codena de las partidas dedintz, entro que fassas aquela penetrar de aquela partida; e tu ja has agreguadas doas extremitatz de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, e so faytas quatre ordes.	And this is the common method of suturing: take a needle or a thread according to the size of the wound; and then hold it from the edge of the wound at the base of the ring finger, and pull the needle through one end of the wound towards the other without piercing both ends of the skin at once, using the point of the needle to penetrate between the two layers of the skin until you have joined together two ends of the wound and two ends of the thread, and repeat this process four times. [agula = needle; cantitat = quantity; amplitut = width; extremitat = end; strenh = pull; ciphac = suture material; codena = skin; partidas dedintz = inside layers]
E aprop strenh am fiel doble en le circuit de la agula, e alcunas veguadas de doas partz ensemps, e aprop agregua las doas labias e la plagua per agreguacio decent; e aprop layssa la grossitut del dit e fiqua una autra agulha en aquela, e aprop lia aquela am fiel ayssi cum fiest am la primieyra agulha; e no cesses far aquo si es necessitat am las agulhas entro que ajas complida tota la contriccio de la plagua.	And then pull the thread tight around the needle, and sometimes do this for two layers at once, and then bring together the two lips of the wound with proper closure; and then leave some space between your fingers and insert another needle into it, and then tie it to the first needle as before; and continue doing this with multiple needles until you have completed suturing the entire wound. [fiel = thread; circuit = path; contriccio = sewing together]
E sian las agulhas migieras entre groceza e subtilitat, quar las agulhas subtils mot leugierament insciden la carn; e las grossas so de dificil intrament en la codena, e donc per aquo cove que sian migieras en subtilitat e grosseza.	And let the needles be of moderate size between thickness and thinness, because very fine needles slightly cut into the flesh, and thick ones are difficult to insert into the skin, so they should be moderate in thickness and thinness. [insciden = cut into; leugierament = slightly; dificil = difficult]
E no cove que la agulha sia ficada en doas extremitatz de la codena propdana mot, per so que la carn no sia inscidida leugierament e que la plagua se huebra devant la sua consolidacio.	And it is not necessary for the needle to penetrate too deeply into both ends of the skin because this may cause a slight cut in the flesh and lead to the wound opening up before it has healed completely. [huebra = open; consolidacio = healing]
E no sian prolonguadas de sutura per que la plagua no sia prohibida de consolidacio.	And let the sutures not be too long because this may prevent the wound from healing properly.
E aprop inscideys las extremitatz de las agulhas per so que no ledescan le malaute deves le sieu dormier; e pausaras sobre la sutura pulvils expanduts de tota partida, les quals tenguan las extremitatz de las agulhas; e layssa aquelas entro que sapias que la plagua ja es consolidada.	And then blunt the ends of the needles so that they do not prick the patient while they are sleeping, and place poultices on both sides of the sutures to hold them in place; and leave these in place until you are certain that the wound has healed completely. [pulvils = poultices; expanduts = spread out; entro = until] [translated by machine]
E aquestas specias de sutura am agulhas en cal manieyra es pus convenient en las plaguas petitas, quar habasta en la sutura de lor una agulha o doas o entorn aquelas.	And this method of suturing with needles is more suitable for small wounds because even in the suturing of such wounds only one or two or at most a few needles are required. [habasta = up to; entorn = around]
Mays la segonda sutura es cominal: e es que tu aministres am sutura las quatre extremitatz, de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, en una veguada, am agulha en la qual sia fiel envolopat engual en subtilitat e grosseza.	The second common method of suturing is to use a needle with thread wrapped around it in fine and thick threads to stitch together the four ends of the skin and both ends of the wound in one go. [aministres = administer; sutura = suture; engual en subtilitat e grosseza = thread wrapped around the needle]
E aprop quan am la agulha auras penetrat aquestas quatre extremitatz, reduzeys la agulha de aquela meteyssa partida de la qual comensest, per so que le fiel retrayt caja de la pus subirana partida a la plagua, per so que la sutura sia segon sutura de drap am la qual les draps so strengutz.	And then when you have penetrated these four ends with the needle, return the needle to its original position so that the thread is pulled from the deeper part of the wound to the more superficial part, making the suture resemble a stitch in fabric that strengthens it. [reduzeys = return; meteyssa partida = same place; retrayt = pull; pus subirana partida = higher part; sutura de drap = stitch in fabric]
E pausa entre quascuna sutura la quantitat del gros del dit mendre.	And leave a space between each suture equal to the width of the smaller finger.
E aquesta sutura sabo les homes.	This method of suturing is common among humans.
E am tal sutura yeu cozegui la plagua la qual era accidida a un home en le sieu ventre le qual era stat plaguat am un cotel, e era la disrrumpcio de la plagua major de un palm, e era eyssit dels budels entorn dos palms del budel del mieg loc e era la disrupcio en le mieg del membre; e adonc yeu reduzegui aquel depus que le budel havia stat foro la plagua per xxiiii horas.	And with such a method of suturing, I stitched the wound that had been inflicted on a man's stomach by a knife, where the rupture was larger than a palm and some intestines had come out around two palms from the middle of the belly, and the rupture was in the middle of the abdomen. And then I reduced it because the intestines had been outside the wound for 24 hours. [disrrumpcio = rupture; foro = outside; horas = hours]
E la plagua fo consolidada en le spazi de xv dias o entorn, e curegui aquel e es sanat; e aprop aquo visquec per motz ans, e es conversat en las suas disposicios.	And the wound healed in the span of 15 days or so, and I cured him and he recovered completely; and furthermore, he lived for many years and resumed his normal activities.
E les autres metges havian jutgat que no fora sanat; e per miracle foc, quar yeu no curegui aquel am enguent, quar era en loc en le qual enguent no era atrobat ni deguna medicina, mays pausegui sobre la plagua coto viel dos veguadas lo dia e ablucio assiduo am aygua de mel entro que foc sanat.	And other doctors had judged that he would not recover; and it was a miracle because I did not cure him with ointment, for it was in a place where no ointment or any medicine could be found. Instead, I applied cotton swabs twice a day and washed it assiduously with honey water until it healed completely. [jutgat = judged; metges = doctors; atrobat = found; mel = honey; ablucio = wash; assiduo = assiduous]
Mays yeu diyre dos specias de sutura proprias segon narracio de Paraula.	But I will describe two other types of suturing according to the account in the text.
E es que tu comenses am sutura de la codena, e entrometas agulha de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz.	The first type of suturing involves starting with stitching the skin from the outside to the inside.
E donc cum la agulha penetra en la codena e en aquel meteys lacertz segon rectetut e en longetut de tot le cos, e layssa la extremita del ciphac en le qual has entromesa la agulha; e fay penetrar en la autra extremitat la agulha de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo en l’autra extremitat del mihat.	And then when the needle enters the skin and continues along the length of the body, leaving the end of the thread attached to the needle, insert the needle into the other side from inside to outside at the other end of the incision, in the same way as before. [longetut = length; mihat = middle] [translated by machine]
E don cum tu auras fayta aquela penetrar, lahoras tu fay aquela penetrar autra veguada en aquela meteyssa extremitat del mihat de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz; e leyssa la extramitat del ciphac que es en aquest latz, e fay penetrar la agulha en l’autra extremitat de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo.	And once you have made that incision, then make another incision in the same wound from the outside part to the inside part; and leave the extremity of the hip that is on this side, and make the needle penetrate in the other extremity from the inside part to the outside part.
E fay penetrar am aquela la tua penetracio am la qual fas aquela penetrar en le ciphac en la extremitat del mirat la qual es en la partida de lu entro que tot aquel penetre.	And insert with that same incision you make in the hip in the extremity of the member that is inside, so that everything penetrates.
E aprop comensa de aquest meteys costat e cus aquel am la extremitat que es del ciphac en l’autra latz, e extratz la agulha de la codena la qual penetrec, e aprop redutz aquela en aquela codena e cos la extremitat del ciphac que es en l’autra costat am aquesta extramitat del mirat; e extratz aquela de la codena la qual es de part de lu.	And begin from this same side of the wound and extract the needle that you inserted, which has penetrated, and return it to the kidney on this side with this extremity of the member that is inside; and extract the one from the kidney that is on the other side of the body.
E fay aquo una veguada e autra, e fay aquo una veguada aprop autre veguada entro que tu cozes tot aquo que es deforo segon aquel eysemple.	And do that one time and another, and do that one time after another until you sew all that is outside according to this example.
E la suma de aquesta manieyra de sutura es que tu cozes am sutura de pellicies am la qual cozo las pels, enayssi que tu cozes le ciphac una veguada de la part de la extremitat de la codena, e que leysses aquela autra veguada entro que la ajas complida.	And the sum of this method of suturing is that you sew with sutures made of animal gut, in such a way that you sew the hip one time from the side of the extremity of the kidney, and leave the other part open until it is completed.
Mays la segonda specia de sutura propria la qual dieys eyssament Gualia , e aquest es de sermo de lu e per lu recomtat, es que tu cozas aquela segon semilitut am la qual alcus medicantz cozo aquela, enayssi que agreguan tota partida a la sua compar partida a lu convenient per natura; e aplican la extremitat de autre de lu e la extremitat del mirat al autra extremitat de lu, e aquo es fayt segon que yeu a tu recomti.	But the second type of suturing, which I previously mentioned as belonging to Galen, is done in this way: you sew with a semicircular stitch, in such a way that the medical practitioner sews it, joining all parts together according to their natural correspondence; and they apply the extremity of one part to the other extremity of the member, and this is done as I have described.
Cove que tu fiques la agulha en la extremitat del mirat a tu propdana de la partida deforo, e fassas aquela penetrar a la partida dedintz en aquel sol, e leysses dos extremitatz del ciphac; e aprop revolveys la agulha e fay aquela penetrar de foro a la dedintz en dos extremitatz del ciphac.	It is necessary that you insert the needle in the extremity of the member at your own side, and make it penetrate to the inside part in that same wound, leaving both sides of the hip; and then turn the needle around and make it penetrate from the outside to the inside in both sides of the hip.
E aprop revolveys aquelas cascunas, e fay penetrar quascunas de la partida dededintz entro a la partida deforo en dos extremitatz del mirat autras que so en le latz contrari.	And then turn those sutures around, and make each one penetrate from the inside to the outside in both sides of the member that are on the opposite side.
E aquesta manieyra de sutura es milhor de la sutura comuna leugiera, e es sutura de la qual precedic rememoracio.	And this method of suturing is better than the common light suture, and it is the suture that I previously mentioned.
Aquest es le sermo de Gualia	This is Galen's technique.
E mays le diyssero alcus, sutura del ventre es rectificada am dos agulhas, so es que tu entrometas en aquestas a quascunas un fiel, e comensa am intromiccio de agulha de aquo que es deves tu, e fay aquela penetrar entro al autra latz segon sutura de aquels les quals cozo les cuers engualment.	But they also called it the "suture of the belly," which is corrected with two needles, that is, you insert in each one a thread, and begin with the needle that is on your side, and make it penetrate to the opposite side as in the suturing of those who sew animal skins.
E sapias que quan disrupcio es en le mieg loc del ventre, lahoras la sutura de lu es pus difficil que dels autres locs del ventre.	And know that when there is a rupture in the middle of the abdomen, then the suturing of it is more difficult than in other parts of the belly.
Mays le juguament de medicacio de plagua es jutgament de las autras plaguas.	But the judgment of medical treatment for a disease is the same as for other diseases.
La qual causa es quar quan tu consieguas la plagua recent am le sieu sanc denant que l’ayre altera aquela, e reduses le budel e cozes aquela e aptas aquela decentment, lahoras pausa sobre aquela polvera encarnativa.	Which is caused by the fact that when you find the disease while it is fresh with its blood before the air alters it, and you return the intestines and sew it up properly, then place powder that promotes healing on it.
E si le ayre ja ha alterada la plagua, lahoras pausa sobre aquela alcus enguentz les quals so a tu presens entro que fassan peyra dura e cajan les fiels, e sian consolidatz ciphac e mirat; e aprop cura aquela ayssi cum es la curacio de las autras plaguas entro que sia sanat.	And if the air has already altered the disease, then place on it these types of ointments that are present to you until they form a hard crust and the threads come out, and the wound heals; and treat it in this way as with the treatment of other diseases until it is cured.
Mays si a tu no so presens las medicinas, lahoras pausa sobre aquela tantost, pus que comensa a getar brac, coto viel, e permuta aquel dos veguadas le dia, ayssi cum a tu e ensenhat, entro que sia sanat, quar tu no indigeysses de autra medicacio en motas disposicios quan las plaguas so simplas.	But if you do not have the medicines present, then place on it immediately, since it begins to heal and form a crust, and change it every two days as I have taught you, until it is cured, because you will not need any other medication in most cases when the diseases are simple.
Mays si tu temes que la plagua comunique en lesio als membres principals, lahoras cove que tu submergas lana leon en oli de trempada qualiditat, o en oli rozat, e pausa aquela en le circuit dels locs que so entre les angonas e dejos las aysselas.	But if you are afraid that the disease may communicate to the main members, then it is necessary that you soak wool from a lion in oil for boiling or in rose oil, and place it on the circumference of the areas that are between the armpits and the hips.
E si sent dolor o putrefaccio en les sieus budels, quar motas veguadas aquo s’endeve, lahoras cristeriza aquel am vi stiptic negre tebe, e majorment si la poyredura es pervenguda en le budel e es fayta exitura penetrant entro la conquavitat de lu.	And if there is pain or putrefaction in the intestines, since this often happens, then apply a plaster made of wax and black styptic to it, especially if the powder has penetrated into the intestine and formed an ulcer in its cavity.
E sapias que aquela que es del budel gros es de pus leugiera sanacio que aquela que es en les budels subtils.	And know that the one that is in the large intestine heals more easily than the one that is in the small intestines.
E es de dificil sanacio quar le budel le qual es apelat “gegunu” no recep sanacio de plagua que caja en lu de tot; e aquo es per la gran multitut de venas que so en lu e per la magnitut de lu que so en aquelas, e per subtilitat del cos de aquel, e per propinquitat de aquel a natura de nervis.	And it is difficult to heal because the intestine called "gallbladder" does not accept healing from a wound that penetrates into it completely; and this is due to the large number of veins in it, and its great size, and due to the thinness of its body, and its proximity to the nature of nerves.
Mays si aquo que procezeys de la plagua es la tela, e conseguas aquela recent, redutz aquela segon la tua rectetut am la qual reduzes les budels engualment.	But if what comes out of the disease is a piece of tissue, and you find it fresh, then return it to its place according to your skill, in the same way that you would return the intestines.
Mays si es passat a lu spazi e ja es feyt vert o negre, lahoras que tu strenguas aquela am fiel sobre le loc que es denigrat de lu, per so que vengua fluxs de sanc, quar en la tela so venas e arterias.	But if it has been outside for some time and has turned green or black, then you should strengthen it with a thread over the place that is darkened by it, so that blood flows from it, because there are veins and arteries in the tissue.
E aprop inscideys aquo que es otra aquel liament, e pausa dos extremitatz del fiel pendentz de la partida dejos de la plagua foro lu, per que sobre tu sia alleujada la atraccio de lu deves le cazement de la tela e emissio del brac de la plagua.	And then insert what is other than this ligament, and place both ends of the thread on the side opposite the wound, so that it is relieved from its attraction to the sewing of the tissue and the emission of blood from the wound.
Rememoracio de las plaguas quan accideysso en le budel.	Recollection of diseases when they occur in the intestines.
Quan accideys disrupcio en le budel e es petita, lahoras es possibla que sia resteurada en alcus homes, per aysso quar yeu vi aquel le qual era stat plaguat en le sieu ventre am percussio de lansa et era la plagua de la part dreyta del stomac, e la plagua era antiquada e fayta fistula, e eyssic de lu gestio e ventositat.	When there is a rupture in the intestines and it is small, then it is possible for it to be restored in some people, because I have seen someone who was wounded in the stomach with a lance and had a wound on the right side of the stomach, and the wound was old and had formed a fistula, and pus and gas were coming out of it.
Adonc yeu pansegui la curacio de lu ja sia que no era confizat en la sanacio de lu, mays cessegui subtiliar aquel entro que foc sanat e le loc es consolidat.	Therefore I continued the treatment of it, knowing that it was not possible to heal it completely, but I stopped trying to refine it once it had healed and the place had hardened.
E yeu pus que vi le loc ja consolidat, timegui sobre le malaute que endevengues sobre lu accident de mal en le sieu ventre; e no endevenc alcu per aquo mal accident e romas en las suas milhos disposicios mangant e bevent, e aprop entrec en banh e es exercitat en sos ditz.	And because I saw that the place had healed, I was afraid for the patient that an accident might happen in his stomach; and no harm came to him from this accident, and he remained healthy in his various habits of eating, drinking, taking baths, and exercising.
E ja diysero alcus experimentados que quan endeve plagua en le budel, e es petita, lahoras cove que sia liada segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas fromiguas de grans caps; e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua e pausa una fromigua de aquelas que aja la boca uberta sobre las doas labias de la plagua; donc quan pren sobre aquelas e strenh la sua boca, abscindeys le cap de lu, quar adhereys e no es dissolvut.	And some experienced people have said that when there is a wound in the intestines, and it is small, then it should be bound in this way: take large-grained chickpeas; and then bring together the two lips of the wound and place one of those chickpeas that has its mouth open on the two lips of the wound; so that when you press on them, and close its mouth, cut off its head, because it adheres and is not dissolved.
E aprop pausa autra formigua prop la primieyra, e no cesses aquo a far am formiguas una aprop autra segon la quantitat de tota la plagua.	And then place another chickpea next to the first one, and do not stop doing this with chickpeas, placing one next to the other, according to the size of the entire wound.
E aprop reduzeys aquela e cos la plagua; e romanguan aquels caps annexces en le budel entro que·l budel sia sanat; e no accideys al malaute degun nocument.	And then return it to its place and sew up the wound; and the heads of the chickpeas will remain attached inside the intestines until the intestines heal, and nothing bad will happen to the patient.
E ja es possible que·l budel sia liat am fiel subtil lo qual es fayt del budel de bestia annexs am lu, pus que es mes en agulha; e es que tu prenguas la extremitat de aquestz fiels de budel, e sia mot descarnat, e aprop lia la extremitat de lu am fiel de li, envolopat, e aprop entromet aquel fiel en agulhas e cos am aquel le budel, e areduzeys aquel en la disrupcio.	And it is possible that the intestines can be bound with delicate thread, which is made from animal intestines and is sewn with a needle; take one end of this delicate thread, and strip off its flesh, and then tie it to the other end of the thread, wrap it around, and insert this thread into needles and sew the intestines together, returning them to their place.
E aquesta manieyra de sutura am formiguas no es sino segon via de fiducia e d’esperansa.	And this method of binding with chickpeas is only done out of hope and trust.
Mays si la plagua es gran e ampla, majorment si es en un dels budels subtils, quar lahoras no es engen sino subtiliacio, e no es sanacio de lu de tot.	But if the wound is large and wide, especially if it is in one of the small intestines, then it cannot be bound, but only refined, and not completely healed.
