De curacio de zuchem e fistula.	Of the treatment of abscesses and fistulas.
Sapias que tota plagua e apostema quan se envilheseys e se Antiqua, e es fayt ulcus, e no es consolidat e geta braç tot temps e no es abscindit, lahoras, en qualque membre sia, universalment es nompnada fistula e nos la apelam aquela azukem.	Know that every wound and abscess that becomes old and forms an ulcer, and does not heal and constantly emits pus, but is not cut open, no matter where it is in the body, is called a fistula, and we call it "azucar".
E fistula segon veritat es nodacio feutrada, dura, blanqua am la qual no es dolor e a la qual es conquavitat ayssi cum es conquavitat de pena de ausel; e per aysso nompnat aquela alcus rizatz, id est pena.	And fistula in truth is hard swelling, white, with which there is no pain and it has a cavity like the cavity of a bird's quill; and because of this it is named curved hole, that is, quill.
E es en alcus homes humida, la qual geta brac; e fort leu la humiditat es abscidida en alcunas horas.	And it is a moist hole in men, which discharges pus; and the moisture is easily drained within a few hours.
E alcunas veguadas aquesta humiditat es mota, e es pauca, e es grossa, e es subtil.	And sometimes this moisture is thick, and scanty, and coarse, and thin.
E yeu ja he denant dit en la divisio, lahoras cum yeu diyssi las plaguas, que tot ulcus que no es sanat ni no es en lu nuda carn, no es aquo sino per una de ix causas: de las quals la una es o per pauquesa de sanc en le cos; o per malicia de lu; o quar entre lu e las labias es carn dura prohibent nativitat de carn; o quar es de mota legesa; o quar aquel ulcus en si meteys es poyrit e la materia que es a lu tramesa es de mala qualitat; o quar la medicina es enconvenient en la curacio de lu; o quan corrupcio catz en la regio, e es pestilencia; o per proprietat de regio ayssi cum endeve a Saragossa , en la qual es fayta difficil degestio de las malautias, e es tardada en aquela sanacio de apostema per natura; o quar en lu es os un, o motz osses.	And I have said before in the division, about wounds, that any ulcer that is not healed or is not open flesh, it is not so except for one of these causes: either because of little blood in the body; or due to bad condition of the patient; or because there is hard tissue between it and the lips preventing new flesh from growing; or because it is caused by thick injury; or because the ulcer itself has become purulent and the matter that is transmitted to it is of poor quality; or because the medicine used for its treatment is inappropriate; or when corruption occurs in the region, and it is pestilence; or due to properties of the area such as in Zaragoza, where digestion of diseases is difficult, and healing from abscesses is slow by nature; or because there is one bone or many bones in it.
Ja e mostrat totas aquelas causas, e·ls senhals de aquelas e la curacio de lor am medicinas en la divisio.	I have now shown all those causes and the signs of them as well as their treatment with medicines in the division (chapter).
E cove assi que yeu fassa a tu saber la curacio de fistula la qual es fayta per via de operacio am ma.	And it is appropriate that I should inform you about the treatment of fistula, which is made through surgery with the hand.
E sapias que fistula accideys en totz les membres del cos; quar de aquelas son fistulas que perveno a las venas grantz e arterias, o als nervis, o al ciphac, o al budel, o a la vesica, o ad alcuna de las costas, o ad alcu dels spondils del dos, o ad alcuna de las juncturas compostas per composicio ayssi quo de la ma e del pe; e de aquelas so que dan a lu propinquitat del membre principal e de semblantz.	And know that fistulas can occur in all parts of the body, for there are those that reach major veins and arteries, or nerves, or spleen, or intestines, or bladder, or any of the ribs, or any of the vertebrae of the spine, or any of the compound joints such as the wrist and ankle; and among them are those that are near to the main member.
E donc aquela de aquestas fistulas que es segon aquesta manieyra es de las malautias de dificil sanacio, e no recep curacio, e occupacio am aquela es trebalh e ignorancia.	And so among these fistulas, the one that is of this kind is one of the diseases of difficult healing and it does not accept treatment or care, and its practice requires hard work and ignorance.
E si es de las fistulas alcuna la profunditat de la qual no perve ad aquestz locs que e dit, e esperas e confizas en la curacio de lu, e vols pervenir a cognicio de lu, lahoras pren tenta de eram o de ferr, e si la fistula va segon rectetut, e perquireys aquela am lu.	And if any of the fistulas is not so deep as to reach those places that I mentioned and you hope for its healing, trust in its treatment and want to understand it better, then take an iron or a probe, and if the fistula follows a straight path, seek its depth with it.
Mays si la fistula es tortuissitat, lahoras investigua aquela am tenta de plom subtil, quar plom am la levitat del sieu cors es alleujat e curvat deves la tortuositat.	But if the fistula is twisted, then investigate it with a thin lead probe, for lead because of its lightness follows the twisting path.
E si la fistula es havent motz horrificis, no es a tu possible que signifiques sobre lu am tenta.	And if the fistula has many holes, it is not possible for you to recognize it with a probe.
Adonc cristeriza le orrifici per sos orrificis, quar la humiditat per la qual clisterizas aquela va deves las autras orrificis e corr de lor.	Therefore, fill its holes with them, for the moisture that you use to fill it will flow through the other holes and come out from there. [**Note**: In this context, "clisterizas" likely refers to filling or injecting the fistula with a substance using an enema (a device commonly used in medieval medicine to introduce liquids into the body).]
E aprop inquier exquisitament, segon qual manieyra a tu es possible que conoguas si aqui has os o nervi, e es la conquavitat de la fistula longinqua o propdana, o es una fistula a la qual so motz orrificis e esta sobre aquo tot am la suma de la tua fortaleza, am la tua enterroguacio, am la qual enterroguas le malaute, e la invencio de la dolor deves la tua compressio am la ma sobre le loc, e semblantz de las significacios e de las causas accidentz al apostema.	And then investigate carefully, in any way that is possible for you to understand, if there are bones or nerves here, and whether the cavity of the fistula is deep or shallow, or if it is a fistula with many holes and lies above it all with all your strength, with your questioning, by asking the patient, and discovering the source of pain through your compression with your hand on the area; and similar signs and causes as in abscess. [**Note**: The sentence seems to describe a process of careful examination and questioning of the patient to determine the nature and extent of the fistula.]
E cum tu auras stat sobre totas aquelas causas am stacio veraya, lahoras ve a la curacio segon confidencia: e es que tu consideras lahoras si es fistula apparent propinqua o en loc sal, longinqua de junctura, o de nervi, o de arteria, o de vena, o de un dels locs les quals yeu a tu e ditz.	And once you have examined all those causes with true scrutiny, then consider the treatment according to your judgment: and it is that you should now consider whether it is an apparent or nearby fistula in a healthy location, distant from joint, nerve, artery, vein, or any of the locations that I mentioned. [**Note**: This seems to indicate that the treatment for fistulas may depend on their location and proximity to various parts of the body, such as nerves, blood vessels, or joints.]
Lahoras tu secca la fistula segon que denant es dit de la naracio de lu, e osta aquo que es en aquela filtracio e de carns corrumpudas, e aquo que es nascut en le orrifici de la carn, o de theil e de semblantz, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And now you should dry out the fistula as described earlier in its description, and remove anything that is draining from it and of rotten flesh, and whatever has been born in the opening of the flesh, or pus and similar things; and cure it inside so that it heals.
Mays si la fistula es de longinqua profunditat, e es segon rectetut, lahoras cove que inscidas aquela en le preon atant quant a tu sira possible, e aprop mondifica aquela de totas las suas carns corrompudas; e aprop administra calguas envolopadas en medicinas acutas, e intromet aquelas entro a la conquavitat de la fistula, la qual has conprenduda am ferr.	But if the fistula is of great depth and follows a straight path, then you must cut into it as much as possible, and clean out all the rotten flesh; and apply hot compresses wrapped in strong-smelling medicines and insert those into the cavity of the fistula that you have opened with an iron probe.
E fay aquo am aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la medicina acuta corroda tot aquo que es romas en la conquavitat de la fistula de la corrupcio.	And do this several times until the strong-smelling medicine has eaten away all that is rotten in the cavity of the fistula, caused by corruption.
E aprop restaura aquela am enguentz les quals engendran carn sana entro que sia sanada.	And then restore it with ointments that promote healthy flesh growth until it is healed. [**Note**: This seems to suggest that after removing the infected tissue and cleaning out the fistula, the physician should apply a medicated ointment that promotes healthy tissue growth to help the wound heal properly.]
Mays si no es sanada per aquo, lahoras tu cauteriza aquela segon que havem recomtat.	But if it is not healed by this, then you should cauterize it as we have recommended. [**Note**: The text suggests that in some cases, cauterization with a hot iron or other heated object may be necessary to treat a persistent fistula. This was a common medical practice in medieval times and is still used today in certain situations. However, the decision to use cautery would depend on various factors, including the location of the fistula, its size and depth, and the patient's overall health and condition.
Mays si la causa de fistula es os e es deves tu certificat aquo, lahoras tu inquireys aquela e secca aquela segon que havem recomtat, si tu no prohibeys alcuna causa de vena o de nervi o de membre principal ayssi cum havem dit.	But if the cause of the fistula is bone and you are certain of that, then you should investigate it further and dry it out as we recommended, unless there is some other reason to avoid doing so due to a nearby vein or nerve or major body part as we mentioned earlier.
Mays si le os es a tu descubert e es en lu alcuna corrupcio e negror, lahoras tu ratz aquel entro que la corrupcio sia hostada tota; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que lu encarne entro que sia sanat.	But if the bone is exposed and there is some corruption or blackness in it, then you should cut into it until you reach the source of the corruption and clean out all the infected tissue; and then promote healing by encouraging new flesh to grow over the wound.
E si no es sana e gieta brac ayssi cum fazia, lahoras sapias que tu no est pervengut a la eradicacio tota de la corrupcio; e adonc tu descuebre sobre lu segondanament e exquisitament fay la razio de lu e la mundificacio de lu am la deriera fortalasa tieua, e aprop restaura aquel.	And if it is not healed and discharges pus as before, then know that you have not yet completely removed the corruption; and so you should investigate further and carefully consider the cause of the problem and clean out any remaining infected tissue with your last efforts, using gentle methods to promote healing and encourage new flesh growth.
E donc si es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras sapias que aquela corrupcio es en la profunditat longinqua del cors, la qual no ha conseguida, e adonc a tu en aquel no es engen sino laysar aquela.	And so if it is healed, that's good; but if not, then you should know that the corruption lies deep within the body and has not been reached, and in such a case your only option is to leave it alone.
E si le os corromput es petit, o es a tu possible atirar aquel, lahora tu le atira am forceps subtils las quals conveno ad aquo.	And if the corrupt bone is small or can be extracted, then you should extract it with fine forceps that are suited for this purpose.
E si so motz osses, lahoras exquisitament fay la extraccio de totz aquels, e de aquels no laysses denguna causa am la tua fortaleza.	And if there are many bones, then you should carefully extract all of them, leaving behind none due to your own weakness.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat alcuna causa de las humiditatz, e en lor inscizio no ha temor ni error, lahoras inscideys aquelas liaments o carns si so aqui, e deliura les osses.	But if there are any obstacles to incision due to nearby moist areas, and there is no danger or risk involved, then you should cut the ligaments or flesh that may be present, and extract the bones.
Mays si a tu no es preparacio de ostar les osses de la tua hora, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua aquo que poyresca la plagua aquela, e layssa aquela entro que aquo es al enviro de aquels osses de carns e de liamentz, e guarda la plagua que no sia consolidada, e sia constrengida la seccio la qual tu has inscidida en la tua operacio.	But if you are not prepared to remove the bones immediately, then place a dressing on the wound that will promote healing, leaving the area around the bones undisturbed and allowing them to be surrounded by flesh and ligaments; keep the wound clean and avoid letting it become stiff or constricted as you perform your operation.
Habantz, si temes, pausa sobre lu coto submers en sopre trissat am oli, o coto submers en anguent egipciac, o en alcu dels enguentz vertz, quar quan poyriran aquelas liaments, e les osses son de lor seperatz la ablacio, e de aquels atraccio es alleujada.	If you are concerned, place a compress soaked in treacle and turpentine oil, or an Egyptian ointment, or any other of the green ointments on it; for when these ligaments dissolve and the bones separate from them, the traction becomes easier.
Mays si es un gran os ayssi cum le os de camba o de coyssa o semblantz ad aquels, e aquo que de lu es corromput es la facia de lu tant solament, lahoras ratz aquela am resio tant solament derriera entro que sia ostada aquela negror e corrupcio, e aprop restaura la plagua.	But if it is a large bone such as the thighbone or hipbone or similar ones, and only the surface of it is affected by corruption, then cut into the surface layer until the blackness and corruption has been removed, and then promote healing of the wound.
Mays si aquo que de lu es corrumpyt es gran partida, e la corrupcio ja ha conseguida la medulla del os, lahoras es causa necessaria cerrar aquel e aquel tot inscidir entro al loc on es pervenguda la corrupcio, e lahoras cura aquel entro que sia consolidada.	But if the corruption has affected a large portion of the bone and has reached the marrow, then it is necessary to close the wound and refrain from cutting any further into the area where the corruption has spread; instead, promote healing and consolidation of the wound.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc ad un home en la sua coyssa per que pausez aquela a eyssempli e adjutori sobre la tua operacio.	I recommend that you use a cushion or support under the patient's hips to aid in your operation.
Foc un home jove per etat entorn xxx ans, al qual accideys dolor en la sua cueyssa, e de las partidas dedintz mauguda es sobre la materia dedintz le cors entro que la materia es pervenguda a la cueyssa, e es materia de apostema am gran apostema, e no foc a lu causa extrinseca.	There was a young man of about thirty years old who experienced pain in his groin, and the matter inside his body had moved to the area near the hip joint, causing an abscess with significant swelling, and this was not caused by any external factor.
E adonc foc extendut le temps am aquela per la error dels metges entro que l’apostema es hubert, e acorrero de lu materias motas, e la sua curacio foc aprop pausada entro que la camba foc fistulada, e faytz son en lu motz orrificis les quals totz getavan poyredura e las humiditatz del cos.	The abscess was allowed to progress for some time due to the error of the doctors, and it grew larger, and its treatment was delayed until the hip joint became fistulized, resulting in many openings that drained pus and other bodily fluids.
E adonc le curec multitut de metges entorn dos ans, e no foc en aquels savia ma en la art, entro que yeu fu appelat.	Many doctors treated him for two years, but none were successful in curing him until I was called upon to help.
E vi la camba de lu e las materias que corrian de lu aquels orrificis per gran cors; e ja le cos de aquel home era tot stabozit e la color de lu era citrina.	I examined the thigh of the man and saw the pus-filled openings from which it was draining, and his entire body had become emaciated with a yellowish tinge to his skin.
E adonc yeu intromesi la tenta ad un de aquels orrificis e pervenguec la tenta al os.	Then I inserted a probe into one of the openings and reached the bone.
E aprop yeu e perscrutat tostz les orrificis e trobegui aquels pervenir a lor de totas partidas de la camba.	And then I carefully examined all of the openings and found that they led to different parts of the thigh bone.
E adonc yeu me coytegui e inscidegui sobre un dels orrificis aquels entro que descrobegui una partida del os, e atrobegui aquel corromput, e ja era terros e corrumput e denigrat; e era ja corrumpuda una partida de la camba entro que havia penetrat entro a la mezola.	Then I considered my options and made an incision in one of the openings, exposing a portion of the bone, which I found to be corrupt and crumbling with signs of necrosis; it had also spread to a part of the thigh muscle, where it had penetrated deep into the tissue.
E adon yeu serregui aquo que a mi era discubert e preparat del os descubert.	Then I carefully removed the corrupt bone and prepared the area for healing.
E yeu cujegui que no fos en le os sino aquela corrupcio la qual abscidigui e serregui, e yeu ja havia derraziguada.	I believed that it was not the bone itself but rather the corruption in it that needed to be removed and discarded, which I had already done.
E aprop pausegui la restauracio de la plagua am medicina consolidativas per lonc temps, e no es consolidada.	And then I promoted healing of the wound with consolidating medications for a long time, but it still did not heal properly.
E aprop yeu iteregui e descubregui sobre le os segondament sobre le descubriment primier, e atrobegui continua corrupcio am le os.	And then I re-examined and found that the bone was still affected by corruption, so I cut further into it and discovered even more widespread decay.
E serregui aquo que a mi apares de aquela corrupcio, e aprop yeu fo perforsat fayre la curacio de lu e restauracio, e no es restaurat.	I removed the corrupt tissue and performed a thorough cleansing of the wound, but despite my efforts, it did not heal properly.
E adonc yeu descubri sobre lu autra veguada e no cessegui inscidir le os petit a petit particuladament e perforsa la restauracio de lu, e no es restaurat entro que inscidigui entorn un palm de lu, e aquel extraxi am la medula sua, e aprop restauregui aquel am medicinas, e es consolidat leugierament e sanat.	And so I investigated further and continued to cut into the bone gradually and meticulously, eventually removing a piece about the size of a hand's width, including its marrow; then I used medications to promote healing, and the wound became slightly consolidated and healed.
E no es necessaria iteracio en la operacio de lu e seccio de lu sino per la disposicio de la freulesa de lu e per la paucitat de la tollerancia de lu e paor de lu de mort, quar a lu accidia en totas horas per superfluitat de evacuacio sincopi mala.	And there was no need for further cutting or sectioning during the operation except for the weakness of his body and his fear of death, as he frequently suffered from fainting spells due to excessive bodily discharge.
E donc sanat es per sanacio entiera, e nada es en loc de os carn dura; e es fayta bona la disposicio de lu en le sieu cors e retornec la vertut de lu; e es conversat en las suas disposicios e no fec a lu contrarietat en ambulacio ni nocument en denguna causa.	And so he was completely healed, with no hardened flesh remaining in the area of the bone; his body had regained its proper alignment and vitality, and he was able to return to his normal activities without any adverse effects or harm.
Mays si es os eminent en loc del cors ja trauquat, lahoras cove que tu secces aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas liament e strenh aquel en la extremitat de aquel os eminent, e comanda ad alcu que extenda aquel en sus; e pausa aquel liament de lana pus gros del primier liament; e aprop lia aquel sobre la carn que es dejos le os, e exten la extramitat de lu per que atires la carn a las partidas dejos, e tu descuebras la carn sobre le loc le qual voles serrar per que la serra no leda la carn.	But if the bone is prominent in a traumatized area of the body, then it must be cut as follows: take a ligament and tie it tightly around the end of the protruding bone, and command someone to pull on it; place a thicker linen bandage over the first one; then draw the skin taut over the bone with forceps and extend the limb so that the skin is drawn toward the area where you want to make the incision; finally, clear away the skin from the area where you want to cut in order to avoid cutting into the skin.
E pausa fust o taula dejos le os decentment, quar quan tu fas aquo no es prohibida la serra que no secce la carn corrumpuda.	And place a board or stick under the bone in a suitable position, so that when you make the cut with the saw, it will not cut into the corrupt flesh.
E cove que sia la serradura sobre le loc corrumput petit a petit, quar si es en la concavitat del os corrupcio e no appar en la sua apparicio al sentiment, e forssa a serratura de lu autra veguada.	And it is necessary that the sawing be done gradually on the corrupt spot, because if the corruption is in the concavity of the bone and not visible or palpable, the saw may cut into it from another direction.
E si le os es corrumput e no-eminent, abantz es la una partida continuada am la autra, e la corrupcio es al mieg loc o en partida de lu, lahoras tu descuebre la carn de totas partz tota; e aprop pausa fust dejos, e aprop serra aquel de la primiera partida la on es la corrupcio entro que sia continuada la serratura del autra partida.	But if the bone is corrupt and not prominent, and one side of it is connected to the other, and the corruption is in the middle or on one side, then you should expose all the flesh around it; and place a board underneath, and saw through the first section where the corruption is until the sawing is continuous with the second section.
E sia la serradura segon le loc de la corrupcio un petit, segon que havem dit.	And let the surgery be tailored to the location of the corruption, small as we have said.
E si la corrupcio es en la junctura, inscideys aquela junctura corrumpuda, e serra le os la on es continuat del autra part.	And if the corruption is in the joint, cut open that corrupt joint and saw the bone at the point where it connects to the other part.
E si de la corrupcio es en la continuacio de doas juncturas, lahoras no es en lu razio sino engen.	And if the corruption is in the continuity of two joints, then it is not reasonable but instead an abnormality.
E si la corrupcio es en le pecte de la ma o del pe, es mot dificil; empero cove que tu inquieras la corrupcio en qual manieyra appareys a tu, e que abradas aquela, e mondes aquela segon quascuna disposicio la qual es a tu possibla, e am cascum engen sia rectificat a tu, quan no fa a tu contrarietat vena o nervi.	And if the corruption is in the arm pit of the hand or foot, it is difficult; but it is necessary that you investigate the corruption in the manner it appears to you, and that you cut open that which can be cut, and clean it in a way that is possible for you, and correct every abnormality as long as it does not conflict with veins or nerves.
E sapias qual es inscididors e las serras a inscidir aquestz osses son motz segon le situament dels osses, e la preparacio de aquels, e la grosseza de aquels, e la subtilitat e la grandeza e la parvitat de aquels, e la duricia e la lor raritat; per que cove que tu prepares a tota specia de operacio estrument convenient ad aquela opperacio.	And know that the incisors and saws used to cut these bones are many according to the position of the bones, their preparation, thickness, subtlety, size, smallness, hardness, and rarity; therefore it is necessary that you prepare suitable instruments for every kind of operation.
E sapias que aquela operacio significa a tu sobre la specia del strument del qual indigeysses; quan am tu es gran studi e lonc e conoyssensa de las manieyras de aquesta art, e testimoni de manieyras de malautias, quar lahoras ja tu las avias per tu meteys aquo que es convenient a lu dels sturmentz a tota malautia.	And know that this operation indicates to you the type of instrument you need; when you have great study and experience in the methods of this art, and knowledge of various diseases, then you will have by yourself which instruments are suitable for every disease.
E yeu so a tu formant en la fi de aquest capitol le nombre dels instrumentz les quals pausaras cum eyssimples am les quals proceziras a la tua prohibicio la qual experimentaras sobre las autras.	And I have given you in this chapter the number of instruments that you will need, which are simple and with which you will proceed according to your own judgment and experience, which you will test on others.

Forma de un autra inscissori; aquest semblant a ray, e la extremitat de lu es cum serra, e es exhibit en motz locs en la razio dels osses:	Form of another incisor; this one resembles a saw and its end is like a saw, and it is used in many places on the surface of bones.

E la extremitat de lu es triangulada e de aguda extremitat.	And the end of it is triangular and sharp.
E es fayt de ferr de India , e semblantment cove que totas las causas que havem ditas de rasoris e de inscissoris e de serras.	And it is made of Indian iron, and similarly it is appropriate for all the uses that we have mentioned for rasps, incisors, and saws.
De inscizio extremitatz e de la serratura dels osses.	"De incisio extremitatibus" can be translated as "regarding the cutting of ends or extremities," while "de serratura ossium" can be translated as "regarding the sawing of bones." Therefore, the phrase "De inscizio extremitatatz e de la serratura dels osses" can be translated to "Regarding the cutting of extremities and the sawing of bones" or "On incisions at the ends and sawing bones."
Las extremitatz se poyresso o per causa intrinseca o per causa extrinseca, o cum tu auras medicat aquela corrupcio per curacio de aquelas medicinas e la curacio no comfereys, o vezes la corrupcio anar deves le membre la qual no percuteys denguna causa, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquel membre entro aquo la hon acossec la corrupcio, per que le malaute evasesca per aquo de mort o de malicia que es major defeliment del membre.	Extremities can become necrotic or undergo corruption due to intrinsic or extrinsic causes, or when a disease is not cured by medications, and sometimes the corruption spreads to the limb that is unaffected, in which case it is necessary to cut into the member where the corruption has spread, in order to prevent death or further damage to the limb.
E le senhal de aquel al qual accideys, es que·l membre es fayt negre entro que sia cujat que foc la ja comburit, o se poyreys aprop la negror entro que la poyredura aquela ane entro aquel membre que siec lu e que prengua tot le cors; e donc coyta te am inscizio de aquel.	And the sign of one who is affected, is that the member becomes black inside and appears to be charred, or you may notice the darkness spreading inside the member until it engulfs the whole body; therefore, quickly proceed with cutting into that part.
E semblantment si es causa de la corrupcio percussio de alcunas causas venenosas ayssi cum de scorpio mari o de vupera o de rutela e de semblantz.	Similarly, if the corruption is caused by a venomous strike from animals such as sea scorpions, vipers, or spiny fish, then it is necessary to proceed with incisions.
E si la corrupcio o la percussio es en la extremitat del dit, lahoras tu inscideys le dit e no dones spazi a la corrupcio per que ane entro a la ma.	And if the corruption or strike is on the extremity of the finger, then you should cut into the finger and not allow space for the corruption to enter into the hand.
E semblantment si accedeys a la ma, lahoras tu inscideys aquela de la razit del focil, e no dones spazi a la corrupcio entro que prengua en le focil del bras.	And similarly, if the corruption has reached the hand, then you should cut into it with an incision along the wrist, and not allow space for the corruption to enter into the forearm.
E si envezeys aquel, lahoras inscideys le bras entro al coyde en la junctura.	And if that is not possible, then you should cut into the arm at the elbow joint.
E si passa otra la corrupcio e la vezes enviro le coyde, lahoras en aquel es la mort del malaute; e aministrar autra causa otra aquo en curacio es quantitat de vertut.	And if the corruption has passed beyond and you see it has spread around the elbow, then in that case death is inevitable for the patient. There is no other remedy or cure to be administered.
E semblantment fay del pe quan corrupcio envezeys le dit del pe, lahoras tu inscideys aquel entro ad un dels nozes.	And similarly, do this for the foot when corruption affects the skin of the foot, therefore you make an incision in it to one of the toes.
E si pren en la pente del pe, lahoras tu inscideys tot le pe.	And if it takes hold in the sole of the foot, therefore you should incise the entire foot.
Mays si pueja entro al denol, lahoras tu inscideys la camba entro a la junctura del denol.	But if it rises into the tendon, therefore you should incise the calf at the joint of the tendon.
E si la corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denol, lahoras en lu no es engen sino dimissio, e layssar le malaute a la mort.	And if the corruption has already reached the tendon, then there is no ingestion but dismissal, and leave the patient to death.
E la manieyra de inscidir le membre o de serrar lu es que tu strenhas le liament en la partida pus dejos la qual voles inscidir, e strenh autre liament sobre le loc; e extenda le ministre un liament a las partidas dejos, e extenda le ministra autra liament en sus; e tu separa la carn la qual es entre dos liamentz ain spatum lat entro que sia descuberta tota la carn; e aprop sia inscidit o serrat.	The method of incising the limb or binding it is that you tighten the ligament in the part below where you want to incise, and tighten another ligament on top of the spot; and stretch a ligament by the lower parts, and stretch another ligament upon them; and separate the flesh which is between two ligaments as far apart as a finger's breadth so that all the flesh is exposed; and then let it be incised or bound.
E cove que sia pausat drap de li de totas partidas per so que no toque le loc sa, e que vengua al malaute lesio ajustada e apostema caut.	And it is necessary that cloth be placed on all sides so that it does not touch the wound, and that for the patient there comes an appropriate dressing and healing cautery.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc quan obras, lahoras tu cauteriza le loc coytadament, o pausa sus lu alcunas polveras restrenhentz le sanc; e aprop retorna a la tua medicacio entro que sia complida.	But if there occurs bleeding of blood when you operate, therefore cauterize the spot moderately, or place some restraining powders on it to stop the blood; and then return to your treatment until it is finished.
E aprop lia le membre plaguat am liament al u convenient, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then bind the affected limb with a ligature in a suitable place and cure that which is within until it heals.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc a un home en le sieu pe, aquest meteys accident le qual yeu e a tu recomtat, le qual es quar accidic a lu negror en le sieu pe am adustio que era asemblada a combustio de foc.	I recommend to you that which happens to a man in his foot, this same accident that happened to me, which is because of blackness in his foot with scorching which was like a fire's burning.
E aquela corrupcio accidic primierament en le sieu dit entro que tendec tot le pe.	And this corruption occurred first in his skin, extending over the entire foot.
E adonc aquel home preparec per si meteys pus que vic la curacio anar al membre am la vehemencia de lu que atrobec de dolor e de adustrio de lu, e el inscidic aquel pe entro a la junctura, e foc sanat.	And then that man prepared for himself likewise pus which accompanied the cure going to the limb with the vehemence of him who overcame pain and scorching from it, and he incised the foot at the joint, and it was healed.
Lonc temps accidic a lu aquela meteyssa corrupcio en le dit de la ma indic.	For a long time that man suffered from this same corruption in the skin of his right index finger.
E adonc venc a mi, e so me perforsat repercutir aquela superfluitat am aquo que pausegui sobre la ma de las medicinas, aprop la mundificacio del cos de lu; e no es repercussa la superfluitat e comensec anar al autra dit entro que comensec en la ma.	And then he came to me, and I managed to relieve him by applying remedies on his hand, in order to cleanse his body; but the discharge was not relieved and began to spread to another finger until it reached the hand.
E el apelec me a inscidir la ma de lu, e yeu no volgui far aquo sperant sobre la repercussio de aquela superfluitat, e mays que temegui deves la inscizio de la ma de lu mort, quar la vertut del malaute era sobre cazement.	And he asked me to incise his hand, but I did not want to do that, hoping for the relief of this discharge, and fearing rather the incision of his hand would lead to death, because the power of the illness was so strong.
E pus que el se desperec de mi, es retornat en la sua terra e pervenguec a mi que aquel home preparec e inscidic la sua ma tota, e es sanat.	And because he lost hope in me, he returned to his own country and later I heard that this man prepared himself and incised his entire hand, and was healed.
E no he adhuzida aquesta narracio sino per que sia adjutori sobre aquo que catz de aquesta malautia, e que sia significacio per la qual sia significada e segon la qual sia obrat.	I have not prolonged this narrative except to serve as an aid for those afflicted by this illness, and it is a sign which may be understood and followed in its treatment.
De cura sinuum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis.	On the care of sinuses and the quality of cleansing with medicines.
Quan accideys apostema en alcus membres carnozes e·l spazi de l’apostema es prolonguat entro que fa colleccio de sania, e aprop es romput e perforat, e es eyssida de lu la sania, e roman le loc vuoyt quays cum si era vayssel, e la codena que es desobre lu ayssi cum drap subtiliat, e no es pervengut a deriera corrupcio, e no inprimeys en le os o en nervi ni en liament, es apelat sinu, e no es nompnat fistula.	When an abscess forms in fleshy members and the space of the abscess is extended to such a degree that it collects pus, and then it bursts open and is perforated, and pus comes out of it, leaving a hollow cavity like a vessel, and the skin above it shrinks like thin cloth, and it has not spread to deep corruption, and it has neither affected bone nor nerve nor ligament, this is called a sinus, and it is not named a fistula.
Mays empero si le spazi es prolonguat entro que la corrupcio enprema en alcun membre, lahoras es appelada fistula e no zukem.	But if the space extends to such a degree that corruption affects some member, therefore it is called a fistula and not a sinus.
E la cura de lu es que inscidas aquela codena tota ayssi cum es revolvut, e majorment quan es subtiliada e es fayta cum drap, e comfizas que no adhereys al loc per la sua corrupcio.	And the treatment of it is that you incise the entire skin in the way it has folded over, especially when it has shrunk and become thin like cloth, and make sure that it does not stick to the location due to corruption.
Mays si tu speras que la codena adheresca e que aquela corrupcio no aja conseguit per deriera consecucio, e en la codena ha spassitut de cara, lahoras tu cura aquel am clisteri.	But if you hope that the skin will stick and that the corruption has not yet reached in a deeper consequence, and there is some softness of flesh visible, then treat this with an enema.
E es que consideras al sinu, e lahoras si es gran, e·l brac que yeys es de fetent odor, lahoras clisteriza aquel am medicament egipciac le qual es de oli e vi agre e ziniar recebent partidas enguals, e sian ajustadas en un vayssel, e sian coytas sobre le foc entro que’l medicament se fassa rog e pervengua a specitut de mel.	And if you consider the sinus, and find that it is large, and there is fetid odor from it, then give an enema with this Egyptian medicine which consists of oil, vinegar, and juniper, receiving equal parts and mixed together in a vessel, and heated over the fire until the medicine becomes thick like honey.
E aprop tu pren de lu aquo que es necessari e dissolveys lu am aygua e mel; e clisteriza am aquel le sinu, e strenh le orrifici de lu, e layssa la medicina en lu per la quantitat de doas horas.	And then take what is necessary from it and dissolve it in water and honey, and give the enema for the sinus, and strengthen the orifices of it, and leave the medicine in for two hours.
E aprop extratz aquela am sprecio; e fay aquo per tantz dias entro que sia mundificat le sinu e sia remauguda la pudor.	And then extract that with stool, and do this for so many days until the sinus is cleaned out and the bad smell disappears.
E alcunas veguadas es clisterizat am aygua de cendre, quan no es a tu prezent aquest medicament; e es que tu prenguas la cendra de vitz, e met sobre lu aygua; e aprop cola aquela e clisteriza aquel am ela entro que te confizes que·l sinu lahoras es ostat.	And sometimes it is given an enema of ashes and water, when this medicine is not available to you; and take the ash of wheat and pour water over it, and then boil that and give the enema with it until you are certain that the sinus has been stopped.
E si le malaute no ha tollerancia sobre le medicament egipciac ni l’aygua de la cendre, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aygua e mel e quays sia mesclat ziniar trissat, e clisteriza aquel am vi e mel mesclat, quar de proprietat de mel es que mondifique e lave, e le vi fa adherir le sinu, e majorment quan en le vi ha superfluitat de stipticitat e de siccitat.	And if the patient cannot tolerate the Egyptian medicine or the ash water, then give an enema of water and honey with juniper juice mixed in three hundred parts, and also give an enema of wine and honey mixed together, because the property of honey is to cleanse and wash, while the wine causes the sinus to adhere, especially when the wine has a surplus of stypticity and dryness.
E cum tu fas aquo alcunas veguadas e te comfizes que·l sinu ja es remaugut, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aquo que fa naysser la carn en lu.	And when you do this several times and are certain that the sinus has healed, then give an enema with something which makes the flesh grow in it.
E es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e dissolveys aquel am oli rozat e vi stiptic; o que clisterizas aquel am alcunas medicinas e enguentz autres que hajan las proprietatz les quals ja he yeu scritz en le tractat dels enguents.	And take diaphoretic ointment and dissolve it in rose oil and astringent wine, or give an enema with some medicines and other ointments which have the properties that I have written about in the treatise on ointments.
E si le orrifici del sinu es streyt en le qual no es recebuda la canula del clisteri, lahoras tu le amplifique aquel am ferr petit a petit, e pausa en lu calgua envolopada en enguent egipciac o en enguent basilicon entro que sia amplificat.	But if the orifice of the sinus is narrow and cannot receive the cannula for an enema, then gradually widen it with a small iron instrument, and place in it a cloth dipped in Egyptian ointment or basilicon ointment until it has been widened.
E semblantment si le orrifici es ample, lahoras tu agregua las labias de lu am sutura e layssa de lu quantitat en la qual intre le clisteri ses addicio.	And similarly, if the orifice is wide, then bring together its lips with stitches and leave enough space for the enema cannula to be added without overflowing.
E si le orrifici de lu del qual corr le brac es elevat a las partidas desus, lahoras secca aquel en le pus bas loc que es en lu per que le brac corra entro dejos, quar quan le brac es coartat en la preondeza de sinu la carn esser en lu engendrada.	And if the orifice of it from which pus flows is raised up above, then dry that part at a lower location in order to make the pus flow into the lower part, because when the pus is obstructed by the swelling of the sinus, flesh is generated there.
E si no es a tu possible seccar le sinu entro al enviro del os pus bas segon que voles, lahoras te perforssa que prepares le membre am preparacio per la qual corr de lu le brac leugierament segon que es a tu apparelhat e que no sia en lu retengut alcuna causa del brac.	And if it is not possible for you to dry the sinus in the area below the bone as you wish, then make sure that the member is prepared with a preparation which allows the pus to flow out lightly, according to what is appropriate, and without any obstruction of the pus remaining.
E pren medicinas consolidativas que sian pausadas sobre le sinu convenientz ad aquo que vols exxten aquelas sobre drap de li.	Take consolidating medicines which should be placed on the sinus appropriately according to what you want to extend that over cloth.
E le drap sia de tan gran quantitat cum fa la comunicacio de tot le sinu; e aprop inscidey am las forfexs en le dreyt del orrifici del sinu un trauc pus ample un pauc que l’orrifici del sinu; e aprop exten sobre autre drap de li dels enguentz leons segon la quantitat del trauc, e pausa le sobre aquel per posicio longinqua del orrifici del sinu per que sia aleujat le eyssiment del brac de lu e no ostes le drap gran sino aprop alcus dyas una veguada.	And the cloth should be of sufficient quantity to cover the entire sinus; and then use scissors to make an incision at the right of the orifice of the sinus, making it larger than the opening by a little bit; and then extend over another piece of cloth with lion's ointment according to the length of the incision, and place that over it in a position far from the orifice of the sinus so as to relieve the discharge of pus from it, and do not remove the large cloth until several days have passed.
Mays aquel que es sobre le orrifici del sinu, le qual remauguas en tota hora per so que yesca aquo que es ajust en lu del brac.	But the one that is over the opening of the sinus should remain in place at all times so as not to obstruct what flows from it.
E per que sapias si aquo que corr de lu del brac es mot o pauc, o es digest, o es no-digest.	And so that you know if what flows from the opening is much or little, digested or undigested.
E am aysso tu considera le loc de aquel sinu, si en lu sent le pacient dolor o no, e si es en lu apostema.	And in this, you consider the location of that cavity, whether the patient feels pain there or not, and if there is an abscess present.
E cum la tua medicacio es prolonguada en la tal manieyra, e vesas la matiera que es gitada sobre le orrifici del sinu ja adhereys, o se apropria adherencia, lahoras le mayti tu le deslia o le tertz dia, e quan deslias la plagua, lahoras muda le drap per autre e renova le enguent.	And as your treatment progresses in this manner, and you see the matter that is discharged from the cavity's opening has adhered or begun to stick, then loosen it on the third day, and when you loosen the wound, change the dressing for a new one.
Mays si del sinu aprop lon spazi yeys virus subtil, lahoras no te desperes de la adherencia de li, quar la sanacio de lu se apropria, quar so alcus homes en les quals tarda generacio de carn en las lors plaguas, e de aquels so en les quals es fayt le contrari de lu.	But if the cavity is deep and contains subtle and pervasive corruption, then do not be alarmed by any adhesion that forms there, for it indicates healing, as this happens in those who have a slow generation of flesh in their wounds, and it is precisely the opposite for others.
E si del sinu aprop motz dias es yssit brac indigest, lahoras sapias que·l sinu no adhereys; e si es tardada la adherencia del sinu e es la causa prolonguada, lahoras tu ajusta en exsiccacio de las medicinas, e si las medicinas so humidas en lor substancia e en la sua vertut, son seccas ayssi cum enguent dyafinicon, quan es en lu ajustada superfluitat de addicio de zegi.	And if for many days pus has been discharged from the cavity, then know that it is not healing, and if adhesion in the cavity is slow to form, and the cause prolonged, then adjust the dryness of the medicines, and if they are wet in their substance and effect, make them as dry as a diaphanicon ointment when there is an excess of addition of fat.
E le mays derier am le qual es curat, es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e sia dissout en oli rozat, e sia sobre lu vojat vi antic engual en la sua substancia, e aprop comfeys aquel am lu, e usa de aquel.	The last remedy for healing is to take diaphanicon ointment and dissolve it in roasted oil, then add some crushed egg white into its substance and mix it well with that. Use this mixture.
E ja fa semblant en aquela accio, quan no y a brac, enguent dyafinicon, mel quan es coyt entro que sia engrossat, e usa de lu; o que prenguas mirra e aloen e enses, e trissa tot e polveriza sobre le mel quan es sus le foc, e aprop lineys aquo sobre drap e strenh aquel sobre le sinu; e lineys aquel am le mel le qual has cuoyt entro que es engrossat, e polveriza sobre drap e strenh aquel.	And perform this action when there is no pus, by using diaphanicon ointment, melted until it becomes thick, and use that; or take myrrh, aloe, and wax, grind them into a fine powder over fire and place it on a cloth, then apply it to the cavity. Grind the mixture with honey until it becomes thick, then sprinkle it on a cloth and apply it.
E alcunas veguadas so administratz am lu aristologia longua e razitz de lili celesti (e es lili celesti) e farina de errs e centaurea, e usa de aquels simples o ajustatz, trissa aquels e cribela e polveriza sobre le mel le qual he recomtat; e husa de lu.	And sometimes these remedies are administered with long aristolochia and celestial lily root (celestial lily is a type of plant) and powdered iris and centaury, and use these simple herbs or adjust them as needed, grind them into a fine powder and sprinkle it over the honey that I have mentioned; and use that.
E si es prolonguat le sinu, e no es sanat per aquesta curacio, lahoras sapias que la corrupcio es en le preon de lu, e ja fa enquisicio en les osses o en les autres membres durs o als liaments; lahoras tu le cura am curacio fistular, ayssi cum desus es dit.	And if the cavity is prolonged and does not heal with this treatment, then know that the corruption is in its depths and has formed a fistula in the bones or other hard members or tendons; then cure it with fistula treatment as mentioned before.
De curacio de panarici et unguis attritae et incisione digiti additi et sectione.	The following is about treating paronychia (inflammation of the nail fold), onychia (nail infection or inflammation), digital incisions, and finger amputations.
Panarici es apostema le qual nays dejos la ungla del dit pous de la ma o del pe, e fort leu nays en les autres ditz, e cum es prolonguat e la sua curacio es mens prezada, o es apostemat de apostema caut, o es corrumput, e gieta brac entro que corrodeys la razitz de la ungla, e fort leu corromp aquela tota, e fort leu perve la sua corrupcio al os entro que es a lu odor fetent, e es fayta la extremitat del dit lada, e la color de lu es fayta fusca.	Paronychia is an abscess that forms under the nail of the finger or toe and can occur in other fingers as well. If it becomes prolonged and its treatment is less valued, then it can become a deeper abscess or corrupted, causing pus to discharge from beneath the nail, which can cause its decay and easily spread corruption into the bone within, resulting in a stinky odor and causing the finger's tip to rot. The color of the affected area becomes darkened.

And therefore when you have that with what we have mentioned in the division and it does not respond to your treatment, then it is necessary that you make an incision with iron through all the excess skin that has formed on the nail and cauterize the wound with that because cautery is helpful in this case.
Mays si le os es sa e la ungla es sana, e las addicios de la ungla vuoydas ja compremen las carns a las partidas dedintz, e comensan lu punger e ledeysso aquela, lahoras cove que tu pauses ray subtil dejos le angle de la ungla que pungeys la carn, e impelleys aquela sus e inscideys aquela carn am facilitat, e pausa sobre aquo que roman de la carn de las medicinas comburentz corrosivas entro que sia tot remaugut; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	But if the bone is healthy and the nail is also sound, but the growths of the nail are already compressing the flesh against its divisions, causing it to pierce and injure that area, then it is necessary to make a fine incision below the angle of the nail, carefully pushing back the skin and making an incision in the flesh with ease. Place remnants of the flesh on a cloth soaked in corrosive burning medicines until it has all been consumed; then cure it with ointments until it is healed.
Mays si la corrupcio ja enprem en le os, lahoras cove que tu inscidas le os aquel e le extraguas, car nul temps no es sanat que sia en lu le os corrumput. And if sometimes the corruption and decay spread to the finger, then you should make an incision in one of the knuckles according to the memory that is pressed there, and then cure it until it is healed.
Mays si a la ungla endeve percussio o atricio, e endeve en aquela dolor vehement, lahoras cove que tu al comensament fleubotomes le malaute, e aprop secca la ungla am spatum agut am seccio transversa desus en jus, e guarda te que la seccio no pervengua entro a la carn que es dejos la ungla, quar tu faras accidir al malaute dolor vehement, e sira causa a nativitat de la carn ajustada superflua en le loc; e aprop cura aquel loc am aquo que ceda dolor.	But if the nail has undergone percussion or friction and it causes intense pain, then at first, it is necessary to bleed the patient, and then dry the nail with a sharp spatula with a transverse section from above downward, ensuring that the incision does not reach the flesh below the nail. This will prevent an intense pain for the patient and avoid causing an abnormal growth of skin in the area. Then cure it with something that alleviates the pain.
Mays dit ajustat, le qual es nat en las mas de alcus homes, fort leu es carnos tot, e fort leu so en lu osses, o fort leu es en lu ungla.	But sometimes, what is abnormal for some people can be normal for others, as it can easily become all flesh in the case of certain individuals, or become bone in other cases, or even turn into a nail.
E alcus de lu son natz en la razit de la junctura, o es la nativitat de lu en alcus nozes dels ditz.	And some are born on the sides of the joints, while others are born in certain knuckles of the fingers.
Mays aquel que es nat en alcus nozes del dit no se mau, e aquest que es nat en las juncturas fort leu es maugut.	But one that is born on the knuckles of the finger will not be harmful, whereas one that is born in the joints can easily become problematic.

Mays de aquel que es nat en la razitz de la junctura, la curacio es dificil; e donc guarda te de la abscizio de lu.	But for those born on the sides of the joints, the cure is difficult and therefore one should be careful with any incision in that area.

De inscizio de vices, so son varicas.	Regarding incisions on veins, there are varicose veins.
Vices so son varicas, e so venas envolutas grossas plenas de superfluitatz melencolicas las quals veno en motz dels membres del cors, e le major adveniment de lor en las cambas, e majorment en las cambas dels itinerantz e dels laborantz e dels portantz.	Varicose veins are when the veins become swollen and thick with melancholic fluids that collect in various parts of the body, especially in the legs, and more so in the legs of travelers, laborers, and carriers.
Adonc cove que tu administres purguacio del cors de colera negra alcunas veguadas am expulcio fort, e aprop sangna le pacient de la vena basilica.	Therefore, it is necessary to administer a strong purge for black bile several times with evacuation, and then bleed the patient from the basilic vein.
Mays la curacio de lor am ferr es segon dos manieyras: la una es que sia inscizas e sia atirat aquel sanc negre, e l’autra manieyra es que sia elevada la vena e sia extrayta tota.	But the cure for varicose veins with iron can be done in two ways: one is by incising and drawing out black blood, and the other method is raising the vein and extracting it completely.
La seccio de lu es segon aquesta manieyra: embroca al comensament la camba am aygua cauda mot entro que le sanc gros sia resolvut, que es feculent de la camba, e aprop strenh la camba del malaute a la partida pus sobirana de la coyssa entro a la partida dejos del denol am una benda, e aprop secca la vena en un loc, o en dos, o en tres am seccio ampla, e aprop eleva le sanc negra am la tieua ma de la partida dejos de la camba entro en sus, e desus en jus, entro que del sanc sia yssida la quantitat que voles e que vezes habastar, e la qual tollera la vertut del malaute.	The incision method is as follows: first, soak the leg with warm water until the thick blood in the calf has been dissolved, which is the fatty part of the leg. Then bind the leg of the patient to the upper part of the thigh using a bandage, and dry the vein in one place or two or three places with a wide incision. Finally, raise the black blood with your hand from below the calf upward toward the inside, squeezing out the amount of blood that you deem necessary for the patient to bear based on their strength.
E aprop lia aquela, e comanda a lu que abstengua de las viandas colera negra engendrantz.	Then bind it and command the patient to avoid foods that cause black bile to form.
E itera la curacio per fleubotomia quan las venas so umplidas e aquo notz al malaute.	And repeat the cure through bloodletting when the veins are full and this is noticeable in the patient.
Mays la elevacio de lor es segon aquesta manieyra: tu que razas la camba del malaute, si en lu so motz pels, e aprop met le en banh e embroca la camba de lu am aygua cauda entro que s’enrogesesca e las venas sian exuberadas; o que sia exercitat per exercici fort, si banh no es a tu present, entro que·l membre sia scalfat.	But elevating them is done in this way: you should massage the patient's leg, if it has many knots, and then place it in hot water until their leg becomes red and the veins become swollen; or exercise it vigorously if a bath is not available until the limb feels tired.
E aprop secsa la codena en le dreyt de la vena per seccio en le lonc o en le derier de lu deves le denol, o en le pus bas de lu deves lo talo.	And dry the skin along the vein by making an incision in its length or at the back of it near the heel or on the bottom near the toes.
E aprop uobre la codena am uncis e excorja la vena de tota part entro que appara al sentiment, e es deves la appericio de lu que vezes aquela roga declinant a negror. E donc cum evazeys e de la codena tu vezes aquela blanca quays sia corda.	And as you leave, and from the neck, you see that whitish vein that is the cord.

E aprop secsa autra seccio aprop aquela seccio per tres ditz, e aprop excorja la codena de la partida desus de la vena entro que apparia.	Then dry another section above that one for three fingerwidths, and scrape the skin of the neck from the area above the vein where it appears.
E aprop eleva aquela e inscideys aquela en deriera seccio deves le talo, e aprop extratz aquela e eleva aquela entro que sia yssida per la seccio segonda, e aprop extratz aquela de la seccio que es sobre aquela.	Then raise and make an incision in the skin of the second section at the ankle, and extract what has come out through that second incision and raise it up, and then extract what is from the third section above it.
E fay aquo entro que extraguas aquela de la seccio que es pus sobirana o pus auta de totas las seccios, entro que tota es yssida; e lahoras inscideys aquela.	And do that until you extract the one from the highest or deepest section of all the sections, until everything is removed, and then make an incision there.
E si no obezeys a tu ad extrayre e elevar, lahoras intromet una agulha am fiel fort doble e ligua aquela e extratz la, o intromet dejos lu le ray e revolveys la tua ma a tota part entro qu’en sia getada.	And if it does not come out easily or rise up, then insert a needle with strong double-strength thread and tie it off and extract it, or insert the lancet below it and rotate your hand until it is removed.
E guarda te que no sia inscidida; quar si es trencada, es fayt a tu dificil elevar aquela mot e es vengut sobre le malaute per aquela nocument.	And be careful not to make an incision, for if it is broken, it will be difficult to raise and may come out onto the patient, causing harm.
E cum aquela tota auras fora-gitada, lahoras pausa sobre le loc de la plagua lana submerssa en vi e oli rozat e oli no-rozat, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat. And if the vein is constricted and twisted with a kink that prevents it from flowing as we have said, then you must make an incision along the entire length of the twist and at the sites of constriction, and then suspend it with hooks until you can raise it up.
E guarda te deves la tua seccio que no inscidas la vena e que no plagues aquela, quar dificil sira a tu elevar aquela; e serva la tua prudencia en aquela.	And be careful to avoid making an incision on the vein and to not harm it, for it will be difficult to raise if you do; use your judgment carefully in this matter.
