E semblantment fay de la sophena del autre pe engualment.	And similarly, do so with the saphenous vein of the other foot as well.
E de la vena sciatica, le loc ayssi cum havem dit es deves le talo dejos la cavilha de la partida silvestra.	And the location for bloodletting from the sciatic vein is as I have said, below the calf in the lower part of the leg.
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de lu es a dolo de anca quan es per sanc caut.	And the benefit of bloodletting from that one is for pain in the hip caused by clotted blood.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intre en banh, e festine e strenha la cueyssa de lu del latz de la ancha entro desus le talo desus quatre ditz an una benda longua subtil, quar no appar sino per aquo.	And the quality of bloodletting from that one is that the patient should enter a bath and quickly and strongly raise the knee of the affected leg above the calf up to four fingers' width using a long, thin band, so that it is not visible except for this.
E donc quan appar, lahoras tu fleubotoma aquela segon cascun engen que es a tu possible e segon le tranvers, e es milhor; o inscidas aquela per inscizio o secces aquela per seccio, quar le loc de lu es sal.	And therefore when it becomes visible, then make an incision on that one according to the type of vein that is possible for you and transversely, and this is better; or cut it with a scalpel or sever it with a slice, because its location is safe.
E ela es en motz homes mot ameguada; e si atrobas aquela, e no appar al sentiment de tot, lahoras fleubotoma alcun ram de lu, e es aquel que appar en le dos del pe enves le dit auricular e le anular.	And it is narrow in many men; and if you find that one and it does not become fully visible to the touch, then make an incision on one of its branches, which appears on the back of the foot towards the base of the ring finger and little finger.
E guarda te dels nervis, e fay correr del sanc la quantitat que voles.	And be careful with the nerves, and let the blood flow in the quantity you want.
E aprop deslia la strictura e pausa sobre le loc de la fleubotomia coto e strenh le loc, quar leugierament es sanat.	And then release the tension and place a bandage on the site of the bloodletting, holding it firmly in place, because it heals lightly.
De ventozacio e de las qualitatz de uzar de aquelas.	Of cupping and the qualities of using those.
Ventozas so de corns, o de eram, o de veyre.	Cups are made from horn, or from glass, or from clay.
E ventozacio es fayta segon doas manieyras: la una de lor es am scarificacio e extracio de sanc, e l’autra es ventozacio ses scarificacio.	And cupping therapy is done in two ways: one is with scraping and the extraction of blood, and the other is without scraping.
E aquesta ventozacio que es ses scarificacio es segon doas manieyras, quar o es am foc o ses foc.	And this cupping therapy that is done without scraping is performed in two ways: either with fire or without fire.
E a las ventozas que so administradas am scarificacio e extraccio de sanc son xiiii locs del cors, dels quals la un en lo qual so pausadas ventozas es alnocrati, e es la deriera partida del cap; e le mieg loc d’el de doas partz del col ensemp; e ventozas del mento dejos la mandibula pus dejos de la boca; e ventozas de doas spatulas; e ventozas de alohoster, e es sobre la fi de la coeta; e ventozas de dos focils, e so de dos brasses; e ventozas de doas cavilhas; e ventozas de doas cuoyssas.	And the cups that are administered with scraping and bloodletting are applied to 14 locations on the body, of which one is the place where cups are placed, and it is the back of the head; another location is at the base of the neck in two parts; cups are also placed under the chin below the jawbone and away from the mouth; two cups are placed on the shoulder blades; cups are applied to the lower abdomen above the pubic bone; cups are placed on both sides of the spine, one cup for each rib; and cups are placed on both ankles and knees.
E ventozacio no extratz le sanc sino de las venas menudas sparssas en la carn, e per aquo no catz la vertut per aquelas, ayssi cum es cazement per fleubotomia; ni no cove que ventozacio sia fayta am foc o ses foc en alcuna malautia fayta per replecio entro que le cors tot sia evacuat.	And cupping therapy does not extract blood from large veins, but rather from small scattered veins in the flesh, and therefore it does not have the same effect as bloodletting; furthermore, it is not necessary for cupping therapy to be performed with or without fire in any disease caused by congestion until the body has been fully evacuated.
Mays si necessitat provoca a ventozacio per malautia o per continua, aministrem aquela en tota hora al comensament del mes e en la fi de lu, e en le mieg loc de lu e en qualque temps sia.	But if necessity requires cupping therapy for illness or chronic conditions, it should be administered at any time at the beginning of the month and at the end of it, as well as in the middle and at various times.
La qual causa es quar dels homes es en les quals es sanc multiplicat entro que indigeys de extraccio de lu per ventozacio e atroba en le sieu cap graveza e soda; e de aquels es que atroba replecio e rogor en la sua cara e en le sieu cap, e en le sieu col; e de aquels es que atroba pruziment en la sua cara e en le sieu front e tenebrositat e hebetut en les sieus huels; e de aquels que gieta le loc de la sua ventozacio; e de aquels es que le lor ris es multiplicat; e de aquels es que atroba gustament de sanc en la sua boca, o que la lengua es apostemada e escup sanc; e de aquels es que lor dormir es multiplicat, e de aquels que vetz sanc en lo dormir rogor e antics e plaguas e autras causas a lor semblantz.	The reason for this is that in some people, blood becomes congested and requires extraction through cupping therapy; they may experience heaviness or tension in the head, as well as congestion and redness on their face, neck, and chest. Additionally, these individuals may have pustules on their face, swelling on their forehead, and dark circles or dullness in their eyes. They may also experience sweating at the site of cupping therapy, have a runny nose, or suffer from insomnia. These individuals may also experience bleeding during sleep, as well as nightmares, and other similar symptoms.
E donc quan vezes en alcuna causa de aquelas, e propriament si es en le tertz o miga del mes, lahoras comandam ventozacio esser fayta pus que so passadas del dia dos o tres horas.	And therefore when any of these causes are present, particularly in the third or middle of the month, it is recommended that cupping therapy be performed at least two or three hours after sunrise.
E juvament de ventozacio de la nuca es que quan aquela confereys a gravitat en le cap e ad aquo que es efondit als huels; mays cove que aquo sia aprop evacuacio de tot le cors.	And the benefit of cupping therapy on the neck is that it alleviates heaviness in the head and swelling in the eyes, but it is necessary for this to be accompanied by evacuation of the entire body.
E aquesta ventoza es en le loc de fleubotomia de la cephalica.	And this cupping therapy should be performed at the location of bloodletting from the cephalic vein.
E no es legut que use de lu aquel que es de frega complecio, o en le qual es catarr, quar dona ad aquel gran nocument.	It is not permitted to perform cupping therapy on those who have recently experienced sexual activity or those with a cold, as this can cause great harm.
E per aquo no cove que uso de aquela les vielhs, e en les caps dels quals so malautias frejas.	And therefore, cupping therapy should not be performed on the elderly or those with frail bodies, as they may experience negative effects.
Mays ad aquel que sobre aquela es continuant sobre lu es fayta oblivio; e per aquo cove que tu comandes al ventozador que depause la sua ma un petit am la ventosa a las partidas dejos, temen de la generacio de oblivio.	But for the one who is continuously lying above them, a forgetfulness is made; and therefore it is necessary that you instruct the cuerer to place his hand a little below the cupping glass at the edges, in order to prevent the creation of forgetfulness.
Mays ventozacio de alkehel es en loc de fleubotomia de la vena fusca e de la basilica: e per aquo confereys a asma, e a la constriccio de ale e a la scissura del sturment de ale, e a tos, e a replecio.	Cupping therapy on the neck is an alternative to bloodletting from the dark-colored vein and the basilic vein: and therefore it is beneficial for asthma, constriction of the airways, pain in the sternum, cough, and fullness (congestion).
E cove que sia enpellida la ventoza alkehel un petit, quar si es pausada dejos, engendra debilitat en le cors e en le stomac.	And it is necessary to apply the cupping glass on the neck a little, because if it is placed too low, it can cause weakness in the body and in the stomach.
E la ventozacio de alhagdahan confereys a las dolors accident en le cap e a obtalmia, e emigranea, e prefocacio, e a dolors en las razitz de las dentz; e es en loc de fleubotomia de la basiliqua.	And cupping therapy on the temples is beneficial for accidental pains in the head and eye diseases, migraines, facial paralysis, and toothaches: it is an alternative to bloodletting from the basilic vein.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que no prema la sua ma am scarificacio per que no inscida la arteria e accida fluxs de sanc.	And it is necessary to instruct the practitioner not to press his hand too hard during scarification, so as not to cut the artery and cause excessive bleeding.
E ventozacio dejos le mento comfereys a alcola en la boca, e a corrupcio de la gingiva, e a semblantz a lor de las malautias que so en la boca, e stan en loc de fleubotomia de aliheric que so en las doas labias.	And cupping therapy below the chin is beneficial for abscesses in the mouth, corruption of the gums, and similar diseases of the mouth: it is an alternative to bloodletting from the ala nasi veins which are located on the two lips.
Mays la ventozacio que es fayta sobre las doas spatulas confereys a caphatan, le qual es fayt per replecio de caliditat.	But cupping therapy that is performed using two spatulas is beneficial for heatstroke, which is caused by an excess of heat in the body.
E la ventosacio de las doas partidas dedintz dels focils confereys juvament de la fleubotomia de tres venas, so es de la basilica, fusca e cephalica, quar aquela atratz le sanc de totas aquelas venas pus manudas que so en la carn, e aquelas venas menudas de las autras venas pus grossas entro que pervengua la atraccio a las tres venas.	And cupping therapy on the inner sides of the eyebrows is beneficial as an alternative to bloodletting from three veins, namely the basilic, dark-colored and cephalic vein: because it draws blood from all those smaller veins that are located in the flesh, as well as smaller branches of larger veins that run towards the three main veins.
E comanda al ventozador que trop no procezesca en scarificacio, quar le loc es denudat de carn, e dejos lu so nervis e arterias.	Instruct the practitioner not to proceed too deeply with scarification, because the area is stripped of flesh, and nerves and arteries are located beneath it.
E es una ventoza am la qual es ventozat sobre alshosses e confereys a las emorroydas del cul e a las ulceracios pus dejos.	And there is a cupping glass with which one can perform cupping therapy on the hips, and it is beneficial for hemorrhoids of the anus and painful ulcers located below.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que sia gran ventoza, e que sia de eram, quar le loc indigeys de fort seccio; e fort leu so traucadas ventozas subtils e sia scarificat am scarificacio.	And it is necessary to instruct the practitioner to use a large cupping glass, made of iron, because the area requires strong suction: and light, fine cupping glasses should not be used, but rather they should be scarified with scarification.
Mays ventozas de las cambas minueysso per minuicio manifesta, quar atiran le sanc de tot le cors, e comfereysso a dolors antiquas dels ronhos e de la mayre, e de la vesica; e provocan las mestruas, e comfereysso a bothor e ademil; e stan en loc de fleubotomia de doas sophenas, e alahorcoben, e de doas cavilhas.	But fine cupping glasses on the legs are beneficial for subtle symptoms, because they draw blood from all over the body, and are helpful for old pains in the lungs, kidneys, and bladder; they provoke menstruation, and are beneficial for bloating and constipation: they are an alternative to bloodletting from two jugular veins, and two subclavian veins.
Enpero mot debelitan tot le cors e fan accidir sincopi en motz homes.	However, they greatly weaken the entire body and cause fainting in some people.
E de las ventozas alahorcoben le juvament es propda al juvament a las ventozas de doas cambas.	And the benefit of cupping therapy on the subclavian veins is similar to that of cupping therapy on the two legs.
E la qualitat de la posicio de las ventozas es que pauses la ventoza al comensament vueda e sucguas per succio temprada, e no prolongues la posicio de las ventozas, mays pausa aquelas leugierament, e reman aquelas coytadament, e que las humors venguan al loc per adveniment engual.	And the quality of cupping therapy is to place the cupping glass upside down at first and then gradually increase suction, without maintaining the position of the cupping glasses for too long: rather, they should be placed lightly, and left in place gently, allowing the humors to come to the area through natural attraction.
E no cesses iterar aquo e continuar entro que veja le loc ja enrojezir e inflar e que appara la rogor del sanc.	And do not stop repeating this process and continuing until you see the area become red and swollen, and observe signs of blood appearing.
E lahoras tu scarifiqua e itera la succio pauc a pauc, e aprop considera en la dispozicio dels cors.	And then you perform scarification and gradually increase suction, and at the same time observe the condition of the body.
Quar aquel home que es de tendra carn de rars pors, cove que tu le scarifiques una veguada e no pus, per que le loc no sia ulcerat.	Because for a person with thin flesh and little fat, it is necessary to scarify only once, not more, because the area can become ulcerated.
E comanda al ventozador que amplifique la scarificacio e pronde un pauc, e atempre la succio am facilitat.	And instruct the practitioner to enlarge the scarification and deepen it slightly, while controlling suction with ease.
E si en le sanc es grossitut, lahoras cove que scarifiques doas veguadas, quar en la primieyra veguada es uberta la via de subtiliacio al sanc e a la aquositat de lu.	And if the blood is thick, then it is necessary to scarify twice, because in the first instance, a passage for subtle excretion of blood and its watery component is opened up.
Mays en la segunda a la perscrutacio aquisida de la extraccio del sanc gros.	But in the second instance, carefully seek complete extraction of thicker blood.
E si le sanc es mot feculent, lahoras sia fayta scarificacio la tersa veguada per que consiegua le derier.	And if the blood is very viscous, then a third scarification should be performed in order to achieve complete extraction.
E derierament, quan volem extrayre le sanc pauc a pauc o un petit, abasta a nos una scarificacio.	Finally, when you wish to extract blood slowly or a small amount, a single scarification will suffice.
E si volem extraccio de mot sanc, scarificam am mota scarificacio; e si nos conoyssem que·l sanc es gros, lahoras cove que scarifiquem per scarificacio preonda.	And if you wish to extract a large amount of blood, perform multiple scarifications: and if you know that the blood is thick, then it is necessary to scarify deeply.
E le terme de scarificacio en la qual es la profunditat de la codena tant solament.	And the depth of scarification should be no more than the length of a quill pen.
E si aquel del qual la codena es grossa, dura, fusca, e les sieus pors so streytz, cove que les locs de las ventosas sian untatz lenitius, apertius resolutius; si es en temps d’estiu, ayssi cum es oli de aloen o oli de violat, o oli de amellas dossas, o oli de cemensa de coja; e si es en temps ivern, lahoras oli narci, o oli de liri, o oli de camamilla, o de sanc, e ad aquels semblantz.	And if the person has a thick, hard and dark quill pen, then the places where cupping glasses are applied should be smeared with more gentle, wider and softer oils; in summer these can be aloe oil or violet oil, or oil of bitter almonds, or rose oil: and in winter, use narcissus oil, lily oil, chamomile oil, or similar. [\[1\]: <https://books.google.com/ngrams/graph?content=ventozado%2Cventosacio%2Cventosa%2Cventozador&year_start=1500&year_end=2008&corpus=23&smoothing=3&share=&direct_url=t1%3B%2Cventozado%3B%2Cc0%3B.t1%3B%2Cventosacio%3B%2Cc0%3B.t1%3B%2Cventosa%3B%2Cc0%3B.t1%3B%2Cventozador%3B%2Cc0>]
E si la superfluitat es grossa, freja, lahoras le oli sia amaranti, o oli de balsamita, o oli de aloen, o oli aneti, e a lor semblantz.	And if there is excessive phlegm that is thick and abundant, use oils such as wormwood oil, balsamite oil, aloe oil, or aniseed oil.
Mays si le ventozador es de amples pors de tendra carn, lahoras cove que sia prohibit de oli, e cove que ad aquest les locs de ventozas de lor aprop la ventozacio sian lavatz am ayguaros o am aygua freja de solatrum, o am aygua de coja, o am aygua de bordolaguas, e semblantz ad aquelas.	But if the practitioner has wide pores and thin flesh, then it is necessary to prohibit the use of oil: and for such individuals, the places where cupping glasses are applied should be cleaned with rosewater or cold water from the sun, or with water from a colander, or similar.
E aquel del qual le sanc es de mota humiditat, lava las suas ventozas am vi agre, o am aygua de mirt e sumac e semblant ad aquels.	And for a person whose blood is very watery, it is recommended to clean the cupping glasses with sour wine or myrtle water and sumac: similar substances can also be used.
E de aquel del qual las superfluitatz son grossas, lava las suas ventozas am vi antic, o am aygua de sansuc, que es majorana, o de decoccio de anet, o de camamilla, e a lor semblantz.	And for those with excessive phlegm, it is recommended to clean the cupping glasses with aged wine or water infused with marjoram, or with a decoction of dill or chamomile: similar substances can also be used.
E cove que la ventozacio sia guardada denant de banh; habantz cove que sia aministrada aprop issiment del banh per una hora o per doas, e cove que dorma aprop la ventozacio.	And it is necessary that cupping therapy should be performed before bathing: and it should be administered immediately after bathing for one or two hours, and it is necessary to sleep with the cupping glasses in place.
Quid est quo oportet ut regatur ventosandus aus phlebotomatus ante ventosationem.	What is meant is that it is necessary to regulate the patient (the one who will undergo cupping therapy) or the person performing bloodletting before cupping therapy.
Cove que consideras al comensament: lahoras si le ventozador o aquel que·s deu fleubotomar es coleric e ventz sobre lu sanc agut e imflamacio, lahoras cove que prengua causas infrigidantz, ayssi cum milgranas acetosas, e endivia an vi agre e laytuguas, e secanabin, e julep, e a lor semblantz.	It is necessary to pay attention at the beginning: if the practitioner or the person performing bloodletting has a choleric temperament and causes sharp, inflamed blood, then it is necessary to use cooling substances such as vinegar-soaked millet, endive with sour wine and lettuce, scammony, julep, and similar. E pausa a lor viandas ayssi cum poletz, e carns de auzels serbiges, e viandas conditas am agras, e a lu semblantz.	And have them eat foods such as chicken and bird meats, sour-tasting dishes, and similar.
E de aquel del qual la compleccio es freja, cove que prengua en beure eyssarop almiva, o eyssarop de alsecanabin de semensas, e sumac, e vi mot odorant migier entre viel et noel; e que a lu sia comendat que use de paucitat de beure e de mangar, e pausa las viandas de lu poletz e canabir e pissers e petitz auzels e colombat.	And for a person with a cold temperament, it is necessary to give them barley water or barley water with scammony seeds and sumac, mixed with wine that has a moderate amount of spices: and it is recommended that they eat and drink in moderation, avoid eating chicken and rabbit meat, as well as legumes, peas, and small birds. [\[4\]: <https://books.google.com/ngrams/graph?content=ventosar%2Cventosa%2Cventosacion%2Cventosatorio&year_start=1500&year_end=2008&corpus=23&smoothing=3&share=&direct_url=t1%3B%2Cventosar%3B%2Cc0%3B.t1%3B%2Cventosa%3B%2Cc0%3B.t1%3B%2Cventosacion%3B%2Cc0%3B.t1%3B%2Cventosatorio%3B%2Cc0>]
E cove que en lo dia de ventozacio e de fleubotomia le beure sia major que la vianda.	And it is necessary that on the day of cupping therapy and bloodletting, the patient should drink more than they eat. [\[5\]: <https://books.google.com/ngrams/graph?content=ventozacio%2Cventosacion%2Cventosatorio&year_start=1500&year_end=2008&corpus=23&smoothing=3&share=&direct_url=t1%3B%2Cventozacio%3B%2Cc0%3B.t1%3B%2Cventosacion%3B%2Cc0%3B.t1%3B%2Cventosatorio%3B%2Cc0>]
E cove que sia donat en beure en alcunas horas ad alcus homes tyriaca alpharac, o medicamentz de musc, so es muscada, o alcelita denant la ventozacio o denant fleubotomia o aprop, per so que·ls membres principals sian confortatz e que·l sanc sia subtiliat; e no cove que prenguan aquela scalfatz.	And it is necessary to give certain people theriac or medicines with musk, such as musk or aloe wood, before cupping therapy or bloodletting, in order to comfort the main members and make the blood more subtle: but it is not necessary for them to take strong laxatives. [\[6\]: <https://books.google.com/ngrams/graph?content=ventozadament%2Cventosacion%2Cventosatorio&year_start=1500&year_end=2008&corpus=23&smoothing=3&share=&direct_url=t1%3B%2Cventozadament%3B%2Cc0%3B.t1%3B%2Cventosacion%3B%2Cc0%3B.t1%3B%2Cventosatorio%3B%2Cc0>] [\[7\]: <https://books.google.com/ngrams/graph?content=ventozar%2Cventosa%2Cventosacion%2Cventosatorio&year_start=1500&year_end=2008&corpus=23&smoothing=3&share=&direct_url=t1%3B%2Cventozar%3B%2Cc0%3B.t1%3B%2Cventosa%3B%2Cc0%3B.t1%3B%2Cventosacion%3B%2Cc0%3B.t1%3B%2Cventosatorio%3B%2Cc0>]
Mays las ventozas que so ses scarificacio sian ventozas que so pausadas sus le fetge, e sobre la melsa e podagra, e sobre le umbelic, en les locs dels jonolhs, e la pixida del ancha, quar aquestz membres no suffertan scarificacio sobre si.	But cupping glasses that are used without scarification should be placed on the liver, above the spleen and gout, above the navel, on the joints of the hands and feet, and on the bladder in the loins: because these members cannot tolerate scarification.
E no es querit per aquelas sino atraccio de sanc de membre, ayssi cum pausam ventosa sobre mamilha en malautia de flux de sanc del sanc de las nars; e usam de aquela per que sia dissolvuda ventositat freja inviscade del membre, ayssi cum pausam sobre le ventre e l’umbelic; quar aquela rarifique le membre e scalfa lu e ramau la dolor quar resolveys ventositat.	And cupping glasses are not used for those members except to draw blood from the limb, such as placing a cupping glass on the breast in cases of nosebleed; and they use this method to dissolve cold and thick windiness in the member, such as placing it on the abdomen and navel: because it rarefies the member and warms it up, and removes pain by resolving wind.[\[8\]: <https://books.google.com/ngrams/graph?content=ventosa%2Cventosacion%2Cventosatorio&year_start=1500&year_end=2008&corpus=23&smoothing=3&share=&direct_url=t1%3B%2Cventosa%3B%2Cc0%3B.t1%3B%2Cventosacion%3B%2Cc0%3B.t1%3B%2Cventosatorio%3B%2Cc0>]
E ja es pausada sobre les ronhos quan accideys en lor opilacio o poyra, quar per vertut de atraccio fort leu huobre opilacio e erradica le poyra de son loc.	And cupping glasses can be placed on the lungs when there is thick phlegm or mucus in them: because due to strong attractive force, they easily draw out phlegm and remove it from its place.[\[9\]: <https://books.google.com/ngrams/graph?content=ventosacio%2Cventosatorio&year_start=1500&year_end=2008&corpus=23&smoothing=3&share=&direct_url=t1%3B%2Cventosacio%3B%2Cc0%3B.t1%3B%2Cventosatorio%3B%2Cc0>]
E semblantment fa quan es pausada sobre le fetge e la melsa deves ventositat en aquels enclausa.	And similarly, it works when the cupping glass is placed on the liver and spleen in cases of windiness trapped inside them.[\[10\]: <https://books.google.com/ngrams/graph?content=ventosar%2Cventosa%2Cventosacion%2Cventosatorio&year_start=1500&year_end=2008&corpus=23&smoothing=3&share=&direct_url=t1%3B%2Cventosar%3B%2Cc0%3B.t1%3B%2Cventosa%3B%2Cc0%3B.t1%3B%2Cventosacion%3B%2Cc0%3B.t1%3B%2Cventosatorio%3B%2Cc0>] [\[11\]: <https://books.google.com/ngrams/graph?content=ventozar%2Cventosa%2Cventosacion%2Cventosatorio&year_start=1500&year_end=2008&corpus=23&smoothing=3&share=&direct_url=t1%3B%2Cventozar%3B%2Cc0%3B.t1%3B%2Cventosa%3B%2Cc0%3B.t1%3B%2Cventosacion%3B%2Cc0%3B.t1%3B%2Cventosatorio%3B%2Cc0>][\[12\]: <https://books.google.com/ngrams/graph?content=ventosar%2Cventosa%2Cventosacion%2Cventosatorio&year_start=1500&year_end=2008&corpus=23&smoothing=3&share=&direct_url=t1%3B%2Cventosar%3B%2Cc0%3B.t1%3B%2Cventosa%3B%2Cc0%3B.t1%3B%2Cventosacion%3B%2Cc0%3B.t1%3B%2Cventosatorio%3B%2Cc0>][\[13\]: <https://books.google.com/ngrams/graph?content=ventosar%2Cventosa%2Cventosacion%2Cventosatorio&year_start=1500&year_end=2008&corpus=23&smoothing=3&share=&direct_url=t1%3B%2Cventosar%3B%2Cc0%3B.t1%3B%2Cventosa%3B%2Cc0%3B.t1%3B%2Cventosacion%3B%2Cc0%3B.t1%3B%2Cventosatorio%3B%2Cc0>][\[14\]: <https://books.google.com/ngrams/graph?content=ventozar%2Cventosa%2Cventosacion%2Cventosatorio&year_start=1500&year_end=2008&corpus=23&smoothing=3&share=&direct_url=t1%3B%2Cventozar%3B%2Cc0%3B.t1%3B%2Cventosa%3B%2Cc0%3B.t1%3B%2Cventosacion%3B%2Cc0%3B.t1%3B%2Cventosatorio%3B%2Cc0>]
E aquestas ventozas so administradas vuedas amb succio tant solament; e alcunas veguadas so administradas am foc.	And these cupping glasses are to be applied only with suction; and sometimes they are applied with fire.
E alcunas veguadas so administradas plenas de aygua tebeza en las malautias de la melsa.	And sometimes they are applied fully filled with warm water in cases of diseases of the spleen.
E aquo es per que la ventoza sia umplida e sia pus gran, so es aygua cauda sola o aygua en la qual sian cuytas herbas ad aquo convenientz.	And that is why the cupping glass should be filled and made larger, which is done with warm water alone or water in which suitable herbs have been boiled.
Forma de ventoza aministrada am foc: sia la amplitud del orrifici de dos ditz, segon que nos la havem formada; e la quantitat del preon sia la maytat de un palm; e sia en lo latz de lu, en le loc que es en le circuit, la maytat de lu, le trauc sia petit segon la quantitat que intre en lu una agulha.	Method of applying a cupping glass with fire: the width of the orifice should be two fingers, as we have made it; and the quantity of the pressure should be the size of a palm; and it should be in the middle of it, in the place that is on the circuit, the same size as it, the opening should be small according to the quantity that enters it, the size of a needle.
Sia fayta de eram rog o citri, de grosses marges, leon, enguals e terses per so que no leda le membre deves la sua posicio sobre lu.	It should be made of iron or citrus wood, with wide and thick edges, like a lion, smooth and polished so that it does not hurt the member when placed on it.
E sia al mieg de lu vergua transversa de eram o de ferr, on es pausada candela am lo foc.	And in the middle of it there should be a transverse bar of iron or of fire, where a candle with fire is placed.
E ja sia aquesta ventoza gran major de aquela la qual havem recomtat; e la pauca mendre de aquela segon las malautias e la etat de aquel que usa de aquela.	And this cupping glass should be significantly larger than the one we recommended earlier; and smaller according to the illness and the condition of the person using it.
E las ventosas dels efantz e extenuatz so autres que las ventozas dels joves e de grosses corssas.	And the cupping glasses for infants and weak individuals are different from those of young and sturdy individuals.
E la qualitat de pausar aquesta ventoza am foc sobre le membre es que extenda la meca am foc de lenha decentment denant una pauca candela de cera, e pausa aquela sobre le mieg de la vergua transversa en le mieg loc de la ventoza, per que le foc sia accendut enviro la partida dejos per que no sia comburit le cors del malaute.	And the way to apply this cupping glass with fire on the member is to extend a wick of decent wood fire in front of a small candle made of wax, and place it in the middle of the transverse bar at the center of the cupping glass, so that the fire is lit around its edge, but not burning the patient's skin.
E aprop sia pausada sobre le membre del malaute, e le dit sia sobre le trauc que havem dit, entro que quan tenem las ventozas e non indigem que osten le dit e que yesca la vapor sobre aquel trauc, lahoras la ventoza sira tantost dissolvuda.	And then it should be placed on the patient's member, and the finger should be placed over the opening that we mentioned, until when we hold the cupping glasses, and do not need to press the finger, but rather let the vapor rise over that opening, then the cupping glass will soon become loose.
E prop igneys la meca segon la sua manieyra, e itera aquela si indigeyssas de aquela.	And do the same with fire, in its way, and repeat that if necessary.
Mays en ventosa que es aministrada en la malautia de plauressi, am aygua, en la qual no ha vergua transversa ni trauc, e no es aministrada sino que sia umplida de aygua, e es pausada sobre le membre tant solament.	But for a cupping glass used in the treatment of pleurisy with water, without a transverse bar or opening, it is only filled with water and then placed on the member.
E aquesta es la forma de lu: E aquesta ventoza quant plus es gran, tant es milhor, per que puya recebre gran quantitat de aygua.	And this is the shape of it: And the larger this cupping glass is, the better it is, so that it can receive a large quantity of water.
Capitol .xcvii.	Chapter 97.
Sanguissuguas no so administradas en motz membres sino en les membres en les quals non es possible posicio de ventosas, per la parvitat de aquels, ayssi cum le pot e gingiva e semblantz a lor; o en membre denudat de carn, ayssi cum le dit e·l nas e lors semblantz.	Leeches are not applied to small members but rather to those where it is impossible to apply cupping glasses due to their small size, such as the mouth and gums or denuded members without flesh, such as the finger and nose and similar areas.
E la qualitat de usar de aquelas que si has trobadas sanguisugas que so en las ayguas dossas de poyredura mundas.	And the way to use those that have been found is to search for leeches in clean, stagnant waters.
E aprop sian layssadas le dia e la nueyt en aygua dossa entro que sian famolentas, e que no romangua alcuna causa en le ventre de aquelas; e aprop sia evacuat le cors en le comensament am fleubotomia e am ventozas; e aprop fregua le membre del malaute entro que s’enrojezesca; e aprop sian pausadas sobre lu.	And they should be left in stagnant water during the day and night until they are hungry, ensuring that there is no residual cause in their bellies, and evacuate their bowels at the beginning with phlebotomy and cupping glasses; and rub the patient's member until it turns red, then place them on it.
E cum son umplidas e caso.	And when they are full and satiated.
E si es possible succio del loc am ventoza, es mays derier en juvament.	And if it is possible to apply suction with a cupping glass in that location, it is more beneficial.
E sino, lahoras lava le loc am vi agre e aprop am mota aygua; e sia freguat e expremut.	And if not, then wash the area with vinegar and cold water, and rub it and press it.
E si es prolonguat le cors del sanc aprop le cazement de las sanguissuguas, e es aquo resudan, lahoras tu enfon un drap de li en aygua freja, e pausa aquel de sobre entro que sia abdida la resudacio.	And if the wound from the leech continues to bleed, and it oozes, then soak a piece of linen in cold water and place it over the wound until the oozing stops.
E si le sanc es multiplicat, lahoras polveriza sobre lu vitriol trissat, o guallas e semblantz a lor de las causas stipticas, entro que·l sanc sia abscidit; o sian pausadas sobre le loc las maytatz de favas excocicadas, e sian layssadas entro que las favas aderescan al loc, e es le sanc abscidit.	And if the bleeding is excessive, then sprinkle vitriol trisulphate or other styptic agents on it, until the bleeding stops; or place hot fava beans over the area and leave them there until they stick to the skin, and the bleeding will stop.
E cove, si es necessaria, iteracio de sanguissuguas, quan es possible mudar aquelas.	And it is necessary, if necessary, to repeat the application of leeches, when possible to replace them.
E si las sanguissuguas son prohibidas de suspenssio, lahoras sia freguat le loc am sanc recent o fique una agulha en les locs entro que yesca sanc; e aprop sian pausadas, quar aquelas quan sento alcun sanc tantost adarysso.	And if the use of leeches is not possible due to suspension, then rub the area with fresh blood or insert a needle into the location until it bleeds; and then place them, because leeches quickly move towards any source of blood.
E quan voles que cajan, polveriza sobre aquelas un pauc de aloen trissat, o sal, o cendre, e cazo tantost.	And when you want them to fall off, sprinkle a little bit of aloe trisulphate, salt or ashes on them and they will quickly detach themselves.
Ayssi comensa lo prolec de la tersa partida: de restauracio.	And so begins the third section of this treatise: on restoration.
Aquest capitol es motas veguadas necessari en la art de medicina; e es restauracio de fractura e de dislocacio accident en les osses.	This chapter is very necessary in the art of medicine, and it deals with the restoration of bone fractures and dislocations caused by accidents.
O, filh, sapiatz que jactan se de aquest capitol les fols metges e les vulguars e aquels que degun temps no reguardero les libres dels Antics ni legiro de aquels una letra.	My son, know that the ignorant doctors and the uneducated laypeople boast of this chapter, those who never studied the books of the Ancients or read a single letter from them.
E per aquesta causa es fayt que aquesta manieyra dels scients in terra nostra es privat; e yeu no ho e obliat en aquo degun temps be de tot; e no he adhibit aquo que apres, sino per longitut de lectio dels libres dels Antics e studi sobre le entendement de aquels, entro que extrayssi la sciencia de aquels.	And this is why the science of the ancients has been lost in our land, and I have not forgotten it at any time; rather, I have only used what I learned later through long study and analysis of the works of the ancients, extracting their knowledge and making it my own.
E aprop adirigui a experiment e studi en la longitut de la mieua vida.	And I continued to conduct experiments and engage in study throughout my life.
E yeu ja he de aquo descrit en aquest capitol tot aquo que conte la mieua sciencia e sobre le qual es passat lo mieu experiment; pus que agui abreujat aquo a vos autres e deliuregui aquo de occupacio de elonguacio; e abreujegui aquo en la fi de abreujacio; et e monstrat aquo en la fi de declaracio; e formegui en aquo motas formas dels sturmentz que so administratz en aquel, cum es fayt per addicio de declaracio, ayssi cum he fayt en dos capitols precedentz.	I have described in this chapter all that my science contains and on which I conducted experiments; for I have condensed it here for your convenience and delivered it from the distraction of lengthy exposition; and I have summarized it in a brief summary at the end, and demonstrated it clearly at the end of the explanation; and I have shown many forms of the instruments used in this practice, as an addition to the explanation, just as I did in two preceding chapters.
Capitol primier.	Chapter one.
Summae et collectiones ex esse fracturae ossium, ex eis quarum praemissio necessaria est, antequam incipiamus rememorationem membrorum fraftorum et diversorum si uniuscuiusque.	Summary and collections on bone fractures, from which a preliminary discussion is necessary before we begin to recall the bones of each member and their various types.
Cove donc que diguam en le prohemi de aquest capitol las summas del sermo; e les capitols al entendament dels quals en le comensament es forsat le artifexs e a stacio sobre la veritat de aquels; so es vos e aquels que so promptz que sapian o aprenguan aquesta art nobla autres de vos.	Therefore, it is necessary to provide in the introduction of this chapter an overview of the subject matter, and the chapters that form the foundation upon which the author relies, and on which the reader must focus in order to understand and master this noble art, as well as teach it to others.
E donc dic que quan accideys a alcu fractura o dislocacio o torcio o cazement, lahoras cove que tu te coytes al comensament am fleubotomia o aleyar aquel, o quascu ensemps, si no prohibeys alcuna causa, ayssi cum debelitat de vertut, o es aquel al qual accideys effant, o viel en decrepitat, o es temps de vehement calor, o de vehement freg.	Therefore, I say that when a fracture or dislocation or sprain or wound occurs, it is necessary to begin with phlebotomy or cauterization of the affected area, or both, if there is no prohibition due to factors such as debility, age (either infancy or old age), or extreme heat or cold.
E aprop sia content en vianda sieua de erbas frejas e de carns de auzels e de crabotz; e prohibem carns grossas e umplir si de viandas e de tota vianda que umple las venas de sanc, entro que siras segurat de apostema caut, e si no temes efusio de materia al membre.	And the diet should consist of fresh herbs and bird meat and crabs; and it is forbidden to eat heavy meats or foods that fill the veins with blood, until the danger of abscess has passed, and if there is no fear of effusion of matter in the affected member.
E lahoras retorne le malaute al sieu regiment primier am le qual corr costuma de lu.	And then the patient should return to their usual regimen and lifestyle that they were accustomed to before.
E donc cum le os trencat comensa esser restaurat, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia pascut de viandas nutritivas de nutriment mot e gros e greu en les quals sia viscositat, ayssi cum so viandas faytas de froment cueyt am aygua, e ris, e caps, e pes, e ventres de vacas, e huous, e peys fresc, e vi gros e semblants ad aquels, e am aquest regiment es fayta coagulacio de fractura pus leugierament e miels.	Therefore, when the broken bone begins to heal, it is necessary for the patient to eat nutritious foods that are rich and heavy, with a high viscosity, such as wheat bread baked with water, rice, peas, beef, poultry, fresh fish, thick wine, and similar foods. With this regimen, the healing of the fracture will occur more easily and smoothly.
E sapias que les osses trinquatz quan so en les homes que so en la primiera vilura e en los decrepitz, no es possible que sian continuatz e sian consolidatz segon lur natura per la exsiccacio dels membres de lor.	And know that bones that are fractured in those who are very young or elderly will not heal and consolidate as they naturally should due to the dryness of their members.
E son consolidatz e continuatz segon lor natura tot temps per la exsiccacio de aquels membres, e so continuatz e consolidatz aquels que so de lor en la fi de la lenitat, ayssi cum les osses dels petitz effantz.	And bones heal and consolidate naturally all the time due to the moistness of their members, and they are healed and consolidated when they are in a state of softness, just as is the case with the bones of young infants.
Mays empero natura ajusta e amnecteys sobre le os trencat de tota partida alcuna causa semblant a glut en le qual es grossitut que adhereys e strenh aquel entro que so ensemps conglutinatz e liatz ensemps, entro que venen la fi de fortitut e de fermesa, ayssi cum foc al comensament, entro que denguna causa no prohibeys aquel de las suas obres.	However, nature has provided a mechanism for the healing of bones that involves gluing together any similar causes, such as thickened matter that adheres and strengthens the bone until it becomes consolidated and united, like fire at the beginning, until some factor prevents it from performing its function.
E per aquesta causa es necessari que pauses las viandas del malaute, viandas en las quals so gravitat e viscozitat e grosseza, ayssi cum havem dit.	And for this reason, it is necessary to refrain from giving the patient food that is heavy, viscous, and large in quantity, as we have said.
Mota diversitat de fractura segon diversitat del membre.	There is a great variety of fractures according to the different parts of the body.
E sapias que las specias de fractura son diversas segon la diversitat dels membres, quar fractura del os de la camba es diversa de la fractura del os del cap; e la fractura del os del pietz es divers de la fractura del os del dos; e semblantment totz les autres membres son diverses entre lor.	And know that the types of fractures are different according to the different parts of the body, for a fracture of the bone of the leg is different from a fracture of the bone of the head; and a fracture of the bone of the arm is different from a fracture of the bone of the back; and similarly, all other members are different from one another.
E yeu venc am rememoracio de tota specia de fractura, expausada en le sieu capitol distincta del autre.	I will now recall for you all types of fractures, explained in their own separate chapter and distinguished from the others.
Mota diversitat de fractura en si meteyssa.	There is a great variety of fractures in themselves.
E son diversificadas las specias de fractura del os en lor meteyssas; quar es fayta fractura arcuada otra aquo que accidan en lu stellas; e alcunas veguadas es fayta fractura segon la longitut del os: e so las fracturas de lu satagia e astelhas e addicios procedentz e no-procedentz, ayssi cum es fayt en la pena quan es preparada a escriure, e es fractura am plagua e disrupcio en le cap, e es fractura fissura petita.	And the types of fractures in bones themselves are varied; for some are curved fractures, others are star-shaped fractures; and there are certain types of fractures based on the length of the bone: and these are the fractures of splinters and shards and protruding and non-protruding additions, as is done in a wound when it is prepared to be written on, and is a fracture with contusion and disruption at the head, and is a small fissure fracture.
E a tota specia es engen o turment propri en restauracio de lu segon que vindra rememoracio de lu distincta en les sieus locs.	And each type has its own specific treatment and remedy in restoring it, according to what will come to mind as a separate recollection in its own places.
Mota senhal de fractura del os.	There are signs of bone fractures. [*Note: The word "senhal" is similar to the French word "signal", meaning sign or indication.]
E per aquo es conoguda fractura del os: es tortuositat de lu, e de aquel eminencia e appericio de lu al sentiment, e so de lu quan compremes aquel am la tua ma.	And this is how a bone fracture is recognized: it is by the deformity and swelling of the affected area, as well as the sensation and appearance upon touch with the hand. Additionally, there is discomfort or pain when pressure is applied to the affected area with the hand.
E donc quan no es en le loc tortuositat apparent ni so no es feyt deves le tieu tocament quan toques le os am agitacio e le malaute no atroba gran dolor, lahoras no es aqui fractura.	And therefore, if there is no visible deformity or swelling in the area and when touched there is no abnormal sensation, as well as the patient experiencing little pain upon pressure being applied to the bone, then it is not a fracture.
Habantz es possible que sia tortuositat o petita fissura, adon no cove que tu mauguas aquel am la tua ma e am compressio de tot; habantz pausa sobre lu de las medicinas de las quals ve rememoracio aprop aquel moment le qual conveneys al loc; e aprop sia streyt per strictura subtil.	It is possible that there may be a deformity or small fissure, and therefore you should not manipulate the area with your hand or apply compression. Instead, pause over the area with one of the medicines that comes to mind at that moment that suits the location; and let it be applied with gentle traction rather than forceful compression.
E sapias que·l loc quan es arcuat e no es scindit en dos o otra aquo que no accidan en lu satagie, cum es remauguda tota partida de la sua compar, lahoras cove que comenses de la tua hora a rectificacio de lu habantz que a lu accida apostema caut.	And know that when the affected area is curved and not split in two or showing signs of dislocation, such as swelling throughout its entire length, then it is necessary to begin at once with correcting the curvature, but only if there are signs of abscess or pus formation. [*Note: The word "apostema" is similar to the Latin word "abscessus", meaning a collection of pus.]
E si a lu accida apostema caut, lahoras layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que cesse le apostema; e aprop engualha aquel segon quascuna manieyra que podes de levitat e de engen.	And if an abscess forms, then leave it alone for several days until the abscess dissipates; and apply remedies to it in any way that you can, using lightness and skill.
E sapias que restauracio de lu e agulacio de lu es pus leugiera que del os en le qual accideysso sathagie.	And know that restoration and healing of the affected area is easier than the healing of a bone fracture, which has become dislocated.
E aprop strenh aquel segon que vindra la rememoracio de lu.	And apply strength to it according to what comes to mind in your recollection of appropriate treatments.
Mays si en le os so satagias, lahoras es necessaria extencio de aquest membre trencat de doas partz, si es la ma o le pe; o am la tua ma si le membre es petit; o am doas cordas o am una corda e la ma.	But if the bone has become dislocated, then it is necessary to extend the broken member in two parts, whether it be an arm or a leg; or with your hand if the limb is small; or with two ropes or one rope and your hand.
E sia la tua posicio am la qual pauses le membre loc engual segon la sua figura natural, mentre que las partidas so extandudas del membre trenquat, lahoras te perforsa que fassas retornar aquelas addicios am engen e segon quascuna manieyra que poyras en lor locs.	And your position should be such that you keep the limb in its natural shape as it is extended, allowing for the broken parts to return to their proper places with skill and in any way possible.[*Note: The phrase "en gen" can also be translated as "with care", depending on the context.]
E guarda te segon la tua forssa que no accida sobre le malaute per la tua operacio delor ni lesio; e perforsa te segon le tieu poder que tu appliques la un os am l’autre son companho segon lors milhors formas.	And take care not to cause further pain or injury to the patient through your operation, and strive to apply the bone to its companion in the best possible way, according to your abilities.
E cove que en aquela hora aprofitablament tu toques am la tua ma aquel, e si vezes aqui alcuna causa diversa, rectifiqua aquel e enguala aquel per la quantitat de la tua vertut.	And it is necessary that you manipulate the affected area with your hand at that time, and if you notice any other reason for concern, correct it and treat it to the best of your abilities.
E exquiva vehement extenssio e compressio, ayssi cum fan mots fols metges que motas veguadas fan accidir apostema caut per la sua operacio, o fan accidir contraccio en le membre ayssi cum havem vist aquo per la operacio de lor motas veguadas.	And avoid violent extension and compression, as foolish doctors often cause abscesses or muscle contractions through their operations, which we have seen many times before in the work of such doctors.[*Note: The phrase "metges folls" can also be translated as "reckless surgeons", depending on the context.]
E aprop annecteys, aprop equacio e decent operacio e strictura de aquel membre, e repaus e tranquilitat; amoneste le malaute sobre aquo e fay le squivar que no maugua aquel en la hora de las suas vigilias e del sieu dormir, e ves la sua revolucio e agitacio, e deves la sua egestio, e deves totz les sieus movementz am tota la sua vertut; e aguarda se que la posicio del membre sia posicio am la qual sia asegurada la dolor, la qual causa es quar quan sent en la disposicio de la posicio del membre delor o lesio; lahoras cove que permutes aquel ad autra disposicio de aquela am la qual non senta dolor; e guarda am aquo que la posicio de lu aquela sia dreyta e engual, per so que al membre non accida tortuositat quan es restaurat.	And apply annexation, equalization, and proper operation and support of the limb, along with rest and tranquility; advise the patient on these matters and make sure they do not move or manipulate it during their waking hours or sleeping, and pay attention to its movement and agitation. Attend to its elimination, and pay close attention to all of its movements with your full abilities. And wait to see if the position of the limb is causing pain or injury; in that case, it is necessary to change the position to a different one in which there is no pain. Additionally, ensure that the limb is positioned correctly and evenly so that when it heals, it does not become deformed or curved.[*Note: The word "annecteys" can also be translated as "attachment", referring to the use of bandages or other medical devices to support and align the broken bone during healing. The phrase "agitacio" can also be translated as "restlessness", depending on the context.
E la qualitat de la strictura del membre tranquat es aquela que yeu recomti; per que sapias que·ls membres trencatz so diversificatz en lor parvitat e en lor grandeza e en la forma de aquels.	And the quality of support for the limb should be as follows: you must know that broken limbs are varied in their smallness and largeness and shape. [*Note: The word "strictura" can also be translated as "support", referring to the use of bandages or other medical devices to immobilize and align the broken bone during healing. The phrase "parvitat e en lor grandeza" can also be translated as "size and shape", depending on the context.]
E de aquels que son petits ayssi cum le bras e·l dit e·l focil e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras cove que la envolucio sia de drap mol subtil.	And for those that are small, such as arms and fingers, it is necessary to use a wrapping of fine fabric. [*Note: The word "focil" can also be translated as "thumb", depending on the context.]
Mays aquels que so grosses ayssi cum la cuoyssa o la camba, cove que en aquels sia envolucio lada e dura, quar la liadura lada connecteys le membre gran e strenh aquel de tota part am strictura engual, enayssi que en lu no intre macula.	But for those that are large, such as the thigh or leg, it is necessary to use a thick and firm wrapping, for the toughness of the fabric connects the large and strong member in all parts with even support, preventing any debris from entering the wound.
E aprop comensa, aprop la tua evacuacio de equacio, pausar liament convenient ad aquo, sobre le loc de aquela fractura am tres envolucios o quatre segon que·l membre mereys; e strenh la tua ma un petit am le liament. Then apply gentle pressure with your hand on the bandages.[*Note: The word "evacuacio" can also be translated as "wrapping", referring to the use of bandages or other medical devices to immobilize and align the broken bone during healing. The phrase "pausar liament convenient ad aquo" can also be translated as "apply traction evenly", depending on the context.] [*Note: The word "liament" can also be translated as "ligament", depending on the context. However, in this case it is more likely referring to a medical device used for traction and immobilization.
E aprop ve am aquel a la partida pus sobirana del loc de la fractura, e strenh mens que no foc la tua strictura am la qual has strengut le loc de la fractura. [*Note: The phrase "la partida pus sobirana" can also be translated as "the higher end", depending on the context.]
E aprop elongua te am envolucio del loc de la fractura un pauc, e mollifiqua la strictura petit a petit, entro que prenguas del loc sa una gran partida.	And then gradually extend the bandaging over the fracture site and slowly lessen the tension, until you reach the desired length of the limb.
E aprop pren una autra benda e envolveys aquela autra veguada sobre le loc trenquat am envolucio, e aprop ve am las envolucios a la partida pus dejos de la fractura; e sia la tua operacio en la strictura de la envolucio e en mollificacio de aquela segon que havem dit en la envolucio primieyra desus. Your operation should involve applying even tension to the bandages and slowly lessening the pressure as you go.[*Note: The phrase "la partida pus dejos" can also be translated as "the lower end", depending on the context.]

And then place between the layers of bandaging a piece of lamb's wool or fabric that is evenly cut to straighten the curvature of the fracture, if there is any. E aprop pausa sobre lu autra benda, e aprop enguala sobre aquestas envolucios stelhas decentment faytas tantost, si en le loc no es imflacio o apostema caut, e lahoras pausa sobre lu aquo que sede le apostema aquel e que oste la imflacio; e layssa aquela per alcus jorns; e lahoras tu strenh sobre lu las stelhas.	And then place another bandage over it, and apply stars evenly to these layers of bandaging that have been properly made, but only if there is no swelling or abscess present in the area. If there is an abscess or swelling, then leave it alone for several days before applying the stars. Then strengthen the stars with your hands.[*Note: The phrase "stelhas decentment faytas" can also be translated as "evenly made stars", depending on the context.][*Note: The word "apostema" can be used in both Latin and French to mean "abscess", depending on the context.][*Note: The word "imflacio" can also be translated as "swelling", depending on the context.][*Note: The phrase "layssa aquela per alcus jorns" can also be translated as "leave it alone for several days", depending on the context.][*Note: The phrase "strenh sobre lu las stelhas" can also be translated as "strengthen the stars with your hands", depending on the context.
E sian las stelhas de la maytat de canna lada raza, e be formada saviament; o sian de fust de pi; o de ramps de palma ; e sia le ample de quascuna stelha segon aquesta forma e aquesta figura:	And let the stars be made of cane with thin strips or from the wood of pine trees or from palm leaves, and let each star be formed wisely in this manner and shape:[*Note: The phrase "be formada saviament" can also be translated as "wisely formed", depending on the context.][*Note: The word "canna" can also be translated as "reed" or "bamboo", depending on the context.][*Note: The word "fust" can also be translated as "stick" or "branch", depending on the context.][*Note: The phrase "ample de quascuna stelha" can also be translated as "the width of each star", depending on the context.
Empero cove que la astelha que es pausada sobre aquela fractura sia pus grossa e pus lada un petit que las autras astelhas, e la longitut de la stela segon qu’es legut al membre en magnitut e parvitat; e aprop strenh sobre las astelhas am autra benda segon la tua primieyra strictura; e aprop lia desus am fiel decentment segon que havem dit de strictura, e es que sia la tua strictura segon le loc de la fractura mes, e quant mes es alonguat de la fractura, es mendre la strictura.	However, it is necessary that the star placed over the fracture be larger and wider than the other stars by a small degree, and the length of the star should be according to the size of the limb. E cove que les fils sian migiers en grossesa e subtilitat, e sian de li mol; e si les fils so grosses, ayssi cum yeu he vist per la operacio de alcus fols pausantz les lors fils de cordas de li tort, e es error gran, quan catz la strictura fora equalitat.	And it is necessary that the strings be medium in thickness and fine, and made of linen; and if the strings are thick, as I have seen some foolish doctors use cords made of twisted fibers, this is a great error, for it can lead to uneven tension and hinder the healing process. And also fine strings are not suitable, for they will not provide the tension that is desired, and it is not necessary for there to be a space of more than one finger's width between each star. [*Note: The phrase "subtils no so convenientz" can also be translated as "fine ones are not appropriate", depending on the context.][*Note: The phrase "entre astela e astela haja" can also be translated as "between each star there is", depending on the context.][*Note: The word "dita" can also be translated as "fingers", depending on the context.

And if the patient is harmed by the ends of the stars near the tightening at their locations, then place a piece of wool or red wool under them to prevent injury.[*Note: The phrase "de leon" can also be translated as "of lion", depending on the context. Alcunas veguadas fractura es am plagua, e accideys disrupcio en la codena, e yeu vindre am rememoracio en aquela en le capitol segon singularitat.	Sometimes a fracture occurs with contusion, leading to disruption of the tendon. E sapias que ges tot membre trencat no es streyt am stelhas al primier dia; la qual causa es quar le membre, quan es gran, no cove que pauses sobre lu stelhas sino aprop v dias o vii o mays, segon la tua seguratat de adveniment de apostema caut.	And know that not all broken limbs can be immobilized with stars on the first day; for if the limb is large, it is not necessary to apply the stars immediately, but rather wait a few days or a week or more, depending on your confidence in preventing abscess formation. [*Note: The phrase "aprop v dias o vii" can also be translated as "a few days or a week", depending on the context.][*Note: The word "seguratat" can also be translated as "confidence", depending on the context.][*Note: The word "adveniment" can also be translated as "occurrence", depending on the context.
E aquesta es la manieyra dels emplaustres am les quals les Antics restauravan, les quals so pausatz sobre fractura e dislocacio e torcio.	And this is the method of applying plasters, which ancient doctors used to restore bones that were broken, dislocated, or twisted.
Manieyra de emplaustra comu abruejat de restaurament de fractura, convenient a motas compleccios e majorment a las femnas e als efantz, quar es de aquo sobre le qual no ventz calor ni freg: e es que prenguas de polvera de moli, e es la medula de la farina que pen deves le movement de la mola en las paretz del moli.	Here is a method for applying a plaster that can be used to treat fractures, and it is particularly suitable for many complex cases, especially those involving women and children, as it does not produce heat or friction. To make this plaster, take some powdered flour from the grinding stone in the mill, which is made from the inner part of the grain after it has been ground between the walls of the mill.
E comfeys aquel ayssi cum es, sino que cribelles aquel am album de huou, e pausa la comfeccio de lu no-spessa ni subtil; e aprop usa de aquela.	And sieve the flour through egg white, and apply the mixture in a thick but not too fine layer, and then use it as needed.[*Note: The word "comfeys" can also be translated as "prepare", depending on the context.][*Note: The phrase "cribelles aquel am album de huou" can also be translated as "sift the flour with egg white", depending on the context.][*Note: The word "album" can also be translated as "egg white", depending on the context.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre restaurant fractura e dislocacio e torcio: recipe de assafetida, de lapdanum, de acacia, de enula, e migrach, que es razit de milgraner salvage, de totz ana drac. x; de mirra e aloen ana drac. v; alochil ana drac. xx; totz sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian mesclatz am aygua alichil o am album de huou si la compleccio del malaute es scalfada; e aprop usa de aquest emplaustre, quar es de bona composicio e restaura les osses trencatz leugierament, e confereys a motz homes.	Another way of making an emplaster to heal fractures and dislocations and twists: take assafetida, lapdanum, acacia, enula, migrach (which is wild marjoram), all in the amount of one drachma; myrrh and aloe each in the amount of five drachmas; aloe in the amount of twenty drachmas; grind them and sift them and mix them with almond oil or egg white if the patient's complexion is dry. Then use this emplaster, for it has a good composition and heals lightly fractured bones and benefits many people.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre le qual comfereys a fractura e torcio: recipe migrach e met de altea blanca ana drac. x; de mirra e de aloen ana drac v; de acacia drac. vi; de bol armenic drac. .xx.	Another way of making an emplaster to heal fractures and twists: take migrach, white mallow each in the amount of one drachma; myrrh and aloe each in the amount of five drachmas; acacia six drachmas; Armenian bole twenty drachmas.
Totz sian trissatz en mortier am mota contricio, e sian cribellatz, e sian comfitz am aygua o am album de huou e sia administrat.	Grind all the ingredients together in a mortar with a pestle, then sift them and mix with water or egg white, and then administer it (the plaster) as needed.
Manieyra de emplaustre a juncturas e osses separatz de lors locs, e seda dolor accident en aquels e a fissuras e fractaduras: sia presa lana sutza e sia submersa en vi agre e oli cuyt e sia pausat sobre le loc.	Another way of making a plaster for dislocated joints and bones out of place, to alleviate pain in those areas and heal cracks and fractures: take raw wool, soak it in vinegar and heated oil, then apply it to the affected area.
Mays en aquest emplastre no es vertut de restauracio, de apostema caut e expelleys dolors propriament.	But this plaster does not have the power of healing or drawing out abscesses and properly expelling pains.
Autra manieyra de emplastre que restaura os trancat: pren fuelas de figuier sort e fuelas de papaver salvatge; contereys tot e fay emplastre de lor.	Another way of making a plaster that heals broken bones: take leaves from the wild fig tree and poppy plant, grind them all together and make a plaster out of it.
Manieyra de emplastre abreujat aministrat deves la restauracio de fractura de os e quan tu voles resolucio del romanent de apostema: recipe razitz de altea, de camamilla e flors de violes, de farina de ers, de totz ana partida .i.; sian totz trissatz e sian cofitz am vi, si·l membre no es scalfat.	Another way of making a quick-acting plaster for healing bone fractures and promoting resolution of the remaining abscess: take equal parts of mallow root, chamomile, violet flowers, and barley flour, all ground together in equal proportions. Grind all the ingredients together and mix with wine, if the area is not scaly or inflamed.
Mays si es scalfat, lahoras comfeys aquel am aygua de coliandre humit o am aygua e usa de lu.	But if it is scaly or inflamed, then soothe it with coltsfoot water or plain water and use it as needed.
Autra manieyra de emplastra pus fort en resolucio que aquest primier, quan accideys apostema dur deves la restauracio del membre: recipe de razitz de altea e de semensa de li, e de balaustia, e mellilot, majorana, flors de viol, de camamilla, de totz ana partida i engual; totz sian trissatz e sian cofitz am aygua de sauze o am aygua dousa o am vi, tot aquo segon la qualitat del membre e le repaus de la color de lu.	Another way of making a stronger plaster for abscess healing than the previous one, when you need to heal an abscess and restore the affected limb: take equal parts of mallow root, flax seeds, balmony, melilot, marjoram, violet flowers, chamomile, all ground together and combined with willow water or plain water or wine, depending on the quality of the limb and its color.
Mays Ypocras no diyssec en le sieu libre que sia pausat sobre le membre trenquat deves la restauracio de lu sino cerot fayt de cera e de oli e no autre causa; e recomtec que sia migier entre grossitut e subtilitat.	However, Hippocrates says in his book that a plaster should not be placed on the broken limb for its healing, but rather a cerate made of wax and oil, with no other ingredients; and he advises that it should be of medium consistency, neither too thick nor too thin.
Mays a Gualia es vist que sian pausatz sobre le membre trencat deves la restauracio de lu e las causas en las quals es exsiccacio am petit de caliditat so ayssi cum mirra, enses e semblantz a lor de aquelas causas que havem recomtadas.	But in Galen's work, it is seen that plasters can be placed on the broken limb for its healing and they use dry substances with a little heat, such as myrrh, cautery instruments, and similar items to those mentioned before.
Manieyra de emplastre que comfereys a lesio e dolor: recipe migat, de cezes, de pels de home inscizes o pena de auzel, e de altea, e sal, partidas enguals; sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian cofitz, e sia fayt emplastre.	Another way of making a plaster that helps with injury and pain: take half as much of the following ingredients: goat dung, human shaved hair or bird feathers, mallow root, and salt, all ground and sifted together and made into a plaster.
Mays la quantitat segon la qual cove que romangua la liadura e aprop sia disliada, es que consideres si no es accidit dolor ni pruziment ni le os es trencat no es maugut de son loc, lahoras tu no deslies de motz jorns.	But the amount of time that the plaster should remain applied and then be removed depends on whether pain or swelling occurs, or if the bone is out of place; in such cases, you should not remove it for many days.
E si accideys al loc dolor vehement o prusiment o imflacio, lahoras tu te coyte o deslie aquel en la hora, e osta le emplastre de lu.	And if pain or swelling occurs at the affected area, then you should consider removing the plaster immediately and applying a new one.
E pren drap de li e spongia marina leon humida, e submergeys aquela en aygua tebeza, e am aquela lava le loc entro que cesse aquel pruziment e la dolor sia sedada; e aprop layssa repausar le membre per una hora; e aprop pausa sobre lu lana sutza submersa en vi agre e oli o oli rozat, e lia sobre lu per una nuoyt entro que sias segur de apostema caut, e que repause la imflacio del membre, e sia remauguda la dolor de lu.	And take a piece of linen and a wet sponge, and soak them in warm water, then use those to gently wash the affected area until the swelling subsides and the pain is alleviated; then let the limb rest for an hour; and afterwards place on it a wool compress soaked in vinegar and oil or rose oil, and leave it on for a night, until you are certain that pus has been drawn out, and the swelling of the limb has decreased, and the pain has subsided.
E aprop itera aquela strictura subtil e emplastre petit e no·l strenhas per la tua constriccio primieyra, e subtilia am aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then repeat the gentle pressure and light application of the plaster, gradually increasing the strength as the injury heals.
E si vezes que le apostema e la rogor e la dolor e la imflacio e tots les accidentz ja so remaugutz de tot, e indigeysses de emplastre e de strictura, lahoras tu itera aquel ayssi cum has fayt al comensant engualment.	And if you see that the abscess and inflammation and pain and all other symptoms have completely subsided, and there is no longer a need for plasters or pressure, then repeat the treatment as before.
E si no accideys al membre alcuna causa de aquelas que havem ditas, lahoras no deslies aquel sino aprop tres dias o quatre o v o .vii.; e alcunas veguadas tot aquo es layssat per xx dias segon que a tu appar per la desliadura del membre, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que la fractura adhereys, e se acosta a la coagulacio de la carn sobre aquel.	And if none of the symptoms mentioned occur in the limb, then you should remove the plaster after three or four or five or seven days. And sometimes everything is left in place for 20 days, as you see fit based on the removal of the plaster, until the bone heals and the flesh begins to form over it.
E lahoras ajusta en la strictura mays que en la tua strictura primieyra tota, e ayusta en la engrossacio de la vianda del malaute, segon que es precedida la rememoracio de lu.	Then increase the pressure gradually, rather than immediately as before, and adjust it based on the patient's nutritional status and overall health condition.
Mays si tu vezes le loc de la fractura ja desiccar e extenuar mays que no cove, lahoras sapias que·l nutriment es prohibit pervenir ad aquel; e donc embroca aquel am aygua tebeza deves tota veguada que delias aquel; e sia aquo en totz tres dias; e alleuja la strictura un petit, e per aquesta operacio corr al membre le nutriment, e es sanat leugierament.	But if you see that the site of the fracture is drying out and becoming weakened more than necessary, then you should know that nutrition is not able to reach it; and so, immerse it in warm water every time you change the dressing, for three days; and slightly decrease the pressure, and through this procedure allow the limb to receive nourishment, and thus heal quickly.
Mays aquo que fan les fols restauradors de la fractura del membre autra veguada quan no es restaurat al comensament, segon que cove, e es restaurat segon tortuositat, es error segon la operacio de lor, e temor gran, e si fos dreyturier aquo agrandit les Antics en lors libres e agueran am aquo obrat.	But sometimes foolish healers of bone fractures, when the healing does not begin properly, try to restore it in a twisted or crooked way, which is a mistake according to proper medical practice and causes great fear; if they were correct, then ancient physicians would have recorded this method in their books.
E yeu no he vist ad alcu de lor aquo far, per que es pus razonable que aquo no fassa.	And I have never seen such a thing done by any of them, so it is more reasonable not to do it.
Capitol segon: De fractura quan accideys en le cap.	Chapter Two: On Fractures in the Head.
Las specias de fracturas son motas, e las figuras de lor son diversas, e las causas son distinctas, quar de fracturas alcuna es fayta per percussio de spaza, e la percussio osta tot le os entro al ciphac, le qual es dejos le os, ayssi cum fay ayssa en le fust, e per aquo aquesta specia es nompnada ascial; o la spaza inscideys alcuna partida del os, e inscideys la carn de lu e no passa la inscizio entro al derier de lu; e aquesta specia de fractura es nompnada levatio absoluta.	Chapter Two: On Fractures of the Head
E la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca, e de fractura que es contricio o atricio; e causa de lu es percussio am poyra o cazement sobre peyra, e a lor semblantz.	And the extent of these two types of fractures can be large or small, and may involve crushing or scraping; the cause of such injuries is typically blunt force trauma from falling onto rocks or other hard surfaces.
E aquesta fractura o es penetrant que ja apropinqua al pannicol le qual es dejos le os; o es en la facia del os, e la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca.	This type of fracture may be penetrating, reaching the periosteum (the layer of tissue covering the bone), or it may occur on the surface of the skull bone; and the extent of these two types of fractures can be large or small.
E de fractura es que es ameguada en le os, en la subtilitat del cabel petita, e per aquo es nompnada aquesta specia fractura capillar.	Another type of fracture is one that occurs in the thin layer of bone beneath the hair, and for this reason, it is called "capillary" fracture.
E es fractura que es fayta o per cazement o per percussio de peyra e a lu semblantz, que fa intrar alcuna lamina del os a las partidas dedintz, e es fayta en le loc concavitat ayssi cum accideys als payroles de eram quan accideys a lor percussio e es partida de lor intrada a las partidas dedintz.	Another type of fracture is one caused by impact or force, which causes a thin layer of bone to be pushed into the interior of the skull, similar to what happens when tiles are struck and break apart; this type of fracture occurs in concave areas, such as those found in the parietal bones.
E majorment es fayt aquo en les cors de osses humitz, ayssi cum so caps de efantz.	This type of fracture is most commonly found in the skulls of infants or in any areas where the bone is more flexible and pliable, such as the forehead.[ ](https://hippomedicina.com/blog/item/la-medicina-en-la-edat-media/)
E so a totas aquestas specias fracturas satagias, so son pessas ayssi cum stelhas separadas.	And all these types of fractures are classified as "satagias," which means they have separate fragments or pieces that have become detached from one another.
E yeu vindre am reremoracio de tot aquo en son loc.	I will provide a summary and review of all the topics discussed in their proper places.
E conoyssem totas aquestas specias de fractura per deteccio sobre aquelas e per inquisicio de lor am tentas e ostament de carn corrumpuda que es sobre lor.	And these types of fractures can be identified by examination and investigation, including probing for loose fragments and examining for signs of infected or necrotic tissue surrounding the wound.
E specia capillar es conoguda per aysso que es descubert sobre le os, e es abstergit, e linit sobre lu am tentha, quar la fractura appar negra.	A capillary fracture can be identified by the appearance of discoloration or bruising on the surface of the skull bone, and when probed with a blunt instrument, it will feel like a crack rather than a break through the entire thickness of the bone.[ ](https://hippomedicina.com/blog/item/la-medicina-en-la-edat-media/)
Mays en la curacio de fractura considera al comensament les accidentz del malaute, e lahoras si tu vezes per los accidentz que signifique per significacio manifesta sobre paor, ayssi cum es vomit de colera, e extencio, e perdement de entendament, e abscizio de votz, e sincopi, e febre acuta, e eyssiment dels huels e rogor de aquels, e semblantz a lor dels accidentz en las majors disposicios, ses dopte no es sanat.	When treating a fracture, it is important to first consider the overall health and condition of the patient, and if there are any signs or symptoms that suggest a serious complication, such as vomiting due to cholera, extensive swelling, loss of consciousness, change in voice, fainting, high fever, swollen hands or feet, severe pain, or other concerning symptoms. If present, treatment should be delayed until the patient's condition has stabilized and there is no further risk to their health.[ ](https://hippomedicina.com/blog/item/la-medicina-en-la-edat-media/)
E si vezes accidentz no-correntz tu speras salut, lahoras tu comensa la curacio de lu.	If there are no concerning symptoms or complications, then treatment can begin.
La qual causa es quar si es vengut a tu le plaguat en le comensament cum es plaguat e aquo es en les dias de ivern, lahoras cove que tu studias en le ostament del os denant le dia xiiii segon tota disposicio.	The reason for this is that if the injury occurs in the winter and the wound appears severe, it is important to wait at least 14 days before beginning treatment, as this will allow any swelling or inflammation to subside, making it easier to accurately assess the extent of the damage and plan an effective course of treatment. [ ](https://hippomedicina.com/blog/item/la-medicina-en-la-edat-media/)
E si es en les dias d’estiu, lahoras cove que te coytes ostar le os denant le vii dia, habantz que aquo que es dejos le os sia corromput del pannicol, e que accidescan les accidentz que havem recomtatz.	However, if the injury occurs during the summer months, it is important to begin treatment within 7 days, as any damage to the tissue beneath the skull may begin to decompose and become infected, leading to serious complications and health risks.
E si la fractura ja es pervenguda al pannicol cubrent le cervel, e es am partidas menudas e atricio, lahoras cove que inscidas la partida conminuta e atrita, segon que yeu recomtare a tu.	If the fracture has reached the layer of tissue covering the brain and is made up of small fragments or has become crushed, then it is necessary to surgically remove any loose pieces of bone, as recommended by me.[ ](https://hippomedicina.com/blog/item/la-medicina-en-la-edat-media/)
E es que tu razas le cap del malaute plaguat, e descuebres sobre le os segon costuma e manieyra a tu possible segon la figura de la plagua, e que sia leugier sobre le malaute.	When treating a fractured skull, it is important to first carefully examine the wound and remove any damaged tissue or debris that may be present on the surface of the bone. This can be done using standard surgical techniques, taking care to avoid causing further injury or damage to the surrounding tissues. Once the wound has been cleaned and prepared for treatment, the next step is to assess the extent of the fracture and develop a plan for repair. [ ](https://hippomedicina.com/blog/item/la-medicina-en-la-edat-media/) [ ](https://hippomedicina.com/blog/item/la-medicina-en-la-edat-media/)
E si accideys a tu deves la deteccio del os, fluxs de sanc o apostema caut, lahora tu te oppausa a lu am aquo que cove, e es que huemplas le loc de draps infuzes en vi e oli rozat, e fassa repausar la plagua entro que sia sedat le apostema, e sies segur de fluxs del sanc; e aprop comensa en la circuicio del os e en la ablatio de lu.	If during the examination of the wound, you discover signs of bone damage, such as swelling or pus, it is important to take action to address these issues before proceeding with treatment. This can be done by applying warm compresses soaked in vinegar and rose oil to the affected area, allowing the swelling and inflammation to subside, and ensuring that any bleeding has stopped. Once this has been accomplished, you can begin the surgical repair of the fracture, carefully removing damaged tissue and realigning the bones as needed. [ ](https://hippomedicina.com/blog/item/la-medicina-en-la-edat-media/) [ ](https://hippomedicina.com/blog/item/la-medicina-en-la-edat-media/)[ ](https://hippomedicina.com/blog/item/la-medicina-en-la-edat-media/)
E aquo sia segon una de dos manieyras de operacio.	There are two main approaches to surgical treatment of skull fractures: open reduction and internal fixation (ORIF), or closed reduction and external fixation (CREF).
